analyzed: hema śṛṃga khura upetau na saṃspṛśau

analyzed: bhavet

analyzed: agram sūci nibha ākāram anupūrvāt kṛśam bhavet
translated: The tip should be shaped like a needle, and it should gradually become thinner.

analyzed: tri paṃca mātram iti uktam sīra ghrāṇa agraka antakam
translated: It is said to be three and a half finger-breadths long, and the tip of the plough's nose should be attractive.

analyzed: hṛdayam maṃtram uccārya badhvā yuga āśrayau vṛṣau
translated: Having uttered the mantra of the heart, and having tied the two triangular yokes,

analyzed: yuga madhye halam badhvā kiṃcid dakṣiṇam āśritam  /
translated: Having tied the plough in the middle of the yoke, slightly leaning towards the south,

analyzed: karṣayet matimān vipraḥ tṛṇa ādīni vyapohya ca
translated: the wise brahmin should plough, removing grass etc.

translated: Thus, the Nalina-kanta (lotus-beloved) form is pleasing to all gods.

original: trayoviṃśati bhāgaṃ tu taloccaṃ tu vibhājite // //🔽sārdhāṃśaṃ pādukotsedhaṃ upopānaṃ śivāṃśakam /
analyzed: trayoviṃśati bhāgam tu tala uccam tu vibhājite  / sārdha aṃśam pādukā utsedham upopānam śiva aṃśakam
translated: The height of the base should be divided into twenty-three parts.🔽The height of the paduka (pedestal) should be one and a half parts, the upapada (lower part of the pedestal) should be one part,

original: adhaḥ padmaṃ dvibhāgaṃ syāt ekāṃśaṃ kaṇṭhamucyate // //🔽tadūrdhve padmamekāṃśaṃ kumudoccaṃ guṇāṃśakam /
analyzed: adhas padmam dvi bhāgam syāt eka aṃśam kaṇṭham ucyate  tad ūrdhve padmam eka aṃśam kumuda uccam guṇa aṃśakam
translated: and the lotus below should be two parts. The neck is said to be one part.🔽Above that, the lotus is one part, and the height of the kumuda (flower) is five parts.

analyzed: tad ūrdhve padmam eka aṃśam eka aṃśam kampamānakam
translated: Above that, the lotus is one part, and the kampamana (trembling) is one part.

original: kaṇṭhaṃ dvyaṃśena kartavyaṃ ekāṃśaṃ cordhvapaṭṭikā /🔽ekāṃśaṃ padmatuṃgaṃ tu sārdhāṃśaṃ vājanodayam // //
analyzed: kaṇṭham dvi aṃśena kartavyam eka aṃśam ca ūrdhva paṭṭikā  eka aṃśam padma tuṃgam tu sārdha aṃśam vājana udayam
translated: The neck should be made with two parts, and the upper pattika (band) with one part.🔽The height of the lotus is one part, and the rise of the vajana (ornament) is one and a half parts.

analyzed: eka aṃśam padma tuṃgam tu āliṃgam ca eka bhāgayā
translated: The height of the lotus is one part, and the aalinga (embrace) is with one part.

analyzed: tri paṭṭam tu tathā aṃśena pratimānam dvi bhāgayā
translated: The tripatta (three-leaf ornament) is with one part, and the pratima (image) is with two parts.

original: p / ekena vājanaṃ kuryāt śrīsaundaryaṃ samucyate /
analyzed: ekena vājanam kuryāt śrī saundaryam samucyate
translated: The vajana (ornament) should be made with one part. This is said to be the Shri-Saundarya (Beautiful Wealth).

analyzed: pratibandhasya bhedam syāt puratas tathā
translated: The division of the obstruction should be like this in front.

original: caturviṃśati bhāgaṃ tu taloccaṃ tu vibhājite /
analyzed: caturviṃśati bhāgam tu tala uccam tu vibhājite
translated: When the height of the plinth is divided into twenty-four parts,

analyzed: upānam ca eka bhāgena dvi bhāgena tu dala udayam
translated: the base should be one part, and the height of the petals should be two parts.

original: tadūrdhve kaṃpamekāṃśaṃ jagatyuccaṃ śarāṃśakam /🔽vedāṃśaṃ kumudoccaṃ tu padmamaṃśena kalpayet // //
analyzed: tad ūrdhve kaṃpam eka aṃśam jagatī uccam śara aṃśakam  veda aṃśam kumuda uccam tu padmam aṃśena kalpayet  /
translated: Above that, the height of the dome is one part, and the height of the world is five parts.🔽The height of the kumuda (lotus) is four parts, and the lotus should be made with one part.

analyzed: kaṇṭham eka aṃśam iti uktam ūrdhva padmam śiva aṃśakam
translated: It is said that the neck is one part, and the upper lotus is five parts.
The height of the vājana (capital) is two parts, and the lotus part is one part.

analyzed: āliṃgam eka bhāgena tri paṭṭam tad samam bhavet
translated: The āliṅga (embrace) is one part, and the tripaṭṭa (three-banded) should be of the same size.

analyzed: pratimānam dvi bhāgam syāt vājanam ca eka bhāgayā
translated: The pratimāna (proportion) should be two parts, and the vājana (capital) is one part.

analyzed: skandakāntam idam nāmnā pratibandhasya bhedite
translated: This is known as Skandakānti, when the obstruction is divided.

original: dharātaloccaṃ vibhajet trayoviṃśati bhāgayā // //🔽upānodayamekāṃśaṃ ṣaḍaṃśamambujodayam /🔽ekāṃśaṃ kaṇṭhamānaṃ tu ūrdhvaṃ padmaṃ śivāṃśakam // //
analyzed: dharā tala uccam vibhajet trayoviṃśati bhāgayā  upāna udayam eka aṃśam ṣaṣ aṃśam ambuja udayam  eka aṃśam kaṇṭha mānam tu ūrdhvam padmam śiva aṃśakam
translated: The height of the ground floor should be divided into twenty-three parts.🔽The height of the base is one part, and the height of the lotus is six parts.🔽The measurement of the neck is one part, and the upper lotus is five parts.

analyzed: kuṃbhaka utsedham eka aṃśam padma mānakam
translated: The height of the pot is five parts, and the measurement of the lotus is one part.

original: kampamekena kartavyaṃ dvibhāgaṃ kandharodayam // //🔽ekāṃśaṃ kaṃpamānaṃ tu ūrdhvapadmaṃ ca tatsamam /
analyzed: kampam ekena kartavyam dvi bhāgam kandhara udayam  eka aṃśam kaṃpamānam tu ūrdhva padmam ca tad samam
translated: One part should be made for the trembling, and the height of the neck is two parts.🔽The trembling is one part, and the upper lotus is of the same height.
The height of the dove is five parts, and the embrace is with one part.

analyzed: etat ca ambuja kāntam syāt pāda bandhe tu bheditam
translated: This is the lotus-beloved, divided in the foot-bond.

analyzed: evam tu aneka bhedena procyate tu dharā talam
translated: Thus, the ground level is described with many divisions.

original: p / tathaivoccaikamātraṃ vā hīnādhikaṃ na doṣabhāk /
analyzed: tathā eva ucca eka mātram vā hīna adhikam na doṣa bhāj
translated: Similarly, the height is one measure only, less or more does not cause fault.

original: ardhaṃ vārdha tripādaṃ vā balāṃgada balānvitam // //
analyzed: ardham tri pādam vā bala aṃgada bala anvitam
translated: Half, half, or three-fourths, endowed with strength and limbs.

original: tripaṭṭasya viśālaṃ tu dvividhaṃ pravidhīyate /🔽mūlapādasya māvyāsa pādamūle tripaṭṭikam // //
analyzed: tri paṭṭasya viśālam tu dvividham pravidhīyate  mūlapādasya mā āvyāsa pāda mūle tri paṭṭikam
translated: The width of the triple band is prescribed in two ways.🔽The width of the root foot is the triple band at the foot of the foot.

analyzed: pāda antare tri paṭṭānām vyāsam tri pādam ardhakam
translated: The width of the triple bands between the feet is three and a half parts.

analyzed: pāda bāhya samāveśam nīvram ca eva samam bhavet
translated: The outer inclusion of the foot and the base should be equal.

original: yugmā va yuga saṃkhyā vā pādāntareṣu kalpayet /
analyzed: yugmā va yuga saṃkhyā vā pāda antareṣu kalpayet
translated: One should make even or odd numbers between the feet.

analyzed: siṃha ibha makaraiḥ vyālaiḥ bhūta haṃsaiḥ vibhūṣitam
translated: Adorned with lions, elephants, crocodiles, and ghosts, and with swans.

analyzed: pratyagra makaraiḥ vyālaiḥ pāda ādhārasya nirgamam
translated: The emergence of the foot base with fresh crocodiles and beasts.

analyzed: tri paṭṭa ūrdhve pratim hema sarvatra parikalpayet
translated: Above the three bands, one should always imagine a golden image.

analyzed: ūrdhva adhas tambuja upetam kumudam vṛttam ācaret
translated: One should make a lotus with a stem above and below, and a circular kumuda.

analyzed: anye dve kusumāḥ sarve pratibandha aṃghri bandhayet  /
translated: The other two are all flowers. One should bind the feet with a band.

original: vṛttaṃ ca vasukoṇaṃ ca krameṇaiva tu kalpayet /
analyzed: vṛttam ca vasu koṇam ca krameṇa eva tu kalpayet
translated: One should make a circle and a square in order.

analyzed: iti aṃśumānkāśyape adhiṣṭhāna lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter on the characteristics of the plinth in the Kashyapa Sastra.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa nirmālya dvāra lakṣaṇam
translated: Now I shall explain the characteristics of the door of the discarded offerings in particular.

analyzed: pratibandhe praterante tad anye paṭṭikā antike
translated: When the band is extended, the others are near the band.

original: p / galānte kumudānte vā va prānte pādukāntake /
analyzed: gala ante kumuda ante vā va prānte pādukā antake
translated: At the end of the plinth, at the end of the lotus, or at the end of the footstool,

analyzed: nālam kuryāt adhas ca ūrdhve nālam tasmin su yojayet
translated: one should make a stem below and above. One should well join the stem to it.

analyzed: bhānu aṃgulam samārabhya tri tri aṃgula vivardhanāt
translated: Beginning with a span of the sun, increasing by three spans,

analyzed: caturviṃśa aṃgulam yāvat tāvat paṃcavidhāya tam
translated: up to twenty-four spans, one should make it five types.

analyzed: bhitti bāhya gatam hi etat tasya ardham garbhagehakam
translated: This is located outside the wall. Half of it is the inner sanctum.

original: veśayitvātha vā bhitteḥ abhyantarasamaṃ tu vā // //
analyzed: veśayitvā atha vā bhitteḥ abhyantara samam tu vā
translated: Having placed it, or equal to the inside of the wall,

analyzed: vasu aṃgulam samārabhya dvi dvayaṃgula vivardhanāt
translated: beginning with a span of the sun, increasing by two spans,

original: kalāṃgulāvasānaṃ tu vistāraṃ paṃcadhā kramāt // //🔽tanmūlatārapaṃcāṃśaṃ tryaṃśaṃ cāgrasuvistaram /🔽tadvistarasamaṃ vyāsaṃ tripādaṃ vārdhatadghanam // //
analyzed: kalā aṃgula avasānam tu vistāram paṃcadhā kramāt  tad mūla tāra paṃca aṃśam tri aṃśam ca agra su vistaram  tad vistara samam vyāsam tri pādam vā ardha tad ghanam
translated: The width should be divided into five parts, ending with one kala and one angula, in order.🔽One-fifth of that should be the width at the base, and one-third the width at the tip.🔽The diameter should be equal to the width, with three-fourths or half the thickness.

original: vistārasya tribhāgaika uccatāraṃ nataṃ tathā /🔽nālamadhye tu kartavyaṃ nimnonnatavivarjitam // //
analyzed: vistārasya tri bhāga ekaḥ ucca tāram natam tathā  nāla madhye tu kartavyam nimna unnata vivarjitam
translated: One-third of the width should be the height of the spire, and it should slope accordingly.🔽The middle of the shaft should be made without any depressions or elevations.

original: mūlādagraṃ nataṃ kiṃcit mūlaṃ siṃhasya bandhitam /
analyzed: mūlāt agram natam kiṃcid mūlam siṃhasya bandhitam
translated: From the base to the tip, it should slope slightly, with the base bound like a lion's.

analyzed: gaja uṣṭha sadṛśā ālambya yathā sundaram agratas
translated: It should be supported like an elephant's lip, looking beautiful in front.

analyzed: vyāla ibha siṃha bhūtam vā nālam dhṛtvā āsana sthitaḥ
translated: Holding the shaft, which is like a serpent or a lion, seated on the seat,

analyzed: na alam evam prakartavyam saumye   /
translated: the shaft should be made like this, in the east or north, in the middle.

analyzed: sthāpayitvā viśeṣeṇa anena vidhinā budhaḥ
translated: Having installed it according to this procedure, the wise one

analyzed: nālam gandha udakaiḥ gavyaiḥ snāpayitvā ambhasā tatas
translated: should bathe the shaft with fragrant water and cow products, and then with water.

analyzed: śānti homam tu kurvīta vāruṇam sūktam uccaran
translated: He should perform the peace offering, reciting the Varuna hymn.

analyzed: snāpakaḥ su prasanna ātmā su muhūrte su lagnake  /
translated: The bather, with a very happy mind, in an auspicious muhurta and lagna,

original: p / nālaṃ tu sthāpayeddhīmān sthapatiḥ sthāpakānvitaḥ /
analyzed: nālam tu sthāpayet dhīmān sthapatiḥ sthāpaka anvitaḥ
translated: the wise architect, accompanied by the installer, should install the shaft.

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktam sarva ātodya samanvitam  sudhayā gula toyaiḥ ca bandhayet su dṛḍham yathā
translated: It should be adorned with all ornaments and accompanied by all musical instruments.🔽It should be firmly bound with lime, jaggery, and water.

analyzed: su kartavyā na alam tu caraṇādhipam
translated: The female stone should be well-cut, but the male stone should have a long neck.

analyzed: nāla sthāpanam evam tu stambha lakṣaṇam ucyate
translated: The installation of the neck is thus, the characteristics of the pillar are described.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape nālashāpanavidhi paṭalaḥ saptamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventh chapter in the Āṃśumān Kāśyapa on the procedure for installing the neck.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa caraṇa āyāma vistṛtam
translated: Now I will explain in particular the length and width of the foot.

analyzed: ākāram bhūṣaṇam ca eva saṃkṣepāt śṛṇu suvrata
translated: Listen to the shape and ornaments in brief, O one of good vows.

original: staṃbhaṃ ca talipaṃ caiva caraṇaṃ jaṃghameva ca /🔽sthāṇuḥ sthūṇaṃ ca pādaṃ ca paryāya vacanastvime // //
analyzed: staṃbham ca talipam ca eva caraṇam jaṃgham eva ca  sthāṇuḥ sthūṇam ca pādam ca
translated: The pillar, the beam, the foot, and the shank,🔽These are the synonyms for the post, the pillar, and the foot.

analyzed: āpta utsedha aṃśa mānena pāda āyāmam vidhīyate
translated: The length of the foot is prescribed by the measure of the height of the receptacle.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānasya tuṃgasya dviguṇam vā aṃghri tuṃgakam
translated: The height of the foot is twice the height of the base.

analyzed: tasmāt dharā tala uccam tu ṣaṣ aṣṭa aṃśa adhikam tu vā
translated: From that, the height of the ground floor should be either six or eight parts more.
The height of the foot is one part of the eight parts of the row of foot heights.

analyzed: dārupādam tu tatam hi etat kuḍyapādam athā ucyate
translated: This is the stretched foot of wood. Now the foot of the wall is described.

analyzed: tad ardham vā tri bhāga ūna catur bhāga ūnam eva vā
translated: half of that, or one-third less, or one-fourth less.

original: p / kuḍyastambhaviśālaṃ syāt etatsarveṣu dhāmasu /🔽prateruttarasīmāntaṃ anyarāgha / ṣālastaṃbhamucyate // //
analyzed: kuḍya stambha viśālam syāt etat sarveṣu dhāmasu  prateḥ uttara sīmāntam sālastaṃbham ucyate  /
translated: The width of the wall and pillars should be the same in all temples.🔽The space from the threshold to the northern boundary is said to be the pillar space.

analyzed: upānāt uttara antam yat nikhāta staṃbham ucyate
translated: The space from the threshold to the end is said to be the buried pillar space.

analyzed: tuṃgam sapta aṣṭadhā bhajya nava dharma aṃśam eva vā
translated: The height should be divided into seven or eight parts, or into nine parts.
Having divided by the Rudra or Bhanu parts, one part should be the width of the foot.

analyzed: tad mūla tāram ākhyātam tat tāram tu tathā bhajet
translated: That is said to be the height of the base, and that height should be divided in the same way.

analyzed: eka bhāga vihīnam tu śeṣam agra viśālakam
translated: The remaining part, less by one part, is the width of the top.

analyzed: eka ādi ṣoḍaśā antānām talam prati evam ācaret
translated: This should be done for the floors ending with one to sixteen.

analyzed: mūlāt agram tu kuṃbha mṛṇḍī ādi saṃyutam
translated: From the base to the top, it should be quadrangular, with a pot-shaped top, etc.

analyzed: brahmakāntam iti khyātam vasvaśram viṣṇukāntakam
translated: It is known as Brahma-kanta, the favorite of Brahma. The triangular one is Vishnu-kanta, the favorite of Vishnu.

original: rasāśramindrakāntaṃ syāt candrakāntaṃ kalāśrakam /🔽kaṇṭhamānena tanmūle vedāśraṃ tu prakalpayet // //
analyzed: rasāśram indrakāntam syāt candrakāntam kalāśrakam  kaṇṭha mānena tad mūle vedāśram tu prakalpayet
translated: The circular one is Indra-kanta, the favorite of Indra. The crescent-shaped one is Chandra-kanta, the favorite of the moon.🔽At its base, one should construct a square shape with the neck measurement.

analyzed: staṃbha agram ca eka mānena caturaśra samanvitam
translated: The top of the pillar should have a square shape with one measurement.

original: tayormadhyaṃ tu vasvaśraṃ ṣoḍaśāśramathāpi vā // //🔽vṛttākāraṃ tu vā vipra / kuṃbhamaṃḍyādi saṃyutam /🔽rudrakāntamidaṃ khyātaṃ mūlādagraṃ tu vartulam // //
analyzed: tayoḥ madhyam tu vasvaśram ṣoḍaśāśram atha api vā  vṛtta ākāram tu vā vipra kuṃbha maṃḍī ādi saṃyutam  rudrakāntam idam khyātam mūlāt agram tu vartulam
translated: The space between them should be a square of sixteen parts, or an octagon.🔽O Brahmin, it may be circular in shape, endowed with a dome-like top.🔽This is known as Rudrakanta, with a circular top from the base.

original: kuṃbhamaṃḍyādihīnaṃ yat tadvyāpī rudrakāntakam /🔽mūlādagraṃ yugāśraṃ tu madhyeṣṭāśraṃ taducyate // //
analyzed: kuṃbha maṃḍī ādi hīnam yat tat vyāpī rudraka antakam  mūlāt agram yugāśram tu madhyeṣṭāśram tat ucyate
translated: That which is devoid of a dome-like top is all-pervading Rudrakanta.🔽The base to the top is a square, and the middle is said to be an octagon.

analyzed: catur aśram adhobhāge aṣṭa aśram madhyamam tathā
translated: The lower part is a square, and the middle part is an octagon.

analyzed: tad ūrdhve vṛttam evam syāt tri bhāgam tuṅga sādṛśam
translated: Above that, it should be circular, with a height equal to one-third.

original: p / śivacchandamidaṃ khyātaṃ śivaharmye praśaṃsitam /🔽daṇḍaṃ sārdhadvidaṇḍaṃ vā mūle padmāsanodayam // //
analyzed: śivacchandam idam khyātam śiva harmye praśaṃsitam  daṇḍam sārdha dvi daṇḍam vā mūle padmāsana udayam
translated: This is known as Shiva's will, praised in Shiva's temple.🔽The base should be one and a half times the height, with a lotus seat rising.

original: dviguṇaṃ tasya vistāraṃ padmākāraṃ tu kārayet /
analyzed: dviguṇam tasya vistāram padma ākāram tu kārayet
translated: The lotus shape should be made twice the width.

analyzed: sa padmam karṇikāyām tu caraṇa sthāpanam kuru
translated: With the lotus, place the feet in the pericarp.

analyzed: yathā iṣṭa ākṛti saṃyuktam kuṃbha maṇḍī ādi saṃyutam  cakravāka latā ādyaiḥ tu bhūṣitam padma pādakam
translated: Endowed with a desired shape, with a dome-like top,🔽adorned with chakravaka vines, with lotus feet.

analyzed: tu vyālena vyālapādakam
translated: With the lotus foot at the base, the serpent foot is with a serpent.

original: mūlebhaṃ tatpramāṇena gajapādamudāhṛtam // //🔽mūle siṃhādibhiryuktaṃ yatheṣṭākṛti saṃyutam /
analyzed: mūlebham tad pramāṇena gajapādam udāhṛtam  mūle siṃha ādibhiḥ yuktam yathā iṣṭa ākṛti saṃyutam
translated: The base is of the same measure, and the foot is said to be like an elephant's foot.🔽Endowed with a lion and other features at the base, having a desired shape,

original: kuṃbhamaṃḍyādisaṃyuktaṃ tattanāmnā prakīrtitam // //🔽vṛttākāre tadāyāme śuṇḍupādaiḥ samanvitam /🔽kuṃbhamaṃḍyādisaṃyuktaṃ śuṇḍupādamudāhṛtam // //
analyzed: kuṃbha maṃḍī ādi saṃyuktam tad tad nāmnā prakīrtitam  vṛtta ākāre tad āyāme śuṇḍu pādaiḥ samanvitam  kuṃbha maṃḍī ādi saṃyuktam śuṇḍu pādam udāhṛtam
translated: Endowed with a pot-shaped top, it is proclaimed by that name.🔽When the length is circular in shape, it is endowed with trunk-like feet,🔽Endowed with a pot-shaped top, it is said to have trunk-like feet.

analyzed: muktā dāmaiḥ alam kṛtya piṇḍipādam udāhṛtam
translated: Adorned with garlands of pearls, it is said to have a globular foot.

analyzed: viṣkaṃbha karṇa mānena staṃbha agre caturaśrakam  tad ardha su ardha daṇḍena tu abjam aṣṭa asra saṃyutam
translated: The top of the pillar should be square at the height of the pillar.🔽With half the height and half the width, it should have an eight-sided lotus.

analyzed: daṇḍa mānena tasya adhas vasu aśram parikalpayet
translated: Below that, with the width of the pillar, one should imagine a six-sided figure.

analyzed: tad adhas pūrvavat padmam tasya adhas daṇḍa mānataḥ
translated: Below that, the lotus is as before. Below that, with the width of the pillar,

original: caturaśra samāyuktaṃ tasyādhastāttu pūrvavat // //🔽mūle tu śeṣaṃ vedāśraṃ citraṃ vātha taducyate /🔽tanmadhye paṭṭaṃ vasvaśraṃ śrīkaṇṭhaṃ tadudāhṛtam // //
analyzed: caturaśra samāyuktam tasya adhastāt tu pūrvavat  mūle tu śeṣam vedāśram citram vā atha tat ucyate  tad madhye paṭṭam vasvaśram śrīkaṇṭham tat udāhṛtam
translated: It is endowed with a square shape. Below that, it is as before.🔽The remaining part at the base is a Vedic altar, or it is said to be variegated.🔽In the middle of that, a six-sided strip is called Śrīkaṇṭha.

analyzed: ced śrīvaktram staṃbham ucyate
translated: If the middle strip is a six-sided altar, the pillar is said to have a beautiful face.

analyzed: syāt tri paṭṭam kṣepaṇa anvitam
translated: From the base to the top, it should be yuga-shaped, with three bands and projections.

analyzed: kṣepaṇa staṃbham ākhyātam paṭṭam patra ādi śobhitam
translated: The projection pillar is said to have bands adorned with leaves and such.

analyzed: staṃbha tāra tri bhāga ekam catur bhāga ekam eva vā
translated: One-third or one-fourth of the pillar's height,

analyzed: staṃbha madhye śivām kuryāt ūrdhva adhastāt viśeṣataḥ
translated: one should make a Shiva in the middle of the pillar, above and below in particular.

analyzed: staṃbha mūle tu padma ādīn staṃbha mānena kalpayet  /
translated: At the base of the pillar, one should make lotuses and such, according to the size of the pillar.

analyzed: staṃbha lakṣaṇam ākhyātam bodhikā lakṣaṇam śṛṇu
translated: The characteristics of the pillar have been explained. Listen to the characteristics of the Bodhi tree.

analyzed: iti aṃśumānkāśyape staṃbha lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ aṣṭamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter on the characteristics of the pillar in the Kashyapa Sutra of Amshuman.

original: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa bodhikālakṣaṇaṃ param /🔽mūlapādasamavyāsaṃ śreṣṭhamadhyena madhyamam // //
analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa bodhikā lakṣaṇam param  mūla pāda sama vyāsam śreṣṭha madhyena madhyamam
translated: Now I shall explain in particular the supreme characteristics of the Bodhi tree.

analyzed: agra pāda viśālena samam kanyasa bodhikāḥ
translated: The best, medium, and lowest Bodhi trees should have a base and foot equal in width, with the best being medium in height.

analyzed: vistāra sadṛśa utsedham paṃca daṇḍa āyata anvitam  uttamā bodhikā khyātā tāra dvi tri aṃśam unnatam
translated: The best Bodhi trees should have a width equal to the height, and be five cubits long.🔽The best Bodhi trees are known to be five cubits high, with a width of two or three parts.

analyzed: madhyamā sā prakīrtitā
translated: The medium Bodhi trees are proclaimed to be four cubits long, with a height equal to half the width.

analyzed: vistārasya ardha tuṃgam tu tat tri daṇḍa āyata anvitā
translated: They should be three cubits long.

analyzed: kanyasā bodhikā khyātā tu aṃghrīyaḥ bodhikā anvitā
translated: The smallest one is known as Bodhika, and the one with the ankle is endowed with Bodhika.
In the upper part of the Bodhika, one should make a strip one-fourth of the height.

analyzed: madhyemaṃśe taraṃgasyāḥ latā ādyaiḥ bhūṣitam tu vā
translated: In the middle part, the wave should be decorated with creepers and other ornaments.

analyzed: tad adhas tu eka bhāgena kukṣibandham tu kārayet
translated: Below that, one should make a waist-band one part thick.

original: daṇḍaṃ tripādamardhaṃ vā chāyāmānaṃ ca dagrayoḥ // //
analyzed: daṇḍam tri pādam ardham vā chāyā mānam ca
translated: The staff should be three-fourths or half the height, and the shadow should be equal to the height.
Below the upper strip, one should arrange the shadow-like decoration.

analyzed: adhastāt bodhika aṃśena alaṃkāram vadāmi aham
translated: Below that, with the Bodhika part, I shall describe the ornaments.

analyzed: madhya paṭṭa tri bhāga ekam vistāra ardham atha api vā
translated: One-third of the middle strip, or half the width,

analyzed: pārśvayoḥ ubhayoḥ śeṣam taraṃga sthānam ucyate  /
translated: the remaining space on both sides is said to be the place for waves.

analyzed: sa kṣudra kṣepaṇam madhya paṭṭam patraiḥ alaṃkṛtam
translated: The middle strip should be decorated with leaves, with small projections.

analyzed: pārśvayoḥ tu taraṃgaḥ syāt samāḥ ca anyonya hīnakam
translated: The waves should be on the sides, equal and slightly tapering.

analyzed: bodhikā vistara ardham vā tri pādam vā agra nīvrakam
translated: Half the width of the Bodhika, or three-fourths, with a rounded top,

analyzed: tad nivra sadṛśam vyāsam saṃbhoja kāra kalpitam
translated: the width should be like that, arranged by the maker of the Sambhoga.

analyzed: tad utsedham ṣaṣ aṃśam tu kṛtvā ūrdhvam paṭṭikā aṃśakam
translated: Dividing the height into six parts, one part should be made into an upper strip,

analyzed: ūrdhva padmam atha aṃśena karṇam ardhena kārayet  /
translated: Then the upper lotus should be made with one part, and the ear with half a part.

original: adhaḥ padmaṃ dvibhāgena adhaḥ paṭṭyaṃśamucyate /🔽adhaḥsthāmbujamardhāṃśaṃ kalpayettu krameṇa tu // //
analyzed: adhas padmam dvi bhāgena adhas paṭṭyaṃśam ucyate  adhas stha ambujam ardha aṃśam kalpayet tu krameṇa tu
translated: The lower lotus is said to be two parts, and the lower band is said to be one part.🔽The lower lotus should be made with half a part, in order.

original: padmasya mukulākāraṃ agrādadhe gataṃ kuru /🔽agraniṣkrāmayuktaṃ vā chatrākāramathāpi vā // //
analyzed: padmasya mukula ākāram agra ādadhe gatam kuru  agra niṣkrāma yuktam vā chatra ākāram atha api vā
translated: The shape of the bud of the lotus, having gone from the top, should be made.🔽Or it should be connected with the emergence from the top, or it may be shaped like an umbrella.

analyzed: pārśvayoḥ muṣṭi bandha agram vyāla rūpa ādi kalpitam  bhūtaiḥ ca makaraiḥ vyālaiḥ nāṭaka ādyaiḥ vibhūṣitam
translated: The top of the fist-band on the sides is imagined to be in the form of a serpent, etc.🔽It is adorned with elements, makara-s, serpents, and with Nāṭaka-s, etc.

original: p / ratnabandhakriyā vāpi citrā vāgrastha ghaṭṭitam /
analyzed: ratna bandha kriyā
translated: Or the Ratnabhaṇḍa-s are made, variegated, with a raised edge at the top.

analyzed: bodhi agrayoḥ taraṃgaḥ syāt tad madhye daṇḍa mānataḥ  /
translated: The wave should be between the two Bodhy-agras, and the staff should be placed in the middle of that.

analyzed: paṭṭam kartavyam tāra ucchrāye sa suvratā
translated: A band with the shape of a yoke should be made, with a height equal to the height of the star.

analyzed: nānā citraiḥ alam kṛtya bodhikā citra bodhikā
translated: Having adorned it with various pictures, it is the Bodhikā, and the Citra-Bodhikā.

analyzed: patraiḥ vicitritā patrabodhikā parikīrtitā
translated: It is declared that the Patra-Bodhikā is variegated with leaves.

analyzed: mahā arṇava taraṃga ābhān taraṃgān tu prakalpayet
translated: The waves should be imagined to be like the waves of the great ocean.

analyzed: pādam ardham tri pādam vā bhitteḥ stambhasya nirgatiḥ
translated: The emergence of the wall or the pillar should be one quarter, half, or three quarters.

analyzed: caturaśra aṣṭa vṛttānām kramāt sādhāraṇam tu vā
translated: Rectangular, octagonal, and circular, in order, or common.

analyzed: bodhi kāyaḥ tu adhastāt tu vīra kāṇḍam yuga aśrakam
translated: The base of the Bodhi tree is octagonal, the trunk is square,

analyzed: agra pāda samam tāram tri pādam tuṃgam ucyate
translated: The height is said to be three-fourths of the length of the front foot.

analyzed: sarveṣām api pādānām vīrakāṇḍam yugāśrakam
translated: The trunk of all the feet is square.

analyzed: śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the characteristics of the fruit season below the trunk of the hero.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape bodhikālakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ navamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the ninth chapter on the characteristics of the Bodhi tree in the Kashyapa Prakriya.

original: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa phalakānāṃ tu lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa phalakānām tu lakṣaṇam
translated: Now I shall describe in particular the characteristics of the fruit platforms.
The width of the fruit platform is three cubits, equal to half the height of the small one.

analyzed: catur daṇḍa viśālam tu uttamā bhavet
translated: The width of the large fruit platform should be four cubits.

analyzed: athavā kuṃbha karṇa samam bhavet
translated: Or the width of the fruit platform should be equal to the length of Kumbhakarna.

original: p / sarveṣāṃ phalakānāṃ tu tuṃgaṃ pādona daṇḍakam /
analyzed: sarveṣām phalakānām tu tuṅgam daṇḍakam
translated: The height of all the fruit platforms is one cubit less than a danda.

analyzed: tad utsedham tridhā ābhajya ūrdhva aṃśa utsaṃdhiḥ ucyate
translated: Dividing that height into three, the upper part is said to be the joint.

analyzed: tad adhas vetram eka aṃśam tasya adhasta aṃśam ambujam
translated: Below that, the bamboo is one part, below that is the lotus.

analyzed: nāga vaktra sama ākāram āpotrāt pāda rūpavat
translated: Having the shape of a naga's face, like the foot of the water spout.

analyzed: sarveṣām phalakānām tu utsandhyā ābham yuga aśrakam
translated: For all the fruits, the top should be of the shape of a yoke, with the color of twilight.

analyzed: phalakā iva prakartavyā tasya adhastāt ghaṭam kuru
translated: The fruit should be made like this, and below it, make a pot.

analyzed: dvi daṇḍam pāda hīnam vā sārdha daṇḍam atha api vā
translated: The height of the pot can be two daṇḍas, one daṇḍa less, one and a half daṇḍas,

original: sapādadaṇḍatuṃgaṃ vā ghaṭoccaṃ tu caturvidham // //🔽priyadarśanasaumyaṃ ca candrakāntaṃ ca śrīkaram /
analyzed: sa pāda daṇḍa tuṃgam vā ghaṭa uccam tu caturvidham  priyadarśana saumyam ca candrakāntam ca śrīkaram
translated: or one daṇḍa and a quarter - thus, the height of the pot is of four types.

analyzed: yathā krameṇa nāmāni kalaśānām krama uditam
translated: The names of the pots are Priyadarśana, Saumya, Candrakānta, and Śrīkara, as mentioned in order.

original: ghaṭocchraye navāṃśenaghṛtabhāgena parikalpayet /🔽vedāṃśaṃ kalaśotsedhaṃ kaṇṭhamekāṃśamānataḥ // //🔽āsyoccamekabhāgena padmamekena kalpayet /
analyzed: ghaṭa ucchraye nava aṃśena ghṛta bhāgena parikalpayet  veda aṃśam kalaśa utsedham kaṇṭham eka aṃśa mānataḥ  / āsya uccam eka bhāgena padmam ekena kalpayet
translated: In the height of the pot, one should calculate by the part of ghee.🔽The height of the pot should be one-fourth of the height, and the neck should be one part high.🔽The height of the mouth should be one part, and the lotus should be made with one part.

analyzed: ardhena vṛttam ardhena hīnau saṃkalpayet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should make the circle half and half less.

analyzed: ūrdhvāt adhas gatam kuryāt tat etena vinā kramāt
translated: One should make it go downwards from above, without this order.

original: evamuccaṃ samākhyātaṃ niṣkaṃbhamadhunā śṛṇu // //🔽pādavyāsasamaṃ hīrau tatkarṇaṃ cāsya vistṛtam /
analyzed: evam uccam samākhyātam niṣkaṃbham adhunā śṛṇu  pāda vyāsa samam hīrau tad karṇam ca asya vistṛtam
translated: Thus, the height has been described. Now listen to the pillarless (temple).🔽The width of the gem is equal to the width of the foot, and its height is the same as the height of the pot.

original: āsyaṃ karṇaṃ viśeṣeṇa kuṃbhasyaiva tu vistṛtam // //
analyzed: āsyam karṇam viśeṣeṇa kuṃbhasya eva tu vistṛtam
translated: The mouth and the height of the pot are especially wide.

analyzed: stambha vyāsa samam proktam vistāram dhṛga kaṇṭhayoḥ
translated: The diameter of the pillar is said to be the same as the width of the base and neck.

analyzed: tasya adhas laśunam mūla tuṃga daṇḍa eka mānataḥ  /
translated: Below it, the garlic and the root should be of the same height as the staff.

analyzed: tad ardhaḥ tad tad ardhena mānena abjam prakalpayet  vaktra sthānam udāhṛtam
translated: Then, with half of that and half of that again, one should design the lotus.🔽The place for the face is said to be with a staff half the length of the lotus.

analyzed: tasya adhas daṇḍa mānena muktā dāmaiḥ vibhūṣitam
translated: Below it, adorned with pearl garlands, with the measure of the staff.

original: laśunaṃ cābjapatraṃ ca muktādāma tathaiva ca // //🔽staṃbhavyāsasamaṃ vyāsaṃ kalpayetkalpavittamaḥ /
analyzed: laśunam ca abja patram ca muktā dāma tathā eva ca  staṃbha vyāsa samam vyāsam kalpayet kalpa vittamaḥ
translated: The garlic, lotus leaf, and pearl garland are the same.🔽The best of those who know the Kalpa should make the diameter the same as the diameter of the pillar.

original: athavā bodhikādīnāṃ udayaṃ tu vadāmyaham // //🔽guṇāṃśaṃ caraṇotsedhaṃ kṛtvādhodvyaṃśakaṃ vrajet /
analyzed: athavā bodhikā ādīnām udayam tu vadāmi aham
translated: Now I will tell the rise of the Bodhika and others.🔽Having made the height of the foot one-fourth of the total height, one should go down two parts.

analyzed: ūrdhva bhāgam tu saṃgrāhya dvāviṃśati aṃśakam bhavet
translated: Taking the upper part, it should be divided into twenty-two parts.

analyzed: yuga aṃśam bodhikā utsedham vīrakāṇḍam ca tad samam
translated: The height of the Bodhika should be five parts, and the Vīrakaṇḍa should be of the same height.

original: bhūtāṃśaṃ phalakotsedhaṃ ghṛtamānāṃśakaṃ bhavet // //🔽ghaṭotsedhaṃ tuṃ vedāṃśaṃ kaṇṭhamānaṃ śivāṃśakam /
analyzed: bhavet
translated: The height of the fruit should be four parts, and the ghee should be one part.🔽The height of the pot should be four parts, the neck should be three parts,

analyzed: tadā asya udayam eka aṃśam padmam ekena kārayet  /
translated: the mouth should be one part, and the lotus should be made with one part.

analyzed: vittam ardhena kartavyam hīrau tat samam ucyate
translated: The wealth should be made half, and that is said to be equal to the gem.
The garlic, lotus creeper, pearl necklace, and so on are as before.

analyzed: staṃbha bhūṣaṇam evam syāt vedikā lakṣaṇam tathā
translated: Thus, the pillar ornament and the characteristics of the platform should be like this.

analyzed: iti aṃśumānkāśyape stambhabhūṣaṇa paṭalaḥ daśamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the tenth chapter on pillar ornaments in the Mayamata.

original: p / atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa vedikā lakṣaṇaṃ param /
analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa vedikā lakṣaṇam param
translated: Now, I shall describe the excellent characteristics of the platform.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna upariṣṭhāt tu staṃbha mūle tu kalpayet
translated: On top of the foundation, one should make it at the base of the pillar.

analyzed: prastarasya upariṣṭāt ca kartavyā vedikā dvija
translated: O Brahmin, it should be made above the stone slab.

analyzed: adhyardha daṇḍa mānam tu kanyasā
translated: The lowest platform should be one and a half daṇḍas in height.

original: dvidaṇḍena tu madhyaṃ syāt śreṣṭhatuṃgaṃ tridaṇḍakam /
analyzed: dvi daṇḍena tu madhyam syāt śreṣṭha tuṃgam tri daṇḍakam
translated: The middle one should be two daṇḍas, and the best one should be three daṇḍas high.

analyzed: athavā anya prakāreṇa vedikā utsedham ucyate
translated: Now, the height of the platform is described in another way.

analyzed: vibhājite
translated: When the rise of the foot is divided into seven parts of five,

analyzed: eka aṃśam vedikā mānam kramāt śreṣṭha antara adhamam
translated: the platform height is one part, the best, medium, and lowest in order.

original: evaṃ hi caraṇāyāṃ tu mūle tu vedikodayam /
analyzed: evam hi caraṇāyām tu mūle tu vedikā udayam
translated: Thus, the rise of the platform at the base of the foot,

original: ūrdhve bhūmyaṃghri tuṃgaṃ tu saptabhāgaṃ vibhājite // //
analyzed: ūrdhve tuṃgam tu sapta bhāgam vibhājite  /
translated: and the height of the upper floor is divided into seven parts.

analyzed: eka aṃśam kaṇṭha harmyāṇām vedikā udayam iṣyate
translated: The height of the platform is considered to be one-eighth of the neck chambers.

original: tricatuḥpaṃcabhāgaṃ tu galotsedhaṃ vibhājite // //🔽galamūle tu vedyuccaṃ aṃśaṃ śreṣṭhāntarādhamam /
analyzed: tri catur paṃca bhāgam tu gala utsedham vibhājite  / galamūle tu vedi uccam aṃśam śreṣṭha antara adhamam
translated: When the neck height is divided into three, four, or five parts,🔽the height of the platform at the base of the neck is considered the best, medium, or lowest.

analyzed: āpeta utsedha aṃśa mānam vā gala mūle tu vedikā
translated: Or the platform at the base of the neck should be equal to the height of the neck.

original: ṣaḍaṃśe vedikotsedhaṃ guṇāṃśaṃ galamānakam /🔽galordhve kaṃpamekāṃśaṃ ekenābjaṃ prakalpayet // //
analyzed: gala ūrdhve kaṃpam eka aṃśam ekena abjam prakalpayet
translated: In a six-part division, the height of the platform is one part, and the neck is five parts.🔽Above the neck, the projection should be one part, and the lotus should be designed with one part.

analyzed: tad ūrdhva kaṃpam ekena kartavyam dvijasattama
translated: O Best of Brahmins, the projection above that should be made with one part.

analyzed: sapta aṃṣṭa aṃśe tu vedi ucce veda bhūtam kramāt galam
translated: In a seven or eight-part division of the platform height, the neck should be divided into three parts in order.

original: kampapadmaṃ ca kampaṃ ca prāgivaiva prakalpayet /
analyzed: kampa padmam ca kampam ca prāk iva eva prakalpayet
translated: The projection, lotus, and projection should be designed as before.

analyzed: karṇa mānena tad mūle kaṃpam ekena kalpayet  /
translated: At its base, the projection should be made with one part of the height of the eaves.

original: p / śeṣaṃ karṇodayaṃ proktaṃ tatkaṃparahitaṃ tu vā /
analyzed: śeṣam karṇa udayam proktam tat kampa rahitam tu vā
translated: The remaining height of the eaves is said to be without the projection.

original: adhyardhāṃśaṃ tu vā padmaṃ tuṃgaṃ dvyaṃśamathāpi vā // //🔽padmaśaivalapatrābhā citrāṃgā vedikā matā /
analyzed: adhyardha aṃśam tu vā padmam tuṃgam dvi aṃśam atha api vā  padma śaivala patra ābhā citra aṃgā vedikā matā
translated: Or the lotus should be one and a half parts, and the height should be two parts.🔽The platform is considered to have variegated limbs, resembling a lotus leaf or moss.

analyzed: sarvāsām vedikānām tu galam aṃghri vibhūṣitam
translated: All the platforms are adorned with neck and base.

analyzed: kuḍya staṃbha samam vyāsam nīvram ca vedikā aṃghriṇā
translated: Listen to the insertion of the base of the altar with the width of the wall and pillar equal to the height of the wall.

analyzed: prastara upari vedīnām veśanam śṛṇu suvrata
translated: O one of good vows, listen to the insertion of the altar above the platform.
One-third of the inner wall is the insertion of the base of the altar.

analyzed: catur bhāga eka veśam vā
translated: Or the insertion of one-fourth.

analyzed: kuḍya staṃbhasya bāhyām tu vedyā aṃghrī bāhyaveśanam
translated: The base of the altar outside the wall and pillar is the external insertion.

analyzed: evam vā anya prakāreṇa vedikā vistṛtam śṛṇu
translated: Thus, or in another way, listen to the width of the altar.

analyzed: kuḍya pād bāhyamānam tu ubhayoḥ pārśvayoḥ api
translated: The external measurement of the wall foot is on both sides.

original: ṣaṭsaptāṣṭanavāṃśaṃ vā daśabhāgaṃ tu vā bhajet // //
analyzed: ṣaṣ sapta aṣṭa nava aṃśam vā daśa bhāgam tu vā bhajet  /
translated: It should be divided into six, seven, eight, nine, or ten parts.

analyzed: eka aṃśa rahitam śeṣam vedikāyāḥ tu vistaram
translated: The remaining width of the altar is one part less.

original: yugāśravedikākārā nāgare prastaropari // //🔽drāviḍe vesare harmye vasvaśraṃ vedikākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: yuga aśra vedikā ākārāḥ nāgare prastara upari  drāviḍe vesare harmye vasvaśram vedikā ākṛtiḥ
translated: The shape of the altar is like a square on the platform above in the Nagara style.🔽In the Dravida and Vesara temples, the shape of the altar is like a cross.

original: athavā vesare harmye vedikā vṛttameva vā // //🔽anekāśrāyatāśre ca galāśrā vedikāśrakāḥ /
analyzed: athavā vesare harmye vedikā vṛttam eva vā  ca galāśrāḥ vedikāśrakāḥ
translated: Or in the Vesara temple, the altar is circular.🔽In the many-sided and angular temples, the shape of the altar is like a neck.

analyzed: vedikā lakṣaṇam proktam śṛṇu jālāka lakṣaṇam
translated: The characteristics of the altar have been described. Listen to the characteristics of the lattice.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape vedikā lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ ekādaśa
translated: Thus ends Chapter Eleven on the Characteristics of the Altar in the Mayamata.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa śṛṇujālāka lakṣaṇam
translated: Now I will tell you the characteristics of the lattice in particular, listen.

analyzed: pāda varge gale ca eva jālakasthānam ucyate
translated: The place for the lattice is said to be in the group of feet and in the neck.

analyzed: prāsādeṣu mahā śālāsu antarāle ca madhyame
translated: In palaces, large halls, and in the middle space,

analyzed: vātāyanam prakartavyam anena vidhinā budhaḥ
translated: the wise one should make the window according to this procedure.

analyzed: yojayet vedikā ūrdhve tu jālakam tu dvijottama
translated: O best of the twice-born, one should install the lattice above the platform.
The platform and half of the lattice should be cut, which destroys everything.

original: tasmādyatnena vediṃ tu jālakārdhaṃ na chedayet /
analyzed: tasmāt yatnena vedim tu jālaka ardham na chedayet
translated: Therefore, one should not cut the platform and half of the lattice with effort.

original: dvidaṇḍaṃ kanyasaṃ vyāsaṃ tridaṇḍaṃ madhyamaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: dvi daṇḍam kanyasam vyāsam tri daṇḍam madhyamam bhavet
translated: The smallest width is two daṇḍas, the medium one is three daṇḍas.

original: caturdaṇḍaviśālaṃ tu uttamaṃ parikīrtitam /🔽vistārasadṛśotsedhād ekadaṇḍa vivardhanāt // //
analyzed: catur daṇḍa viśālam tu uttamam parikīrtitam  vistāra sadṛśa utsedhāt eka daṇḍa vivardhanāt  /
translated: The width of four daṇḍas is declared to be the best.🔽The height should be equal to the width, increasing by one daṇḍa.

analyzed: vistāra dviguṇam yāvat tāvat vaijālaka unnatam
translated: The height of the lattice should be twice the width, up to that extent.

original: eṣu tuṃgaviśāleṣu yadiṣṭaṃ tatparigrahet // //🔽stambhavyāsārdhamānaṃ tu ghanavyāsāṃghrikaṃpayoḥ /
analyzed: eṣu tuṃga viśāleṣu yat iṣṭam tat parigrahet  stambha vyāsa ardha mānam tu ghana vyāsa aṃghri kaṃpayoḥ
translated: One should adopt whatever is desired among these heights and widths.🔽The thickness of the pillars and the height of the feet should be half the width of the pillars.

analyzed: vistāra ardha ghanam vyāsam tri caturtha aṃśam eva vā
translated: The thickness of the platform should be half the width, or one-third or one-fourth of it.

original: madhye staṃbhaṃ ca raṃghraṃ ca varjyā jālakamācaret /
analyzed: madhye staṃbham ca raṃghram ca varjyāḥ jālakam ācaret
translated: In the middle, one should avoid the pillar and the floor, and use lattice work.

analyzed: yugma pāda samāyuktam yugmakam penam ucyate  /
translated: What is joined with two pairs of feet is said to be a pair.

analyzed: gonetram hastinetram ca nandyāvartam ṛjuṃkriyām
translated: The cow's eye, the elephant's eye, the nandya-avarta, the straight work,

original: puṣpaghaṇḍaṃ rasakaṇṭhaṃ ca jālakaṃ ṣaḍvidhaṃ bhavet // //🔽dīrghāśraṃ kaṇṭhagacchidraṃ gonetramiti saṃjñitam /
analyzed: kaṇṭha ga chidram gonetram iti saṃjñitam
translated: The flower bunch, the rasa-throat, and the lattice work are of six kinds.🔽The long-shaped throat hole is known as the cow's eye.

analyzed: kaṇṭha ga chidram hastinetram udāhṛtam
translated: The square-shaped throat hole is said to be the elephant's eye.

analyzed: paṃca sūtram tu yat chidram pradakṣiṇa vaśāt kṛtam
translated: The hole made by turning to the right with five threads,

analyzed: nandyāvartasya puṣpa ābham nandyāvartam udāhṛtam
translated: Is said to be the nandya-avarta, having the shape of a nandya-avarta flower.

analyzed: ārjavam saṃbhakam vaudvau jālakam tat ṛju kriyam
translated: The straight work is the lattice work with two or four holes.

analyzed: puṣpa khaṇḍam ca karṇam ca nandyāvartam iva ākṛtiḥ
translated: The flower bunch and the ear are shaped like a nandya-avarta.

analyzed: stambha yogam kavāṭam ca bhitti madhyāt bahis sthitam
translated: The pillar connection, the door, and the wall are located outside in the middle.

analyzed: yugmāyugmaka vāṭam vā ghāṭanāt ghāṭana kṣamam
translated: The even or uneven door is capable of being opened by closing.

analyzed: jālakam tu sabhā ādīnām madhya mānena kalpayet
translated: The lattice work of the assembly halls etc. should be made with the middle measure.

analyzed: lohaiḥ druma utpalaiḥ dravyaiḥ veṣṭakābhiḥ tu jālakam
translated: The lattice is made with iron, wood, lotus, and other materials, and with bricks.

original: trayovidhaṃ tu yaddravyaṃ tena tatraiva yojayet /
analyzed: trayovidham tu yat dravyam tena tatra eva yojayet
translated: The three types of materials should be used there itself.

analyzed: jālakam hi evam ākhyātam tatas toraṇa lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus the lattice has been explained, and then the characteristics of the arch.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape jālaka lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ dvādaśa
translated: Thus ends Chapter 12 on the characteristics of the lattice in the Kashyapa Sastra of Vishvakarma.

original: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa toraṇānāṃ tu lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa toraṇānām tu lakṣaṇam
translated: Now I shall explain in particular the characteristics of arches.

original: pādodaye daśāṃśe tu saptāṃśaṃ caraṇodayam // //🔽śeṣaṃ ca guṇabhāgaṃ tu jhaṣamānamudāhṛtam /
analyzed: pāda udaye daśa aṃśe tu sapta aṃśam caraṇa udayam  śeṣam ca guṇa bhāgam tu jhaṣa mānam udāhṛtam
translated: In the rise of the foot, in the tenth part, the rise of the foot is in seven parts.🔽The remaining part is said to be the rise of the fish in six parts.

analyzed: nava aṃśe pāda tuṃgam tu ṣaṣ aṃśam caraṇa āyatam
translated: In the ninth part, the height of the foot is in five parts, and the length of the foot is in six parts.

original: p / śeṣaṃ jhaṣodayaṃ khyātaṃ aṣṭāṃśe vāṃghrituṃgakam /
analyzed: śeṣam jhaṣa udayam khyātam aṣṭa aṃśe vā aṅghri tuṅgakam
translated: The remaining part is said to be the rise of the fish. In the eighth part, the height of the foot is in four parts.

original: paṃcāṃśaṃ caraṇottuṃgaṃ jhaṣotsedhaṃ guṇāṃśakam // //🔽tuṃgārdhaṃ vipulaṃ vātha vedabhūtarasāṃghrikaiḥ /
analyzed: paṃca aṃśam caraṇa uttuṃgam jhaṣa utsedham guṇa aṃśakam  tuṃga ardham vipulam vā atha veda bhūta rasa aṃghrikaiḥ
translated: The height of the foot is in five parts, and the rise of the fish is in six parts.🔽The width is half the height or in multiples of one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, or ten parts.

analyzed: toraṇasya eva pād bāhye vyāsam evam caturvidham
translated: Thus, the width outside the foot of the arch is of four types.

analyzed: prāsāda maṇṭapa ādīnām madhya bhāge tu toraṇam
translated: The arch should be in the middle part of the palace, pavilion, etc.,

analyzed: anena vidhinā vā api kartavyam bhitti bāhyake
translated: or it should be made outside the wall according to this method.

analyzed: patra ākhya toraṇam ca ādau dvitīyam makara toraṇam
translated: First is the leaf-named arch, second is the crocodile arch,

analyzed: tṛtīyam citra saṃjñā tu trividham toraṇa ākṛtiḥ
translated: Third is the one named colorful - these are the three types of arch shapes.

analyzed: ardhacandram iva ākāram patra ja ādi virājitam
translated: Resembling a half-moon, adorned with leaf-like decorations,

analyzed: patratoraṇam ākhyātam tatas makaram ucyate
translated: The leaf arch is described, then the crocodile arch is mentioned.

analyzed: paṃcavaktra samāyuktam pārśvayoḥ makara āsyakam  madhye pūrīsa saṃyuktam nānāvidha latā anvitam
translated: Having five faces, with crocodile faces on the sides,🔽In the middle, with a ball, endowed with various creepers,

analyzed: nānā alaṃkāra saṃyuktam yuktam makara toraṇam
translated: Adorned with various ornaments, the crocodile arch is appropriate.

original: tadeva pārśvayormadhye purīmasya dvayorapi // //🔽nakratuṇḍaṃ prakartavyaṃ bhūtavidyādharāsyakam /
analyzed: tat eva pārśvayoḥ madhye purīmasya dvayoḥ api  nakra tuṇḍam prakartavyam bhūta vidyādhara āsyakam
translated: That itself, on the sides in the middle, with two balls on both sides,🔽The crocodile mouth should be made, with the faces of bhutas and vidyadharas.

analyzed: siṃha ibha vyāla haṃsa ādyaiḥ pāla asram mukta dāmakaiḥ
translated: With lions, pythons, swans, etc., with garlands of loose flowers,

analyzed: anyaiḥ ca vividhaiḥ citraiḥ ratna bandhaiḥ ca bhūṣitam
translated: And with various other colorful designs, adorned with jewel bands,

analyzed: citra toraṇam etat syāt procyate toraṇa trayam  toraṇāni uttara adhastāt prayojyāni vicakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: This is the colorful arch - the three arches are described.🔽The arches should be used below and above by the wise.

analyzed: pāda uccam pañca ṣaṣ sapta bhāge dvau toraṇa agrakam
translated: The height of the arch is two-thirds of the height of the pillar.

original: śeṣaṃ pādodayaṃ khyātaṃ evaṃ citramidaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: śeṣam pāda udayam khyātam evam citram idam bhavet
translated: The remaining portion is known as the foot rise. Thus, this would be variegated.

analyzed: catur aśra aṣṭakam vā api vṛttam vā toraṇa aṃghrikam
translated: The base of the arch may be quadrangular, octagonal, or circular.

analyzed: kuṃbha maṃḍī ādi saṃyuktam bodhikā rahitam tu vā
translated: It may be provided with a pot-like projection or without a projection for enlightenment.

analyzed: bodhikā sahitam vā api vīrakāṇḍa samanvitam
translated: It may be provided with a projection for enlightenment or with a heroic section.

original: kuḍyastaṃbhaviśālārdhaṃ tripādaṃ vā samaṃ tu vā /
analyzed: kuḍya staṃbha viśāla ardham tri pādam vā samam tu vā
translated: The width of the arch base may be half the width of the wall or pillar, three-fourths, or equal.

analyzed: toraṇa aṃghri viśālam tu procyate dvijasattama
translated: O Best of Brahmins, the width of the arch base is being described.

analyzed: uttaram vājanam sa abja kṣepaṇam kudravājanam
translated: The upper part, the beam, and the lotus-throwing small beam,

analyzed: yathākrameṇa saṃkalpya anena vidhinā budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should conceive in order according to this procedure.

original: toraṇāṃghri viśālaṃ vā tripādaṃ vottarodayam /🔽tadardhaṃ vājanoccaṃ tu tasyārdhaṃ dalamānakam // //
analyzed: toraṇa aṃghri viśālam vā tri pādam vā uttara udayam  tad ardham vājana uccam tu tasya ardham dala mānakam
translated: The width of the arch base may be three-fourths or equal to the upper rise.🔽The height of the beam may be half of that, and the width of the lotus may be half of that.

analyzed: dala ūrdhva kṣepaṇam khyātam tasya ardham kṣudra vājanam
translated: The upper lotus-throwing is known as half of that, and the small beam is half of that.

original: uttaraṃ bodhikordhve vā vīrakāṇḍe tu vā bhavet // //🔽utsaṃdhyaṃ tannatāgreṇa kuryānmakaraviṣṭharam /
analyzed: uttaram bodhikā ūrdhve vā vīrakāṇḍe tu vā bhavet  utsaṃdhyam tad nata agreṇa kuryāt makara viṣṭharam
translated: The upper part may be above the projection for enlightenment or in the heroic section.🔽The makara-shaped projection should be made with the tip bent down at the joint.

analyzed: toraṇa agra viśālam tu kuḍya staṃbha udaya ardhakam
translated: The width of the top of the arch may be half the rise of the wall or pillar.

analyzed: kuḍya staṃbha dvayoḥ antar vyāsam vā toraṇa agrakam
translated: The width of the top of the arch should be between the wall and the pillar, or equal to the height of the arch,

analyzed: aṃghri vetra avasānam vā tasmāt daṇḍa adhikam tu vā
translated: or ending with the foot and staff, or even more than the staff.

analyzed: evam caturvidham khyātam toraṇa agra viśālakam  kuḍya toraṇam ākhyātam dvāra toraṇam ucyate
translated: Thus, the width of the top of the arch is said to be of four types.🔽The wall arch has been described. The door arch is now being described.

analyzed: dvāra tulya unnatam vyāsam toraṇa aṅghri antaram samam
translated: The width of the door arch should be equal to the height of the door, and the space between the feet of the arch should be equal.

analyzed: uttaram vājanam ca abja kṣepaṇam ca aṣṭamaṃgalam
translated: The upper part, the hanging ornament, the lotus, and the eight auspicious symbols,

analyzed: paṃcavaktra āḍhyam prāc ukta vidhinā kuru
translated: the plank should be adorned with five faces, as described earlier.

analyzed: patra ākhyam makara ākhyam vā citra toraṇam eva vā
translated: It should be named after the leaf, the crocodile, or the colorful arch.

analyzed: madhya ūrdhve śūla saṃyuktam pārśvayoḥ ca samanvitam
translated: In the middle above, it should be connected with a trident, and on the sides, it should be complete.

analyzed: darpaṇam pūrṇa kuṃbham ca vṛṣabham yugma cāmaram
translated: The mirror, the full pot, the bull, the pair of chowries,

analyzed: śrīvatsam svastikam śaṃkham dīpaḥ deva aṣṭa maṃgalam
translated: the srivatsa mark, the swastika, the conch, the lamp - these are the eight auspicious symbols of the gods.

original: śrīvatsaṃ madhyame kuryāt śeṣāstu tasya pārśvayoḥ // //
analyzed: śrīvatsam madhyame kuryāt śeṣāḥ tu tasya pārśvayoḥ  /
translated: The srivatsa mark should be made in the middle, and the others on its sides.

analyzed: lohaiḥ dāru śilābhiḥ vā kartavyam dvāra toraṇam
translated: The door arch should be made of metal, wood, or stone.

analyzed: dvāra toraṇam evam hi staṃbha toraṇam ucyate
translated: Thus, the door arch is described. The pillar arch is now being described.

analyzed: pāda uccam tu tridhā ābhajya dvi bhāgam caraṇa udayam
translated: The height of the foot should be divided into three parts, and two parts should be the rise of the foot.

analyzed: pādam sarva aṃga saṃyuktam bodhikā rahitam kuru
translated: The remaining part should be connected with all the parts and should be made without the decorative band.

analyzed: uttaram vājanam ca abja kṣepaṇam nimna vājanam
translated: The upper part, the lotus, the throwing of the lotus, and the low decorative band,

analyzed: tad ūrdhve jhaṣa khaṇḍam tu nānā citraiḥ vicitritam
translated: above that, the fish-shaped design, decorated with various colors,

analyzed: toraṇam makara ākhyam tu mṛṇābhye dvi krakandharam
translated: the arch called Makara, the two-headed Kankhara,

analyzed: etat syāt staṃbha toraṇam
translated: combined with the self-nature of fire, this should be the pillar arch.

analyzed: pāda antare vā hārāyām karṇa prāsāda madhyame
translated: In the space between the feet or in the necklace, in the middle of the angular tower,

analyzed: śālā madhya antarālāyām kartavyam sarva dhāmasu
translated: in the inner space of the hall, it should be done in all the temples.

analyzed: stambha toraṇam ākhyātam kuṃbha latāḥ vidhim śṛṇu
translated: The pillar arch has been described. Listen to the method of the pot-creeper.

analyzed: iti aṃśumānkāśyape toraṇa lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ trayodaśa
translated: Thus ends Chapter 13 on the characteristics of the arch in the Kashyapa Treatise of Vishvakarma.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa kuṃbha latā vidhim śṛṇu
translated: Now I will tell you in particular, listen to the method of the pot-creeper.

analyzed: staṃbha mūle tu vedi ūrdhve padmāsanam prakalpayet
translated: At the base of the pillar, above the altar, one should design a lotus seat.

original: pādavyāsasamaṃ tuṃgaṃ saptādaṃ padmavistaram /🔽padmoccaṃ vasudhā bhajya kampamekāṃśamucyate // //
analyzed: pāda vyāsa samam tuṃgam sapta ādam padma vistaram 🔽padma uccam vasudhā bhajya kampam eka aṃśam ucyate  /
translated: The height should be equal to the width of the foot, and the lotus should have seven petals.🔽The height of the lotus should be divided by eight, and one part is said to be the height of the petals.

original: adhaḥ padmaṃ guṇāṃśaṃ tu ekāṃśaṃ galamucyate /
analyzed: adhas padmam guṇa aṃśam tu eka aṃśam galam ucyate
translated: The lower lotus is one part, and the neck is said to be one part.

analyzed: ūrdhva padmam dvi bhāgam tu kampam ekena kārayet  /
translated: The upper lotus is two parts, and the top should be made with one part.

analyzed: tad ūrdhve kuṃbha tuṃgam tu padmasya ucca samam bhavet
translated: Above that, the hump of the pot should be equal to the height of the lotus.

original: tattuṃgadviguṇaṃ kuṃbhaṃ vyāsamityucyate mayā // //🔽kuṃbhasya staṃbhaniryūhaṃ vallīmaṇḍalasaṃyutam /
analyzed: tad tuṃga dviguṇam kuṃbham vyāsam iti ucyate mayā  kuṃbhasya staṃbha niryūham vallī maṇḍala saṃyutam
translated: I say that the height of the pot is twice that height, and that is called the diameter.🔽The pot should have pillars, projections, and be adorned with creepers and circles.

analyzed: kuṃbha maṃḍī ādi saṃyuktam vīra kāṇḍa vihīnakam
translated: It should be equipped with pot-circles, etc., and should be devoid of heroic sections.

analyzed: phalaka upari padmam tu kuṃbha mānena kārayet
translated: On top of the beams, one should make a lotus with the dimensions of the pot.

original: kuṃbhaṃ kuṃbhaṃ latāṃ hyetāṃ anyathā vakṣyate budhaiḥ // //
analyzed: kuṃbham kuṃbham latām hi etām anyathā vakṣyate budhaiḥ
translated: The wise ones will explain otherwise, with creepers for each pot.

analyzed: tat eva utsaṃdhikā ūrdhve tu vīra kāṇḍa samanvitam
translated: That itself, above the protrusion, is endowed with a heroic section.

analyzed: bodhikā rahitam yat tat staṃbha kuṃbha latā smṛtā
translated: That which is devoid of the Bodhi tree is known as the pillar, pot, and creeper.

analyzed: staṃbha toraṇa vat mūrdhni kartavyā toraṇa latā
translated: The creeper-arch should be made on the head like the pillar-arch.

original: evaṃ trividhinītyā tu procyate kuṃbhalatā dvija / // //
analyzed: evam tri vidhi nītyā tu procyate kuṃbha latā dvija
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, the creeper-pot is described according to the threefold method.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape kuṃbha latā vidhi paṭalaḥ caturdaśa
translated: Thus ends Chapter Fourteen in the Kashyapa Prakriya on the method of making the creeper-pot.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa vṛtta sphuṭita lakṣaṇam
translated: Now I shall explain in particular the characteristics of circular cracks.

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṃgulam samārabhyam dvi dvi aṃgula vivardhanāt
translated: Beginning with six finger breadths, increasing by two finger breadths each time,

analyzed: kalā aṃgula avadhiḥ yāvat tāvat vyāsam tu ṣaṭvidham
translated: up to twelve finger breadths, the width is of six types.

original: vitārārdhaṃ tu tannivraṃ tridvyaṃśaṃ vā tribhāgikam // //
analyzed: vitāra ardham tu tat nivram tri dvi aṃśam vā tri bhāgikam
translated: The projection should be half the width, or one-third or one-fourth of the width.

original: vṛttākārasamaṃ caiva toraṇaṃghrivadāyatam /🔽sakandharaṃ tadūrdhve tu śukanāsyānvitaṃ tu vā // //
analyzed: vṛtta ākāra samam ca eva toraṇa aṃghri vat āyatam  sa kandharam tad ūrdhve tu śuka nāsya anvitam tu vā
translated: The arch should be circular in shape, extending like the foot of a gate.🔽Above that, there should be a neck, or it should be provided with a parrot's beak.

analyzed: karṇakūṭa ākṛtim vā atha vṛtta ākāram prakalpayet
translated: Or it should be designed in the shape of a pinnacle, or in a circular shape.

analyzed: staṃbha utsedha yuga aṃśe tu dvi bhāgam caraṇa āyatam
translated: In the height of the pillar, divided into two parts, two parts should be the length of the base.

analyzed: prastara udayam eka aṃśam śukanāsya udaya aṃśakam
translated: One part should be the height of the projection, and one part the height of the parrot's beak.

analyzed: tat eva kūṭa mānam tu tad tad ukta avasānayet
translated: That itself is the measure of the pinnacle, which should be completed according to the prescribed method.

original: athavāntaramaṃcaṃ tu proktamārgeṇa vā kuru /🔽vṛtta shuṭitamevaṃ hi latāmaṃḍalamaṇḍitam // //
analyzed: athavā antara maṃcam tu prokta mārgeṇa vā kuru  vṛtta shuṭitam evam hi latā maṃḍala maṇḍitam
translated: Or one should make the intermediate platform according to the prescribed method.🔽Thus the circular design is adorned with clusters of creepers.

original: staṃbhākhye toraṇaṃ caiva tathā kuṃbhalatā dvija / /🔽vṛttākhya sphuṭitaṃ caiva hārāntareṣu kalpayet // //
analyzed: staṃbha ākhye toraṇam ca eva tathā kuṃbha latāḥ dvija  sphuṭitam ca eva hāra antareṣu kalpayet  /
translated: O Brahmin, the arch called the pillar, and the creeper-like pots,🔽should be made in the spaces between the circular designs and the garlands.

analyzed: staṃbha uttare vā kartavyam harmya ādīnām viśeṣataḥ
translated: Or it should be done above the pillar, especially for mansions and so on.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape vṛtta sphuṭita lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ paṃcadaśa
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter on the characteristics of the bursting of the circle in the Kāśyapa school of architecture.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa dvāra vinyāsa lakṣaṇam
translated: Now I shall describe in particular the characteristics of the arrangement of doors.

analyzed: pāda uccam daśadhā bhajya śuddha dvāram nava aṃśakam  /
translated: Dividing the height of the plinth into ten parts, the pure door should be nine parts.

original: caraṇaṃ navadhā bhajyaṃ aṣṭāṃśaṃ dvāramānakam /🔽athavāṃ ghrikatuṃgaṃ tu vasubhāgavibhājite // //🔽saptāṃśaṃ dvāramānaṃ tu śeṣaṃ tu rasabhājite /

analyzed: viśālam vā tri pādam vā ardham eva vā
translated: The breadth of the peak is said to be three-fourths or half.

analyzed: pādam sa ardham sa pādam vā māna sūtrāt bahis gatiḥ
translated: The foot, one and a half feet, or two feet is the external measurement from the measuring thread.

analyzed: athavā a daṇḍa mānena kūṭa ādīnām tu nirgatiḥ
translated: Or the exit of the peak, etc. is by the measure of the staff.

analyzed: daṇḍam vā adhyardha daṇḍam vā dvi daṇḍam vā ardha dvi daṇḍakam
translated: The staff, one and a half staff, two staff, or one and a half staff,

analyzed: tri daṇḍam vā atha niṣkrāntam māna sūtrāt tu bāhyatas
translated: three staff, or more, is the exit outside the measuring thread.

analyzed: mānasya abhyantare veśam vipadām āspadam sadā
translated: The dwelling inside the measuring thread is always the abode of calamities.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena māna sūtrāt bahis gatam
translated: Therefore, by all means, it should go outside the measuring thread.

original: etadvinyāsasūtraṃ vā samasūtraṃ samaṃ tu vā /
analyzed: etat vinyāsa sūtram vā sama sūtram samam tu vā
translated: This is the laying thread, or the equal thread, or the even thread.

analyzed: homa bāhya gatam sūtram avasānam udāhṛtam
translated: The thread going outside the homa is said to be the end.

original: mānavinyāsasūtraṃ ca avasānaṃ ca te tridhā /
analyzed: māna vinyāsa sūtram ca avasānam ca te tridhā
translated: The sutra of the placement of measurements, and the conclusion - these are the three.

analyzed: khyātam saṃkṣepataḥ viprāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, it is known in brief. Listen to the characteristics of the beginning.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape māna ādi sūtra lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ dvāviṃśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-second chapter on the characteristics of measuring and sutra in the Kashyapa of Anshuman.

original: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa āyādilakṣaṇaṃ param /🔽harmyavistārahastaṃ tu guṇavṛddhyāvasubhirharet // //🔽śeṣaṃ dhvajādi yoniḥ syāt utsedhaṃ tu karaṃ budhaḥ /
analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa āya ādi lakṣaṇam param  harmya vistāra hastam tu guṇa vṛddhyā vasuṣu haret  śeṣam dhvaja ādi yoniḥ syāt utsedham tu karam budhaḥ
translated: Now I will tell the supreme characteristics of the beginning in particular.🔽The breadth of the temple should be divided by the increasing factors of five and eight.🔽The remaining part is the base of the flag etc. The wise one should increase the height by one hand.

analyzed: vardhayet vasubhiḥ hrāse nakṣatreṇa ahaya ādibham
translated: In the case of decrease, the height should be increased by the number of stars.

analyzed: nava vṛddhim paritas hastam pātālaiḥ trāsayet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should increase the hand all around by nine.

analyzed: śeṣam arka ādi vāram syāt vyāsa āyāma karam guṇaiḥ
translated: The remaining part is the day of the sun etc. The breadth and length should be increased by the factors.

analyzed: vardhayet triṃśatiḥ hrāse śeṣam pratipadā udayaḥ
translated: In the case of decrease, the remaining part is the rising of the first lunar day.

analyzed: tithayaḥ tu samākhyātā tuṃga hastā aṣṭa
translated: The lunar days are said to be increased by eight hand-spans in height.

analyzed: mukhabhiḥ tu haret śeṣam āyam iti ucyate dvija
translated: The remaining part should be divided by the faces. O Brahmin, it is called the beginning.

original: tuṃgaṃ navena vṛddhyā tu prāgi vai nāḍibhirharet // //
analyzed: tuṃgam navena vṛddhyā tu vai nāḍibhiḥ haret
translated: The height should be increased by nine. The east should be divided by the nāḍīs.

analyzed: śeṣam vyayam iti khyātam āya ādhikyam vyayam kṣayaḥ
translated: The remaining part is known as expenditure. If the beginning is more, it is loss.

analyzed: ketu siṃhaḥ vṛṣaḥ hastī śubhayonim iti smṛtam
translated: Ketu, Leo, Taurus, and elephant are known as the auspicious signs.

analyzed: śukreśanī budhaḥ śubhavāram iti smṛtam
translated: Venus, Jupiter, Mercury, and Jupiter are known as the auspicious days.

analyzed: yajamānasya janma ṛkṣāḥ na virodha dinam tathā
translated: The birth star of the patron and the day without conflict,

analyzed: vāstu janma anukūlam ca nṛpateḥ ca anu kūlakam
translated: The favorable vastu and the favorable king,

original: evaṃ parīkṣya bahudhā aṃśumānaṃ tu saṃgrahet // //
analyzed: evam parīkṣya bahudhā aṃśumānam tu saṃgrahet
translated: Having examined in many ways, one should select the auspicious time.

analyzed: athavā vistṛta āyāma hastam aṣṭaguṇī kṛte
translated: Or, the breadth and length multiplied by eight,

original: bhānurvā eva śeṣaṃ tu āyamityucyate budhaḥ // //
analyzed: bhānuḥ vai eva śeṣam tu āyam iti ucyate budhaḥ
translated: The remainder is called the breadth, and the remainder is called the length.

original: navavṛddyāṃ daśabhirhrāse śeṣaṃ vyāyamudāhṛtam /🔽p / vasubhirguṇite ṛkṣe hate śeṣaṃ hayādikam // //
analyzed: nava vṛddyām daśabhiḥ hrāse śeṣam vyāyam udāhṛtam  vasubhiḥ guṇite ṛkṣe hate śeṣam haya ādikam   /
translated: By increasing by nine and decreasing by ten, the remainder is called the length.

original: guṇavaddhyāṣṭabhirhrāse śeṣaṃ dhvajādi yonayaḥ /🔽nava vṛddhyā parithau hastaṃ saptasaṃkhyā tu hrāsayet // //
analyzed: guṇavat hyā aṣṭabhiḥ hrāse śeṣam dhvaja ādi yonayaḥ  nava vṛddhyā parithau hastam sapta saṃkhyā tu hrāsayet
translated: The zodiac multiplied by eight, the remainder is the horse and so on.🔽By increasing by nine and decreasing by eight, the remainder is the signs beginning with the flag.

analyzed: śeṣam arka ādi vāram syāt nava vṛddhyāḥ traṃśa hrāse tithiḥ bhavet
translated: By increasing by nine and decreasing by seven, the remainder is the day of the week beginning with the sun.

analyzed: prāgvat śubha aśubham vīkṣya śubha mānam tu saṃgṛhet
translated: Having examined the good and bad as before, one should select the auspicious time.

analyzed: tad janma yugalam vedam ṣaṣ aṣṭa navamam śubhaiḥ
translated: That birth pair, the Vedas, the sixth, eighth, and ninth, are auspicious with the good.

analyzed: sadā iṣṭa siddhi dāḥ ṛkṣāḥ proktāḥ śeṣāḥ tu varjitāḥ
translated: The asterisms that bestow desired accomplishments are said to be auspicious, the remaining ones are to be avoided.

analyzed: nṛpa kartuḥ ca janma ṛkṣāt geha ṛkṣa avasānakam
translated: From the birth asterism of the king, the asterisms of the houses ending with the 12th house,

analyzed: gaṇayet matimān vipra śubha mānam tu gṛhyatām
translated: the wise one should count, O Brahmin, and the auspicious one should be taken.

original: lagnāṣṭamapi nāśaṃ ca duryogaṃ ca vivarjayet /
analyzed: lagna aṣṭam api nāśam ca duryogam ca vivarjayet
translated: One should avoid the 8th house from the ascendant, destruction, and bad yoga.

analyzed: āya ādi revam ākhyātam nāgara ādi vidhim śṛṇu
translated: The beginning of the year has been explained. Listen to the procedure beginning with Nāgara.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape āya ādi lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ trayoviṃśāḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-third chapter on the characteristics of the beginning of the year in the Āṃśumān Kāśyapa.

analyzed: nāgara ādi vimānānām lakṣaṇam vakṣyate adhunā
translated: Now the characteristics of the vimānas beginning with Nāgara will be described.

analyzed: deśam udāhṛtam
translated: The land between the daughters of the Himalayas is said to be the land.

analyzed: saḥ api deśam tridhā bhinnam tad tad deśa udbhavaiḥ guṇaḥ
translated: That land is also divided into three types, with the qualities arising from each region.

original: p / yathaiva dehināṃ devaṃ haṃ vātapittakaphātmakam // //
analyzed: yathā eva dehinām devam haṃ vāta pitta kapha ātmakam
translated: Just as the body of embodied beings is of the nature of wind, bile, and phlegm,

analyzed: tathā eva daṇḍa vat sarvam yad jñeyam triguṇa ātmakam
translated: so too this sacrifice is of the nature of the three qualities, like a staff.

original: sātvikaṃ tāmasaṃ caiva rājasaṃ ca tridhā smṛtāḥ // //
analyzed: sātvikam tāmasam ca eva rājasam ca tridhā smṛtāḥ
translated: It is remembered as threefold: sāttvika, tāmasa, and rājasa.

analyzed: himadri siddhayoḥ antargatā tasmāt sātvikāḥ dharāḥ
translated: The lands between the Himalayas and the Vindhyas are therefore sāttvika.

analyzed: siddha ādi kṛṣṇa varṇa antam tāmasa ākhyam mahī talam
translated: The land from the Vindhyas to the black mountains is known as tāmasa.

analyzed: bhavet
translated: The land from Krishnavarṇa to Kanya is of the rajasika type.

original: nāgaraṃ sātvikaṃ deśaṃ tāmasaṃ vesaraṃ tathā // //
analyzed: nāgaram sātvikam deśam tāmasam vesaram tathā
translated: The Nagara country is of the sattvika type, and the Vesara is of the tamasika type.

analyzed: rājasam drāviḍam deśam kramaśas parikīrtitāḥ
translated: The Dravida country is of the rajasika type, and these are declared in order.

analyzed: sātvikam nāgaram harmyam tāmasam vesara ālayam
translated: The Nagara palace is of the sattvika type, and the Vesara abode is of the tamasika type.

analyzed: rājasam drāviḍam harmyam kramāt puṃṣaṇḍa yoṣitaḥ
translated: The Dravida palace is of the rajasika type, and the male and female figures are in order.

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ maheśvaraḥ dhātā kramāt dharmya adhidevatāḥ
translated: Vishnu, Maheshvara, and Brahma are the presiding deities of the palaces in order.

analyzed: nāgaram bhūsuram vidyāt vesaram vaiśyam ucyate
translated: The Nagara should be known as the Brahmana, the Vesara is said to be the Vaishya,

original: drāviḍaṃ tu nṛpo jñeyo ākṛtiṃ śṛṇu suvrata / // //🔽kūṭakoṣṭhādi niṣkrānti mānasūtre tu saṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: drāviḍam tu nṛpaḥ ākṛtim śṛṇu suvrata  kūṭa koṣṭha ādi niṣkrānti māna sūtre tu saṃsthitāḥ
translated: and the Dravida should be known as the king. O good-natured one, listen to the description of the shapes.🔽The projections of the turrets and chambers are situated in the measuring string.

analyzed: unnata avanata upetau kūṭa koṣṭhau yathā kramam
translated: The turrets and chambers are respectively endowed with elevations and depressions.

analyzed: eka aneka tala staṃbham patra toraṇa saṃyutam
translated: Having one or many stories, with pillars, and having leaf-shaped arches,

analyzed: kṣudra koṣṭha samāyuktam mahānāsya pare dvija
translated: endowed with small chambers, and with large openings on the other side, O Brahmin.

analyzed: vedikā jālaka upetam kūṭam vedāśraśīrṣakam
translated: Having an altar and lattice-work, the turret having a square top,

analyzed: eka aneka talam vā api sa alindam vā vihīnakam
translated: having one or many stories, or having a portico or without it.

analyzed: deva agra śīrṣakam kaṇṭham śālākāram atha api vā
translated: The top of the temple should be like the head of a god, the neck should be in the shape of a hall, or it may also be so.

original: nāgaraṃ bhavanaṃ khyātaṃ taddeśaṃ tu prakalpitam // //
analyzed: nāgaram bhavanam khyātam tad deśam tu prakalpitam
translated: The building is known as Nagara, and that region is designated as such.

original: prāgvatkūṭādi niṣkrāntaṃ koṣṭhaṃ kūṭādgataṃ tu vā /
analyzed: prāgvat kūṭa ādi niṣkrāntam koṣṭham kūṭāt gatam tu vā
translated: The chamber should be constructed like a peak, etc., as before, or it may extend from the peak.

original: mānasūtrādbahiḥ kūṭaṃ nīvraṃ kūṭaṃ tu koṣṭhakam // //
analyzed: māna sūtrāt bahis kūṭam nīvram kūṭam tu koṣṭhakam
translated: The peak should be outside the measuring thread, the niche should be in the peak.

original: madhyakoṣṭhaṃ sabhadraṃ vā vibhadraṃ vā dvijottama / /🔽paṃjaraṃ mānasūtre vā kūṭaniṣkrānta sādṛśam // //
analyzed: madhya koṣṭham sa bhadram vā vibhadram vā dvijottama  paṃjaram māna sūtre vā kūṭa niṣkrānta sādṛśam
translated: O Best of Brahmins! The central chamber may have a Bhadra (auspicious) or Vibhadra (very auspicious) chamber.🔽The window should be either on the measuring thread or extending from the peak, like the latter.

analyzed: unnatā avanatā śālā sauṣṭhikā uṣṭham yathākramam
translated: The hall should be raised and lowered in order, the chamber should be in the form of a Sauthika (a kind of building).

analyzed: unnatam sāntaram tata prastara hīnakam
translated: The platform should be raised with an interval, then without a platform.

original: caturaśrāṣṭa vṛttābhaṃ tale tale sauṣṭikaṃ kramāt /🔽nānāmasūrakastaṃbhe vedikājālaka toraṇaiḥ // //
analyzed: caturaśra aṣṭa vṛtta ābham tale tale sauṣṭikam kramāt  nānā masūraka staṃbhe toraṇaiḥ
translated: The Sauthika should be in the form of a square, octagon, or circle on each floor in order.🔽With various types of pillars, platforms, lattices, and archways.

original: vṛttākhya sphuṭitairhasti kutuṇḍe kuṃbhalatādibhiḥ /🔽hārāntareṣu maṃcordhve kṣudrakoṣṭhayutaṃ tu vā // //
analyzed: vṛtta ākhya sphuṭitaiḥ hasti kutuṇḍe kuṃbha latā ādibhiḥ  hāra antareṣu maṃca ūrdhve kṣudra koṣṭha yutam tu vā
translated: With circular names, bursting, elephant's trunk, and creeper-like shapes, etc.🔽In the intervals of the garlands, above the platform, or with small chambers.

original: tatraiva hasti kutuṇḍaṃ vā bhadranāsyalpa eva vā /
analyzed: tatra eva hasti kutuṇḍam vā bhadra nāsī alpaḥ eva vā
translated: There itself, with an elephant's trunk, or a Bhadra (auspicious) face, or just a little.

original: sādhāraṃ vā nirādhāraṃ ekānekatalaṃ tu vā // //
analyzed: sādhāram vā nirādhāram eka aneka talam tu vā
translated: With a base or without a base, or with one or many floors.

original: śiraso vartanaṃ kaṇṭhaṃ vṛttaṃ vāṣṭāśrameva vā /
analyzed: śirasaḥ vartanam kaṇṭham vṛttam vā aṣṭa āśramam eva vā
translated: The neck of the head should be round or octagonal,

original: yugāśraṃ vā śiraśchandaṃ vimānaṃ drāviḍaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: yugāśram vā śiraḥ chandam vimānam drāviḍam bhavet  /
translated: the head should be in the shape of a cross, and the temple should be in the Dravida style.

analyzed: tat eva caraṇādhāram eka ākāreṇa kalpayet
translated: That itself should be made as the base of the feet, in a single form.

original: hārāntare viśeṣeṇa kalpyā vṛttasphuṭādayaḥ // //🔽samau tu kūṭakoṣṭhau dvau sāntaraprastarānvitau /
analyzed: hāra antare viśeṣeṇa kalpyāḥ vṛtta sphuṭa ādayaḥ  samau tu kūṭa koṣṭhau dvau sāntara prastara anvitau
translated: In the middle of the necklace, circles, clearings, etc. should be made in particular.🔽The two peaks and chambers should be equal, with intervening platforms.

original: p / hīnau vāntaramaṃcau dvau nīvraṃ ca samasūtrakau // //
analyzed: hīnau dvau nīvram ca sama sūtrakau
translated: The two intermediate balconies should be lower, and the eaves should be on the same line.

analyzed: hāra antareṣu kartavyam bhadra paṃjara saṃyutam
translated: In the middle of the necklace, it should be made with a good cage.

analyzed: kapota paṃjaram madhyam vā sa antara prastara anvitam
translated: The middle dove cage should be connected with an intervening platform.

original: sarveṣāṃ karṇakūṭānāṃ śīrṣaṃ tu ca yugāśrakam /🔽vasvaśraṃ vedikopetaṃ maṇḍalaṃ śīrṣakaṃ galam // //
analyzed: sarveṣām karṇakūṭānām śīrṣam tu ca yuga aśrakam  vasvaśram vedikā upetam maṇḍalam śīrṣakam galam
translated: The top of all the angular peaks should be in the shape of a cross.🔽The platform should be in the shape of a cross, and the top, neck, and eaves should be in the shape of a circle.

original: vasvaśraṃ vā śiraḥ kaṇṭhaṃ yugāśraṃ vā prakalpayet /
analyzed: vasvaśram vā śiraḥ kaṇṭham yugāśram vā prakalpayet
translated: The head and neck should be made in the shape of a cross or a circle.

analyzed: etat ca drāviḍam khyātam hema ādi kuḍmalam tathā
translated: This is known as the Dravida style, as well as the golden bud, etc.

original: vasvaśraṃ vā ṣaḍaśraṃ vā tacca drāviḍamucyate /
analyzed: vasvaśram vā ṣaḍaśram vā tat ca drāviḍam ucyate
translated: That is said to be in the Dravida style, whether in the shape of a cross or a hexagon.

original: evaṃ trividhaṃ nītyā su procyate drāviḍālayam // //
analyzed: evam trividham nītyā su procyate drāviḍa ālayam
translated: Thus, the Dravida temple is described in three ways.

analyzed: vesare kūṭa koṣṭha ādi nīvram syāt sama sūtrakam
translated: In a vesara, the attic and the bay should be of equal size.

analyzed: vṛtta ākāram śira upetam karṇakūṭam prakalpayet
translated: One should design the attic with a circular shape and a head.

analyzed: vṛttam garbhagṛha ākāram bāhye vṛtta ābham eva vā
translated: Either circular in shape or circular in appearance on the outside,

original: vṛttagrīvaśiropetaṃ yatheṣṭaśikhareṇa vā // //🔽sālindaṃ vā sabhadraṃ vā hyekānekatalaṃ tu vā /
analyzed: vṛtta grīva śirā upetam yathā iṣṭa śikhareṇa vā  sa alindam vā sa bhadram vā hi eka aneka talam tu vā
translated: with a circular neck and head, or with a peak as desired.🔽Either with a balcony or with a good balcony, with one or many stories,

original: samāśraṃ sāyatāśraṃ vā vṛttaṃ vṛttāyataṃ tu vā // //
analyzed: sama aśram sa āyata aśram vā vṛttam vṛtta āyatam tu vā
translated: either square, elongated, circular, or circular and elongated.

original: dvyaśra vṛttaṃ tu vā harmyaṃ kūṭakoṣṭhādibhiryutam /
analyzed: dvi aśra vṛttam tu vā harmyam kūṭa koṣṭha ādibhiḥ yutam
translated: The palace should have two sides, a circle, or be endowed with attics, bays, etc.

original: unnatāvanatopetau kūṭakoṣṭhau yathākramam // //🔽samau vā kuṭakoṣṭhau vā bahubhūmyaikameva vā /
analyzed: unnata avanata upetau kūṭa koṣṭhau yathākramam  samau vā kuṭa koṣṭhau vā bahu bhūmyā ekam eva vā
translated: The attics and bays should be respectively high and low.🔽Either the attics and bays should be equal or there may be many stories in one.

analyzed: vesaram bhavanam khyātam athavā anya prakārataḥ
translated: The building is known as vesara, or otherwise according to another method.

analyzed: janma ādi stūpi paryantam yuga āśram nāgaram bhavet
translated: From the beginning up to the dome, the nagara style should have four sides.

original: vasvaśraṃ śīrṣakaṃ kaṇṭhaṃ drāviḍaṃ bhavanaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: vasvaśram śīrṣakam kaṇṭham drāviḍam bhavanam bhavet  /
translated: The head and neck should have eight sides. The dravida style building should have eight sides.

analyzed: vṛtta grīva śira upetam vesaram harmyam īritam
translated: The vesara palace is said to have a circular neck and head.

analyzed: kūṭa koṣṭha vihīnānām harmyāṇām kathitāḥ tu ime
