analyzed: ṣoḍaśa antara saṃyuktam śata saṃkhyā alpa nāsikā
translated: It should be connected with sixteen intervals and one hundred small windows.

translated: The forehead, nose, face, and auspicious windows on the sides,

original: tathaivaṃ nāsikā praṣṭho śīrṣakaṃ caiva mācaret /
analyzed: tathā evam nāsikā śīrṣakam ca eva mā ācaret
translated: the nose, the back, and the top should be constructed in the same way.

analyzed: nānā adhiṣṭhāna saṃyuktam
translated: It should be connected with various foundations and various feet.

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktam hāra antaram idam bhavet
translated: It should be endowed with all ornaments. This is the interval between the windows.

analyzed: māna sūtra antam nava navadhā tu vibhājite  /
translated: When the space from the measuring thread is divided into nine parts,

analyzed: guṇa aṃśam garbha geham tu śiva aṃśam kuḍya vistṛtam
translated: the inner sanctum should be of five parts, and the wall should be of three parts.

analyzed: paritas lindam eka aṃśam hārāvyāsam śiva aṃśakam
translated: The verandah all around is one part, the space between the pillars is one-fourth part.

original: evaṃ hi kalpitaṃ teṣu karṇakūṭaṃ śivāṃśakam /
analyzed: evam hi kalpitam teṣu karṇakūṭam śiva aṃśakam
translated: Thus, the angular projection at the corners is made one-fourth part in them.

original: madhye koṣṭhaṃ guṇāṃśaṃ syāt ekāṃśaṃ paṃjarastathā // //
analyzed: madhye koṣṭham guṇa aṃśam syāt eka aṃśam paṃjaraḥ tathā
translated: The central chamber should be five parts, the window should be one part,

analyzed: hāra antaram tathā ardha aṃśam kalpya ivam prathame bhuvi
translated: and the space between the pillars should be half a part. Thus, it is designed on the first floor.

original: athavā paṃjarāṇāṃ tu ṣaḍaṃśaṃ vā vidhīyate // //
analyzed: athavā paṃjarāṇām tu ṣaṣ aṃśam vā vidhīyate
translated: Or, for the windows, six parts may be prescribed.

analyzed: śeṣam hāra antara ākhyātam paritas
translated: The remaining space between the pillars should be measured all around.
The central chamber in the middle should be three daṇḍas wide, with a large window.

analyzed: ūrdhva bhūmau ṣaṣ aṃśa iṃśam kūṭa koṣṭhāya tat bhavet
translated: On the upper floor, one part out of six parts should be for the angular projection and chamber.

analyzed: ardha aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: The window should be half a part wide, and the remaining space should be between the pillars.

original: ūrdhvabhūvistṛtāntaṃ tu madhye daṇḍena nirgatiḥ /🔽caturaśramadhiṣṭhānaṃ vasvaśraṃ śīrṣakaṃ galam // //
analyzed: ūrdhva bhū vistṛta antam tu madhye daṇḍena nirgatiḥ  catur aśram adhiṣṭhānam vasu aśram śīrṣakam galam
translated: The height of the upper floor should be extended up to the middle, with an exit through a daṇḍa.🔽The plinth should be square, the top and neck should be in the shape of a swastika.

analyzed: ādau tale catuṣkarṇe kūṭam
translated: First, on the ground floor, there should be four angular projections with a square top.

analyzed: aṣṭāśri śīrṣakam madhyāt ūrdhva bhūmau prakalpayet
translated: In the middle, on the upper floor, one should design an octagonal top.

analyzed: aṣṭa kūṭa aṣṭa koṣṭha ādi kalā paṃjara saṃyutam
translated: Along with the eight angular projections, eight chambers, and lattice windows,

analyzed: śata alpa nāsikā upetam śikhara iṣṭam mahattaram
translated: Having eight small noses on the top, the highest one on the peak.
This is known as Bhadrakoshtha, the supreme abode of all gods.

original: tadeva karṇakūṭānāṃ śīrṣakaṃ vartulākṛti // //🔽prāsādaśikharaṃ kaṇṭhaṃ vṛttākāraṃ prakalpayet /
analyzed: tat eva karṇakūṭānām śīrṣakam vartula ākṛti  prāsāda śikharam kaṇṭham vṛtta ākāram prakalpayet
translated: That itself is the top of the angular towers, round in shape.🔽The top of the palace should be designed with a circular neck.

analyzed: śikhare tu catur dikṣu bhadranāsī samanvitam
translated: On the peak, in the four directions, it is endowed with a large balcony.

analyzed: vidikṣu hi alpa nāsā āḍhyam vṛtta kūṭam idam param
translated: In the intermediate directions, it has small noses, and this is the supreme round-peaked one.

analyzed: tat eva śikharam koṇe kṣudra nāsī aṣṭaka anvitam
translated: That same peak, in the corners, is endowed with eight small noses.

analyzed: karṇakūṭānām śīrṣakam vartula ākṛtiḥ
translated: The top of the angular towers is square, and the top is round in shape.

analyzed: śeṣam prāk iva kartavyam śrīkaṇṭham tat udāhṛtam
translated: The rest should be done as before. That is called Shrikantheshvara.

analyzed: tat eva aṣṭa aṃśam ādhikyam āyāmam caturaśrakam
translated: That itself, with an increase of eight parts, the length is square.

analyzed: śālā madhye mahā nāsī bhadram vinā prakalpayet  /
translated: In the middle of the hall, a large nose should be designed without a balcony.

analyzed: śālā ābha mastakam kaṇṭham vṛtta āyatam atha api vā
translated: The top of the hall should be like a hall, or else it should be circular and long.

analyzed: stūpi traya samāyuktam etad nāmnā su maṃgalam
translated: Endowed with three stupas, this is known as Sumanagala.

analyzed: mānasūtra antaram dharma bhāgam kṛtvā dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, having divided the space between the measuring strings into Dharma parts,

analyzed: garbha geham tu veda aṃśam gṛha piṇḍī aṃśam āvṛtam
translated: The Garbhagṛha (sanctum sanctorum) should be one-fourth of the total area, and the outer wall should be one-eighth of the total area.

analyzed: paritas lindam eka aṃśam hārā bhāgena kalpayet
translated: The verandah all around should be one-eighth of the total area, and the Harabhaga (decorative band) should be one-eighth of the total area.

analyzed: teṣu eka kūṭa vistāram madhye koṣṭha āyatam dvayam  tayoḥ madhya eka bhāgena paṃjara vyāsam ucyate
translated: The width of the single Kūṭa (pillar) in the middle should be one-eighth of the total area, and the length of the Kūṭa should be twice that.🔽The width of the Pañjara (window) in the middle is said to be one-eighth of the total area.

analyzed: hāra antaram atha aṃśena paṃjarasya tu pārśvayoḥ
translated: The space between the Haras (decorative bands) on both sides of the Pañjara should be one-eighth of the total area.

analyzed: aṣṭa aṃśam ca ūrdhva bhūmiḥ tu kṛtvā aṃśam kūṭa vistṛtam
translated: The upper floor should be divided into eight parts, and the width of the Kūṭa (pillar) should be one part.

analyzed: śālā tad dviguṇa āyāmam tayoḥ madhye tu paṃjaram
translated: The length of the Śālā (hall) should be twice that, and the Pañjara (window) should be in the middle.

analyzed: eka aṃśena eva kartavyam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: It should be made with one part, and the remaining space should be the Harantara (decorative band).

analyzed: catur bhāgam dvi bhāgam madhya bhadrakam
translated: The upper floor and the platform should be divided into four parts, and the Madhyabhadraka (central auspicious part) should be two parts.

original: daṇḍaṃ vādhyardhadaṇḍaṃ vā dvidaṇḍaṃ vātha nirgamam /
analyzed: daṇḍam vā adhyardha daṇḍam vā dvi daṇḍam vā atha nirgamam
translated: The projection should be one and a half Daṇḍas, two Daṇḍas, or four Daṇḍas.

original: vedāśraṃ ca madhiṣṭhānaṃ tadvatkarṇaṃ ca śīrṣakam // //
analyzed: ca tadvat karṇam ca śīrṣakam
translated: The base should be in the shape of a square, and the cornice should be similar to the eaves.

analyzed: aṣṭa śālā aṣṭa kūṭam ca paṃjaram ṣoḍaśa anvitam
translated: There should be eight Śālā (halls) and eight Kūṭas (pillars), along with sixteen Pañjaras (windows).

analyzed: śata alpa nāsikā upetam vṛṣa sthala samanvitam
translated: It should be endowed with a hundred small Nāsīkas (ventilators) and a Vṛṣasthala (bull's head).

analyzed: nānā adhiṣṭhāna saṃyuktam nānā pādaiḥ alaṃkṛtam
translated: It should be equipped with various bases and adorned with various feet.

analyzed: unnatau kūṭa koṣṭhau dvau ca antara prastara anvitau
translated: The two elevated peaks and chambers should be provided with intermediate projections.

original: gāndhāramiti vikhyātaṃ aṣṭāśraṃ ca galaṃ śiraḥ /
analyzed: gāndhāram iti vikhyātam aṣṭāśram ca galam śiraḥ
translated: The neck and head are known as Gandhara, octagonal in shape.

analyzed: śrīviśālam iti khyātam vartulam vedikā galam
translated: The platform and neck are known as Sri Vishala, circular in shape.

analyzed: śīrṣakam ca eva kartavyam śeṣam pūrvavat ācaret
translated: The top should be made as before, the rest should be done as before.

analyzed: śrībhogam iti vikhyātam sarva deva arhakam param
translated: This is known as Sri Bhoga, the best suitable for all gods.

analyzed: vṛttāyate dvayāśra vṛtāṣṭāśre ca ṣaḍaśrake
translated: The octagonal, circular, and square shapes, and the six-sided shape,

original: kūṭakoṣṭhādi sarvāṃgaṃ prāgivaiva prakalpayet // //🔽vṛṣasthalaṃ maṇṭapaṃ ca tyajetkarṇaṃ ca śīrṣakam /
analyzed: kūṭa koṣṭha ādi sarva aṃgam prāk iva eva prakalpayet  vṛṣasthalam maṇṭapam ca tyajet karṇam ca śīrṣakam
translated: The peaks, chambers, and all parts should be designed as before.🔽The bull-shaped platform and pavilion should be abandoned, as well as the eaves and top.

analyzed: varṣa sthala vihīnānām karṇam śīrṣaka saṃyutam
translated: For those without a bull-shaped platform, the eaves should be connected with the top.

analyzed: kūṭa koṣṭha ādi sarva aṃga ādi ucitam nāgara ādikam
translated: The peaks, chambers, and all parts of the Nagara style and others are suitable.

analyzed: nānā alaṃkāra saṃyuktam nānā citraiḥ vicitritam
translated: It should be adorned with various ornaments and decorated with various paintings.

analyzed: garbhageha viśālam ca gṛha piṇḍya agra maṇṭapam
translated: The width of the inner sanctum, the top of the house, and the front pavilion,

analyzed: eka bhūmi vidhāna uktam dvi talam tu viśeṣataḥ
translated: The single-storied structure is mentioned in the scriptures, but the double-storied one is special.

analyzed: tri talam hi evam ākhyātam catur bhūmim atha ucyate
translated: The three-storied one is thus described, now the four-storied one is mentioned.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape tri tala vidhāna paṭalaḥ aṣṭāviṃśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-eighth chapter on the rules for the three-storied building in the Kāśyapa Sūtra of Aṃśumān.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa catur bhūmeḥ tu lakṣaṇam
translated: Now I will explain in particular the characteristics of the four-storied building.

original: vistarotsedhamānaṃ tu proktaṃ prāsādamānake // //🔽ravyaṃśaṃ mānasūtrāntaṃ kṛte garbhagṛhaṃ rasam /
analyzed: vistara utsedha mānam tu proktam prāsāda mānake
translated: The width and height have been mentioned in the measurements of the palace.🔽The garbhagrha (sanctum sanctorum) is made up to the end of the measuring thread of the sun's portion.
The pitha, āli, hāra, etc. are each of one part.

analyzed: vinyāsa sūtrayoḥ antara vasudhā vibhajet samam
translated: The space between the two lines of construction should be divided equally into eight parts.

original: karṇakūṭaṃ tatāṃśaṃ tu koṣṭhaṃ tad dviguṇāyatam // //
analyzed: karṇakūṭam tata aṃśam tu koṣṭham tat dviguṇa āyatam
translated: The kūrma (tortoise) is one part, the koṣṭha (chest) is twice that in length.

analyzed: paṃjara vyāsam aṃśena śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: The width of the paṅjara (window) is one part, the remaining space is the hāra (necklace).

analyzed: punar api ūrdhva bhūmim ca vasu bhāga vibhājite
translated: Again, the upper floor is divided into eight parts.

original: karṇakūṭaṃ ca koṣṭhaṃ ca paṃjaraṃ pūrvavadbhavet /
analyzed: karṇakūṭam ca koṣṭham ca paṃjaram pūrvavat bhavet
translated: The kūrma and koṣṭha should be as before.

analyzed: tad ūrdhve aṣṭa bhāge tu śiva aṃśam kūṭa vistṛtam
translated: Above that, in the eight parts, the kūrma is of one part,

analyzed: ardha aṃśam paṃjarasya tu
translated: the koṣṭha is of two parts, and the paṅjara is of half a part.

original: śeṣaṃ hārāntaraṃ proktaṃ hīnādhikyaṃ tu nāśrayet // //
analyzed: śeṣam hāra antaram proktam hīna ādhikyam tu na āśrayet
translated: The remaining space is said to be the hāra. One should not rely on any deficiency or excess.
In the upper floor, in the eight parts, the madhyabhadraka (central auspicious room) is of one part,

original: daṇḍaṃ vādhyardha daṇḍaṃ vā dvidaṇḍaṃ vātha nirgatam // //🔽prāsādoccaṃ tu vibhajet saṃgrahaṃ triṃśadaṃśakam /
analyzed: daṇḍam vā adhyardha daṇḍam vā dvi daṇḍam vā atha nirgatam  prāsāda uccam tu vibhajet saṃgraham triṃśat aṃśakam
translated: a fine of half, one and a half, or two times the amount of the theft.🔽🔽The height of the palace should be divided into thirty parts for the collection.

analyzed: sārdha aṣṭa aṃśam adhiṣṭhānam bhūta aṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: The height of the plinth should be divided into thirty parts, with eight and a half parts for the base, one part for the step,

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna samam maṃcam pāda ūna paṃcakam
translated: the height of the platform equal to the base, and the height of the plinth five parts less than that.

analyzed: sa pakṣa aṃśam ca maṃca uccam kalpayet dvijasattama
translated: O best of Brahmins, the height of the platform should be made one and a half parts.

analyzed: pāda uccam pakṣa aṃśam prastara udayam
translated: The height of the foot should be one and a half parts of a Veda, the height of the projection one part,

original: sapādavedabhāgaṃ tu caraṇodayamiṣyate // //🔽pādonapakṣāṃśaṃ coccaṃ śivāṃśaṃ vedikodayam /
analyzed: sa pāda veda bhāgam tu caraṇa udayam iṣyate  /
translated: and the height of the foot is considered to be one and a half parts of a Veda.🔽The height of the plinth should be one part less than one and a half parts, and the height of the altar one part.

original: karṇoccaṃ tu dvibhāgaṃ syāt sārdhavedāṃśa śīrṣakam // //
analyzed: karṇa uccam tu dvi bhāgam syāt sārdha veda aṃśa śīrṣakam
translated: The height of the eaves should be two parts, and the height of the top one and a half parts of a Veda.

original: p / stūpyuccaṃ tu dvibhāgaṃ syāt śāntikaṃ bhavanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: stūpī uccam tu dvi bhāgam syāt śāntikam bhavanam bhavet
translated: The height of the stupa should be two parts, and the building should be auspicious.

original: catvāriṃśad dvayādhikya bhāgaṃ kṛtvā gṛhonnatam // //🔽guṇāṃśaṃ talamānaṃ tu rasāṃśaṃ caraṇodayam /
analyzed: catvāriṃśat bhāgam kṛtvā gṛha unnatam
translated: Having divided the height of the house by forty-two parts,🔽the height of the floor should be five parts, the height of the foot six parts,

analyzed: prastaram ca agni bhāgena bhūta aṃśam talipāyatam
translated: the projection four parts, and the length of the plinth eight parts.

analyzed: syāt bhūta aṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: The platform should be one-fourth of the fire portion, and the rise of the foot should be one-eighth of the fire portion.

original: sapādadvibhāgamaṃcoccaṃ sārdhavedāṃghriṇodayam // //🔽dvibhāgaṃ maṃcamānaṃ tu śivāṃśaṃ vedikodayam /🔽adhyardhāṃśaṃ galotsedhaṃ yugāṃśaṃ śikharodayam // //
analyzed: sa pāda dvi bhāgam aṃca uccam sārdha veda aṃghriṇā udayam  dvi bhāgam tu śiva aṃśam vedikā udayam  adhyardha aṃśam gala utsedham yuga aṃśam śikhara udayam
translated: The height of the platform should be one and a half parts, and the rise of the foot should be one and a half parts of the platform.🔽The length of the platform should be two parts, and the height of the pedestal should be one-eighth of the platform.🔽The height of the neck should be one and a half parts, and the rise of the pinnacle should be two parts.

original: dvibhāgaṃ tu śikhāmānaṃ pauṣṭikaṃ tadudāhṛtam /🔽paṃcāśadvibhajeddhāmatuṃgaṃ stūpyavasānakam // //
analyzed: dvi bhāgam tu śikhā mānam pauṣṭikam tat udāhṛtam  paṃcāśat vibhajet dhāma tuṃgam stūpī avasānakam
translated: The height of the pinnacle should be two parts. This is declared to be prosperity-giving.🔽The height of the shrine ending with the stupa should be divided by fifty.

analyzed: sārdhatriṃśam adhiṣṭhānam sapta aṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: The plinth should be thirty-five and a half, and the rise of the foot should be seven parts.

analyzed: tad ardham tu ṣaṣ aṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: The length of the platform should be half of that, and the rise of the foot should be six parts.

original: guṇāṃśaṃ maṃcamānaṃ tu ūrdhvapādaṃ tu taddvayam /
analyzed: guṇa aṃśam tu ūrdhva pādam tu tad dvayam
translated: The length of the platform should be eight parts, and the upper foot should be twice that.

analyzed: tri bhāgam prastara utsedham pāda uccam sārdha paṃcakam
translated: The height of the ledge should be three parts, and the height of the foot should be five and a half parts.

original: prastaroccaṃ tribhāgaṃ syāt aṃśena vedikodayam /🔽dvibhāgaṃ galamānaṃ tu śarāṃśaṃ śikharodayam // //
analyzed: prastara uccam tri bhāgam syāt aṃśena vedikā udayam  dvi bhāgam galamānam tu śara aṃśam śikhara udayam
translated: The height of the ledge should be three parts, and the height of the pedestal should be one part.🔽The length of the neck should be two parts, and the rise of the pinnacle should be one part.

analyzed: sārdha aṃśam sthūpi mānam tu jaya dam tat udāhṛtam
translated: The height of the stupa should be one and a half parts. This is declared to be victory-giving.

analyzed: upāna ādi sthūpi paryantam paṃcāśat vibhajet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should divide the space from the plinth to the stupa into fifty.

original: taloccaṃ sārdhamagnyaṃśaṃ saptāṃśaṃ caraṇodayam /🔽p / talocca sadṛśaṃ maṃcatalīpaṃ sārdhaṣaḍbhavet // //
analyzed: tala uccam sārdham agni aṃśam sapta aṃśam caraṇa udayam  sadṛśam sārdha ṣaṣ bhavet
translated: The height of the plinth should be one and a half agnyamsa, and the rise of the foot should be seven amsa.

analyzed: pāda adhika tri bhāga aṃśam maṃca mānam udāhṛtam
translated: The height of the platform should be equal to the height of the plinth, and the platform should be one and a half times the height of the plinth.🔽The height of the platform is said to be three and a quarter bhagas.🔽The height of the foot should be one-tenth, the rise of the pedestal should be one-fifth,

analyzed: sārdha paṃca aṃśam aṃghri uccam maṃcam sārdha dvi bhāgayā
translated: the height of the foot should be one and a half times five amsa, the platform should be two and a half amsa.

analyzed: eka aṃśam vedikā mānam dvi bhāgam syāt gala udayam
translated: The height of the altar should be one amsa, the rise of the neck should be two amsa.

analyzed: paṃca aṃśam śikhara uttuṃgam sa pādam śikhara udayam
translated: The height of the pinnacle should be five amsa, the rise of the pinnacle should be one and a half amsa.

analyzed: adbhutam sadanam hi evam kalpayet kalpa vittamaḥ
translated: The best of those who know the Kalpas should thus design this wonderful temple.

original: ārāmoccaṃ tu paṃcāśat bhāgaṃ kṛtvā viśeṣataḥ /🔽sārdhāgnyaṃśamadhiṣṭhānaṃ dhālvaṃśaṃ caraṇodayam // //
analyzed: ārāma uccam tu paṃcāśat bhāgam kṛtvā viśeṣataḥ  sārdha agni aṃśam adhiṣṭhānam dhālvaṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: Having divided the height of the garden into fifty parts, especially,🔽the foundation should be one and a half agnyamsa, the rise of the foot should be one and a half amsa.

analyzed: prastara uccam tri bhāgena caraṇam sārdha ṣaṣ bhavet
translated: The rise of the pedestal should be three parts, the foot should be six and a half amsa.

analyzed: syāt sa ardha ṣaṭkakam
translated: The platform should be one and a half agnyamsa, the platform should be six and a half amsa.

original: tribhāgaṃ prastarotsedhaṃ pādoccaṃ sārdhapaṃcakam /🔽pādonāgnyaṃśamaṃcoccaṃ śivāṃśaṃ vedikodayam // //
analyzed: tri bhāgam prastara utsedham pāda uccam sārdha paṃcakam 🔽pādona agni aṃśam aṃca uccam śiva aṃśam vedikā udayam
translated: The rise of the pedestal should be three parts, the height of the foot should be five and a half amsa.🔽The height of the platform should be less by one amsa, the rise of the altar should be five amsa.

analyzed: dvi bhāgam galamānam tu pāda aṃśam śikhara udayam
translated: The height of the neck should be two parts, the rise of the pinnacle one part,

analyzed: vyoma aṃśam tu śikhā mānam vimānam sārvadeśikam
translated: and the height of the top one-eighth part. This temple is suitable for all regions.

analyzed: homa ādi stūpi varga antam veda aśram parikalpayet
translated: From the fire altar up to the top, one should construct a temple with a square base.

analyzed: bhānu kūṭam tathā koṣṭham bhānu dviguṇa paṃjaram
translated: The Kūṭa should be of the size of one Bāṇa, the Kūṭa-Koṣṭha should be of the size of two Bāṇas, and the windows should be of the size of four Bāṇas.

analyzed: śikhare tu catur dikṣu bhadranāsī catuṣṭayam
translated: At the top, there should be four doors in the four directions.

analyzed: pādam prati alpa nāsya āḍhyam śikhara ulpa aṣṭa nāsikāḥ
translated: Each door should be adorned with small doors, and there should be eight small doors on the top.

original: p / kūṭakoṣṭhādi sarvāṃgaṃ nāgarādyucitaṃ kuru /🔽ekākāratalastaṃbhaṃ subhadramiti vidyate // //
analyzed: kūṭa koṣṭha ādi sarva aṅgam nāgara ādi ucitam kuru  eka ākāra tala staṃbham subhadram iti vidyate
translated: The Kūṭa, Koṣṭha, etc. should be made in accordance with the Nāgara style.🔽The temple with pillars of the same shape on the ground floor is known as Subhadra.

analyzed: tat eva śikhara iṣṭa alpa nāsikā rahitam bhavet
translated: The same temple without the eight small doors on the top is known as Brāhma.

original: tadbrāhmyamiti vikhyātaṃ sarvadeva priyāvaham // //🔽tadevaṃ śikharaṃ kaṇṭhaṃ vṛttaṃ śrīkāntamucyate /
analyzed: tat brāhmyam iti vikhyātam sarva deva priya āvaham  tat evam śikharam kaṇṭham vṛttam śrīkāntam ucyate
translated: It is famous and brings happiness to all gods.🔽The same temple with a circular top and neck is called Śrīkānta.

original: vasvaśraṃ śīrṣakaṃ kaṇṭhaṃ śrīmaṇḍanamudāhṛtam // //🔽tadeva śikhare cāṣṭau mahānāsī samanvitam /
analyzed: śīrṣakam kaṇṭham śrīmaṇḍanam udāhṛtam  tat eva śikhare ca aṣṭau mahā nāsī samanvitam
translated: The temple with a triangular top and neck is called Śrīmaṇḍana.

analyzed: śrīvantam iti khyātam śālābhadra yutam tu vā
translated: The same temple with eight large doors on the top is known as Śrīvanta, or it may have Śālā and Bhadra.

analyzed: vibhadram vā atha kartavyam sarveṣām sadanām api
translated: Or the Vibhadra form can be made for all, with a height of eight parts.
The head should have a beautiful face, a small peak, a prominent nose, and be beautiful.

analyzed: nānā aṃghri tala saṃyuktam tad tad nāmnā prakīrtitāḥ
translated: It should have various foot soles, and be known by those names.

analyzed: vistāra adhyardham āyāmam sabhā ākāram tu śīrṣakam
translated: The head should be shaped like a hall, with a width of one and a half parts and a height of two parts.

analyzed: saṃpad ālayam iti uktam sarva deva arhakam param
translated: It is said to be the abode of prosperity, and is the best for all gods.

analyzed: mānasūtra antaram nanda bhāgam kṛtvā viśeṣataḥ
translated: Having divided the space between the measuring strings into nine parts, especially the part of Nanda,

analyzed: garbha geham guṇa aṃśam syāt bhāgena gṛha piṇḍikā
translated: the inner sanctum should be one part, the house platform should be one part,

analyzed: alindam aṃśena kartavyam hāra bhāgena kalpayet
translated: the portico should be made with one part, and the cornice should be made with one part.

original: tato vinyāsasūtrāntaṃ sadanaṃ navabhājite /🔽ekāṃśaṃ kūṭavistāraṃ guṇāṃśaṃ koṣṭhadīrghakam // //
analyzed: tatas vinyāsa sūtra antam sadanam nava bhājite  eka aṃśam kūṭa vistāram guṇa aṃśam koṣṭha dīrghakam
translated: Then, having divided the space up to the end of the layout string into nine parts,🔽one part should be the width of the peak, one part should be the length of the room,

analyzed: eka aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam sārdha aṃśam
translated: one part should be the width of the window, and half a part should be the space between the cornices.

analyzed: śālā madhye mahā nāsī nīvram tad ardha bhāgayā  /
translated: In the middle of the hall, there should be a large seat with a threshold of half a part.

original: ūrdhvabhūmyaṣṭabhāge tu kūṭamaṃśena kalpayet /🔽śālā taddviguṇāyāmaṃ śivāṃśaṃ paṃjaraṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: ūrdhva bhūmi aṣṭa bhāge tu kūṭam aṃśena kalpayet 🔽śālā tad dviguṇa āyāmam śiva aṃśam paṃjaram bhavet
translated: In the upper floor, which is divided into eight parts, the peak should be made with one part,🔽the hall should be two parts long, and the window should be one part.

analyzed: śeṣam bhāra antaram ca ūrdhve bhūta aṃśam rasa bhājite
translated: The remaining space above is the upper floor. The bhūta portion is divided by rasa.

analyzed: kūṭam ekena kartavyam koṣṭham tad dviguṇa āyatam
translated: The peak should be made with one part, the courtyard should be twice as long as that.

analyzed: ardha aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: The width of the window is half the part, the remaining is the space between the pillars.

original: ūrdhve bhūmistadardhaṃ tu madhye daṇḍena nirgatiḥ // //🔽caturaṣṭāśra vṛttābhaṃ kūṭānāṃ śīrṣakaṃ kramāt /
analyzed: ūrdhve bhūmiḥ tad ardham tu madhye daṇḍena nirgatiḥ  catur aṣṭa aśra vṛtta ābham kūṭānām śīrṣakam kramāt
translated: The floor above is half of that, and the exit in the middle is with a pole.🔽The top of the peaks is in the form of a square, octagon, and circle respectively.
The courtyard is like a cucumber, the top of the mansion is in the shape of an octagon.

analyzed: mahānāsi aṣṭaka upetam śīrṣakam parikalpayet
translated: The top should be designed with eight large openings.

original: ravikoṣṭhaṃ ca kūṭaṃ ca ravidviguṇapaṃjaram // //🔽prāgivoccāṃśamānaṃ tu bhadrakoṣṭhamidaṃ param /
analyzed: ravi koṣṭham ca kūṭam ca ravi dviguṇa paṃjaram  prāk iva ucca aṃśa mānam tu bhadrakoṣṭham idam param
translated: The courtyard and peak are of the size of the sun, and the window is twice the size of the sun.

original: gehavyāsaṃ tu dharmāṃśaṃ kṛtvā nālīgrahaṃ catuḥ // //🔽grahapiṃḍyaṃśamānena alindaṃ caikabhāgayā /
analyzed: gehavyāsam tu dharma aṃśam kṛtvā nālī graham catuḥ  graha piṃḍī aṃśa mānena alindam ca eka bhāgayā
translated: The width of the house is divided by dharma, and the pole is divided into four.🔽The courtyard is one part, and the portico is one part.

analyzed: hāra vyāsam śiva aṃśena paritas parikalpayet
translated: The width of the pillar is one part of Śiva, and it should be designed all around.

analyzed: vinyāsa sūtrayoḥ antar vyāsāt dharma dvi bhājite
translated: Between the two lines of construction, divided by dharma,

analyzed: karṇakūṭam tad eka aṃśam koṣṭha āyāmam tu tad vayam
translated: one part is the peak and the courtyard is of the same size.

analyzed: ardha aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: The width of the windows should be half the width of the hall, and the remaining space should be the corridor.

analyzed: catuṣkūṭa aṣṭa koṣṭham ca paṃjaram bhānu saṃkhyayā
translated: The windows should have four corners and eight compartments, with the number of windows equal to the number of solar days.

analyzed: hāra antaram caturviṃśatī kalpayet prathame tale
translated: The corridor should be divided into twenty-four parts in the first floor.

original: alindaṃ jalapādāḍhyāt prastarāntaghanī kṛtam // //🔽ūrdhvaṃ tu vasubhāge tu śivāṃśaṃ kūṭavistṛtam /
analyzed: alindam jala pāda āḍhyāt prastara anta ghanī kṛtam  ūrdhvam tu vasubhāge tu śiva aṃśam kūṭa vistṛtam
translated: The verandah should be made strong up to the water level and the plinth.🔽In the upper part, divided into eight parts, the width of the corner should be one part.

original: koṣṭhaṃ taddviguṇāyāmaṃ paṃjaraṃ cāṃśamānakam // //🔽śeṣaṃ hārāntaraṃ khyātaṃ cordhve vasubhājite /
analyzed: koṣṭham tad dviguṇa āyāmam paṃjaram ca aṃśa mānakam  śeṣam hāra antaram khyātam ca ūrdhve vasu bhājite
translated: The compartment should be twice that in length, and the window should be one part in size.🔽The remaining space is known as the corridor. In the upper part, divided into eight parts,

original: kūṭaṃ bhāgena kartavyaṃ koṣṭhaṃ taddviguṇāyatam // //🔽śeṣaṃ hārāntaraṃ khyātaṃ kṣudrapaṃjarasaṃyutam /
analyzed: kūṭam bhāgena kartavyam koṣṭham tad dviguṇa āyatam  śeṣam hāra antaram khyātam kṣudra paṃjara saṃyutam
translated: the corner should be made one part, and the compartment should be twice that in length.🔽The remaining space is known as the corridor, along with small windows.

original: ūrdhvabhūmaṃ tribhāgaikaṃ madhye daṇḍena nirgamam // //🔽caturaśramadhiṣṭhānaṃ aṣṭāśraṃ mastakaṃ galam /🔽śikhare'ṣṭamahānāsī pādaṃ pratyalpanāsikā // //
analyzed: ūrdhva bhūmam tri bhāga ekam madhye daṇḍena nirgamam  catur aśram adhiṣṭhānam aṣṭa aśram mastakam galam  śikhara iṣṭa mahā nāsī pādam prati alpa nāsikā
translated: The upper floor should be one-third, with an exit in the middle by a pole.🔽The plinth should be square, the neck and head octagonal.🔽On the peak, there should be eight large windows, and small windows on each side.

original: karṇakūṭaṃ tu bhānuḥ syāt koṣṭhaṃ ṣoḍaśabhiryutam /
analyzed: karṇakūṭam tu bhānuḥ syāt koṣṭham ṣoḍaśabhiḥ yutam
translated: The corner should be equal to the number of solar days, and the compartment should be endowed with sixteen.

analyzed: natam kūṭa unnatam koṣṭham antara prastara anvitam
translated: The corner should be inclined, the compartment raised, and provided with an intermediate plinth.

analyzed: kṣudranīḍa aṣṭaviṃśaḥ syāt nānāmasūrakāṃghri ca
translated: The small nest should be twenty-eight, with various masura feet.

analyzed: nānā alaṃkāra saṃyuktam nānā jālaka toraṇaiḥ
translated: Equipped with various ornaments, with various nets and arches.

original: nānācitraṃ vicitraṃ tu tuṃbhabhāgaṃ tu pūrvavat /
analyzed: nānā citram vicitram tu tuṃbha bhāgam tu pūrvavat
translated: Various pictures, various, the tambha part is the same as before.

analyzed: jayāvaham idam khyātam sarva deva arhakam param
translated: This is known as Jayavah, the supreme worthy of all gods.

analyzed: tat eva vartulam karṇam śīrṣakam sārvakāmikam
translated: That itself is the circular ear, the headpiece, fulfilling all desires.

analyzed: tat eva antaram aṃcam syāt kūṭa koṣṭham ca paṃjaram
translated: That itself should be the inner platform, the peak, the chamber, and the window.

original: kūṭānāṃ śīrṣakaṃ sthūpī kumbhaṃ karṇaṃ ca vartulam /
analyzed: kūṭānām śīrṣakam sthūpī kumbham karṇam ca vartulam
translated: The head of the peaks, the stupa, the pot, and the ear are circular.

analyzed: evam syāt mūlabhūmam tu vasvaśram madhyame tale   /
translated: Thus, the ground floor should be in the shape of a swastika, and the middle floor in the shape of a cross.

analyzed: ca ūrdhva bhūmau tu karṇakūṭam prakalpayet
translated: On the upper floor, one should plan the peak and the ear in the shape of a cross.

analyzed: sukha āvaham idam khyātam sarva deva arhakam param

analyzed: tat eva kūṭa koṣṭham ca antara prastaram vinā

analyzed: sahyoḥ ca sama sūtram tu tat avyaya gṛham bhavet

analyzed: tat eva śikharam karṇam yugāśram dhātṛka antakam

translated: Thus ends the twenty-ninth chapter on the rules for four-storied buildings in the Kashyapa Sastra.

analyzed: evam ādi tale kuryāt dharā talam
translated: Thus, the ground floor should be made, and above it,

analyzed: vaidika ūrdhve samam vā atha sa antara prastara anvitam
translated: If above the Vedic, or equal, or endowed with an interval and a layer.

translated: That height should be divided by the number of Rudras, and one part is the height of the platform.🔽The height of the foot is one and a half parts, and the pedestal is two parts less by one.

analyzed: sthūpī utsedham sa pāda aṃśam kramaśas parikalpayet
translated: The height of the stupa should be one and a half parts, and it should be conceived in order.

analyzed: evam hi kūṭa koṣṭhau dvau kalpayet kalpa vittamaḥ  bhavet

analyzed: vedāśram vasu koṇam vā vṛtta ābham vā galam śiraḥ
translated: The height of the tower should be one-third, one-fourth, or one-fifth of the total height, and the height of the porch should be one-third of that.

analyzed: nāgara ādi ucitam kalpya karṇakūṭam viśeṣataḥ
translated: The ear-pendants should be especially made suitable for the Nāgaras and others.

analyzed: śālānām pārśvayoḥ vipra lalāṭa ākhyāḥ anu nāsikāḥ  śālāyāḥ tu viśālam tu ratnatāmukha paṭṭikā  sthūpya agra samam proktam lalāṭa nāsya agra sīmakam

analyzed: śālā dīrgham tri bhāga ekam mukha nāsī viśālakam

analyzed: kūṭānām nāsikā nīvram mahā nāsī vat ācaret  /

analyzed: sthūpi traya samāyuktam nāgare bhavanam dvija
translated: O Brahmin! A building in the Nagara style should have three domes.

analyzed: śālānām drāviḍānām tu sthūpiḥ aśvini saṃkhyayā
translated: For Dravida-style halls, there should be as many domes as there are halls.

original: śālānāṃ vesarāṇāṃ tu sthūpyekaṃ vā catuṣṭayam /
analyzed: śālānām vesarāṇām tu sthūpī ekam vā catuṣṭayam
translated: For Vaisnava-style halls, there should be one or four domes.

analyzed: gala aṃśe kūṭa koṣṭhānām devatā ādyāḥ tu kalpayet  /
translated: In the neck portion, one should design the turrets, chambers, and deities, etc.

analyzed: evam hi kūṭa koṣṭham syāt paṃjarāḥ tu adhunā ucyate
translated: Thus, there will be turrets and chambers. Now, the lattices are described.

analyzed: upānāt uttara antam tu nava bhāga vibhājite
translated: When the space from the base to the top is divided into nine parts,

analyzed: upa pīṭham atha aṃśena pakṣa aṃśam tu dharā talam  veda aṃśam caraṇāyāmam maṃcam adhyardha bhāgayā
translated: the pedestal should be one part, the ground level should be one and a half parts,

analyzed: ardha aṃśam vedikā mānam kapota antam gala udayam
translated: the height of the plinth should be one part, the height of the base should be one and a half parts,🔽the height of the platform should be half a part, and the height of the neck should be up to the end of the dovetail.

analyzed: prati vājana sīmāntam paṃjara uccam udāhṛtam
translated: The height of the window is said to be up to the boundary of the outer wall.

analyzed: prāsādasya ca bāhye tu yathā śobhā aṃśa nirgatiḥ  paṃjaram nāsikā ākāram kūṭa koṣṭha ākṛtiḥ tu vā
translated: Outside the palace, the projection should be according to the proportion of beauty.🔽The window should be shaped like a nose or a pavilion.

analyzed: śālā madhyeṃśa mānena daṇḍa mānena nirgatiḥ

analyzed: bhadra kāntam iti khyātam kūṭa koṣṭhau dvayau samau
translated: The one known as Bhadrakanta has two equal ridges and chambers.

original: p / samaṃcaṃ vā vimaṃcaṃ vā janārdanagṛhaṃ bhavet /🔽tadeva koṣṭhamadhye tu bhadrahīnamathāpi vā // //
analyzed: samaṃcam vā vimaṃcam vā janārdana gṛham bhavet  tat eva koṣṭha madhye tu bhadra hīnam atha api vā
translated: It may have a platform or no platform, and be Janardana's house.🔽That itself with a chamber in the middle, or even without a Bhadra,

analyzed: madhyabhadra yutam vā api maṇḍalam śīrṣakam galam
translated: Or with a central Bhadra, a top, and a neck,

analyzed: ati bhadram iti khyātam sarva deva arhakam param
translated: Is known as Atibhadra, the best worthy of all gods.

original: tadeva kūṭakoṣṭhaṃ ca paṃjaraṃ ca samaṃcakam /
analyzed: tat eva kūṭa koṣṭham ca paṃjaram ca sa maṃcakam
translated: That itself with a ridge and chamber, and a window with a platform,

analyzed: sa unnatam sarvatobhadram mama prīti karam bhavet  /
translated: Raised on all sides, would be pleasing to me.

original: vimānaṃ kūṭakoṣṭhaṃ ca paṃjaraṃ samasūtrakam /🔽nānādhiṣṭhānasaṃyuktaṃ nānāpādairalaṃkṛtam // //
analyzed: vimānam kūṭa koṣṭham ca paṃjaram sama sūtrakam  nānā adhiṣṭhāna saṃyuktam nānā pādaiḥ alaṃkṛtam
translated: The temple with a ridge and chamber, and a window with equal threads,🔽Equipped with various foundations, adorned with various feet,

analyzed: nānā alaṃkāra saṃyuktam yugma paṃjara saṃyutam
translated: Equipped with various ornaments, with a pair of windows,

analyzed: śikhara iṣṭa alpa nāsya āḍhyam mahā nāsī catuṣṭayam
translated: The four sides should be large, with a small peak and a large face.

analyzed: vibhadram iti vikhyātam sarva deva priya āvaham
translated: It is known as Vibhdra, which brings delight to all gods.

original: tadevāṣṭakaśālāḍhyaṃ ādibhūmau dvibhāgayā // //🔽bhānupaṃjarasaṃyuktaṃ śeṣaṃ prāgiva kalpayet /
analyzed: tat eva aṣṭaka śālā āḍhyam ādi bhūmau dvi bhāgayā  bhānu paṃjara saṃyuktam śeṣam prāk iva kalpayet
translated: That itself, endowed with an octagonal hall, in the first floor with two parts,🔽along with a window for the sun, the rest should be designed as before.

analyzed: prāc ukta nāmam ākhyātam tāsu iṣṭam parikalpayet
translated: The names mentioned earlier should be given to them, and the desired one should be adopted.

analyzed: paṃca bhūmiḥ samākhyātā ṣaṭtalam ca adhunā śṛṇu
translated: The five-storied building is described. Now listen to the six-storied one.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape paṃcatalavidhi paṭalaḥ ekatriṃśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-first chapter on the procedure of the five-storied building in the Kashyapa school of architecture.

original: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa ṣaḍbhūme'stu vidhiṃ param /
analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa ṣaṣ bhūmeḥ tu vidhim param
translated: Now I shall explain in particular the supreme procedure for the six-storied building.

analyzed: tasya vistāra tuṃgam tu prāsāda māna vat bhavet  /
translated: Its width and height should be like the measurements of the palace.

analyzed: vistāram rudradhā bhajya guṇa aṃśam garbha gehakam
translated: The width should be divided by Rudra, and one-sixth part should be the inner sanctum.

analyzed: dvi bhāgam gṛhapiṃḍī syāt aliṃdam śaśi bhāgayā
translated: The courtyard should be two parts, and the porch should be one-sixth part.

analyzed: śiva aṃśa mānena vai varṣasthalam bhavet
translated: The balcony should be of Shiva's measure, and the terrace should be of the same height as the balcony.

analyzed: dharā talaḥ dvi tri bhūmau devatā sthāpanam bhavet  /
translated: In the first and second floors, the installation of deities should be done.

analyzed: devatā sthāpanam yatra tāvat vai su dṛḍham ghanam
translated: Where the installation of deities is done, it should be very strong and firm.

analyzed: bāhye tri piśilā ākāram bhavana abhyantaram bhavet
translated: Outside, it should have the shape of a triangle, and inside, it should be a house.

analyzed: catuṣkūṭa aṣṭa koṣṭham ca bhānu paṃjara saṃyutam
translated: With four corners and eight compartments, along with a sun-chamber,

analyzed: hāra antaram caturviṃśat kalpayet ādi bhū tale
translated: The space between the beams should be divided into twenty-four parts, and one should first mark the ground.

original: paṃjaraṃ harmya madhye tu karṇe tu sauṣṭikaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: paṃjaram harmya madhye tu karṇe tu sauṣṭikam bhavet
translated: In the middle of the palace, there should be a sun-chamber, and in the corners, there should be a balcony.

original: pārśvayoḥ karṇakūṭasya paṃjaraṃ parikalpayet // //🔽koṣṭhapaṃjarayormadhye kalpayettu viśeṣataḥ /🔽tadūrdhve bhūdaśāṃśe tu vyomāṃśaṃ karṇakūṭakam // //
analyzed: pārśvayoḥ karṇakūṭasya paṃjaram parikalpayet  koṣṭha paṃjarayoḥ madhye kalpayet tu viśeṣataḥ  tad ūrdhve bhū daśa aṃśe tu vyoma aṃśam karṇakūṭakam
translated: One should imagine a sun-chamber on the sides of the corner towers.🔽In the middle between the compartments and the sun-chamber, one should especially imagine🔽above it, in the ten parts of the ground, the corner towers should be one part of the sky.

analyzed: madhye paṃjaram eka aṃśam karṇakūṭam athā kṛtiḥ
translated: In the middle, the sun-chamber should be one part, and the corner towers should be of the same size.

original: dvibhāgaṃ koṣṭhadīrghaṃ syāt ardhāṃśaṃ paṃjarasya tu // //
analyzed: dvi bhāgam koṣṭha dīrgham syāt ardha aṃśam paṃjarasya tu
translated: The length of the compartments should be two parts, and the sun-chamber should be half a part.

analyzed: śeṣam hāra antaram khyātam eṣām saṃkhyā ati bhūṣitān
translated: The remaining space is known as the space between the beams, adorned with these measurements.

original: tasyordhve bhūviśālaṃ tu navabhāgavibhājite // //🔽karṇakūṭamathāṃśena madhye śālāguṇāṃśakam /🔽paṃjaravyāsamekāṃśaṃ ardhāṃśaṃ hārayottare // //
analyzed: tasya ūrdhve bhū viśālam tu nava bhāga vibhājite  / karṇakūṭam atha aṃśena madhye śālāguṇa aṃśakam  paṃjara vyāsam eka aṃśam ardha aṃśam hāraya uttare
translated: Above it, the ground should be divided into nine parts.🔽The corner towers should be one part, and in the middle, the hall should be five parts.🔽The diameter of the sun-chamber should be one part, and the space between the beams should be half a part.

original: p / ūrdhva bhūrvasu bhāge tu śivāṃśaṃ kūṭavistṛtam /
analyzed: ūrdhva bhūrvasu bhāge tu śiva aṃśam kūṭa vistṛtam
translated: Above, the ground should be divided into eight parts, and the width of the towers should be one part of Shiva.

analyzed: madhye koṣṭham dvi bhāgena eka aṃśam paṃjaraḥ tathā
translated: The central chamber should be two parts, and the window should be one part.

analyzed: hāsa ntaram atha ardha aṃśam kalpayet kalpa vittamaḥ
translated: The space between the windows should be half a part. This should be determined by the best of those who know the Kalpa (ritual procedures).

analyzed: tasya ūrdhve bhūmi vistāram ṣaṣ bhāgam vibhajet samam
translated: Above it, the width of the ground should be divided equally into six parts.

original: kūṭamekāṃśamānena koṣṭhāyāmaṃ tu taddvayam /🔽ardhāṃśaṃ paṃjaravyāsaṃ śeṣaṃ hārāntaraṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: kūṭam eka aṃśa mānena koṣṭha āyāmam tu tat dvayam  ardha aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: The height of the pinnacle should be one part, and the width of the chamber should be two parts.🔽The width of the window should be half a part, and the remaining space should be the space between the windows.

analyzed: tad ūrdhve ūrdhva vistārāt ardha aṃśam madhyabhadrakam
translated: Above it, from the width above, half a part should be the central auspicious chamber.

analyzed: daṇḍam vā adhyardha daṇḍam vā dvi daṇḍam bhadranīvrakam
translated: The auspicious chamber should be one daṇḍa, one and a half daṇḍas, or two daṇḍas in width.

original: tuṃgaṃ sarvatra paṃcāśat aṃśaṃ kṛtvā tu deśikaḥ /🔽adhiṣṭhānocchrayaṃ cāgniṣaḍbhāgaṃ caraṇodayam // //
analyzed: tuṃgam sarvatra paṃcāśat aṃśam kṛtvā tu deśikaḥ  adhiṣṭhāna ucchrayam ca agni ṣaṣ bhāgam caraṇa udayam
translated: The preceptor should divide the height of the temple into fifty parts.

analyzed: pāda hīna agni bhāgam tu maṃca mānam udāhṛtam
translated: The height of the plinth should be six parts of the fire (i.e. six-twelfths of the total height), and the height of the base should be one part of the fire (i.e. one-twelfth of the total height).🔽The height of the platform is said to be one part less than the fire (i.e. five-twelfths of the total height).

analyzed: sārdha paṃca aṃśam maṃcam dvi bhāgayā
translated: The height of the platform should be one and a half parts, and the height of the base should be two parts.

original: pādādhikaṃ tu paṃcāṃśaṃ pādāyāmamiti smṛtam /🔽sārdhadvibhāgamaṃcoccaṃ paṃcāṃśaṃ caraṇodayam // //
analyzed: pāda adhikam tu paṃca aṃśam pāda āyāmam iti smṛtam  sārdha dvi bhāgam aṃca uccam paṃca aṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: The height of the base is said to be five parts, one part more.🔽The height of the platform should be two parts and a half, and the height of the base should be five parts.

analyzed: pāda adhika dvi bhāgam tu prastara udayam īritam
translated: The height of the beam is said to be two parts and a half, one part more.

original: pādahīnaṃ tu paṃcāṃśaṃ talipasyodayaṃ bhavet // //🔽dvibhāgaṃ prastaraṃ khyātaṃ ardhādhikayugāṃśakam /🔽pādāyāmamidaṃ khyātaṃ pādona dvyaṃśamaṃcakam // //
analyzed: pāda hīnam tu paṃca aṃśam bhavet  dvi bhāgam prastaram khyātam ardha adhika yuga aṃśakam  pāda āyāmam idam khyātam dvi aṃśam aṃcakam
translated: The rise of the talip should be five parts less than that,🔽The plinth is known to be two parts, with the height of the pillar being one and a half times that.🔽This is known as the foot length, with the platform being one and a half parts less than that.

analyzed: vyoma aṃśam vedikā mānam dvi aṃśakam galam
translated: The height of the base is one part, with the neck being one and a half parts less than that.

analyzed: sārdha veda aṃśa mānam tu śīrṣakam parikalpayet
translated: The top portion should be designed to be one and a half parts of the base.

analyzed: śikhare tu mahānāsī catvāri parikalpayet
translated: In the pinnacle, four large projections should be conceived.

analyzed: ambujāsanam ākhyātam sarva deva priya āvaham
translated: This is known as the lotus seat, which brings about the love of all gods.

analyzed: tat eva śikharam kaṇṭham vasvaśram parikalpayet
translated: That same pinnacle and neck should be conceived as having a cross-shaped base.

original: aśeṣa sauṣṭikānāṃ tu śīrṣaṃ vai caturaśrakam // //
analyzed: aśeṣa sauṣṭikānām tu śīrṣam vai caturaśrakam
translated: The top of all the auspicious houses should be square.

analyzed: unnata avanataḥ vā api bhadram vā bhadrakoṣṭhakam
translated: It may be raised or lowered, auspicious or with auspicious chambers,

analyzed: sāntara prastara upetam hīnam vā api sama unnatam
translated: with an intermediate plinth, or even lower with an even height.

analyzed: su śāṃkaram idam khyātam tat vai sauṣṭika śīrṣakam
translated: This is known as the very auspicious, and that is the top of the auspicious house.

analyzed: vṛtta ākāram prakartavyam nāmnā bhadravalīnakam
translated: It should be made in a circular shape, and is named the Bhadravali.

analyzed: tat eva śikhare ca aṣṭau alpa nāsī yugam udbhavā
translated: In that same pinnacle, there are eight small projections arising in pairs.

analyzed: śiva bhadram idam khyātam śiva prīti karam param
translated: This is known as Shiva's auspicious, supremely pleasing.

analyzed: tat eva dvi aśra vṛtta ābham śīrṣakam gala saṃyutam
translated: That itself, with a two-sided circular top, along with a neck,

analyzed: mukhe lalāṭa nāsā āḍhyam nāga indram iti saṃjñitam
translated: Endowed with a face, forehead, and nose, is known as the king of serpents.

analyzed: ṣaṣ bhūmi evam samākhyātam sapta bhūmam atha upari
translated: Thus, the six-storied [temple] is described. Now, above, the seven-storied [temple].

analyzed: iti aṃśumānkāśyape ṣaḍbhūmividhāna paṭalaḥ dvātriṃśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-second chapter on the rules for the six-storied [temple] in the Kashyapa section of the Mayamata.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa sapta bhūmeḥ tu lakṣaṇam
translated: Now, I shall describe in particular the characteristics of the seven-storied [temple].

original: prāsādamānavidhinā vāsodayaṃ parikalpayet // //🔽p / ravyaṃśaṃ vibhajettāraṃ vedāṃśaṃ garbhagehakam /
analyzed: parikalpayet  ravi aṃśam vibhajet tāram veda aṃśam garbha gehakam
translated: One should determine the height of the dwelling according to the rules for the measurement of the temple.🔽The height of the temple should be divided by six, the central part by four, the walls by one part, and the portico by one part.

analyzed: pakṣa aṃśam bhitti viṣkambham ekena alindam iṣyate  hāra antaram atha aṃśena paritas parikalpayet
translated: The space between the walls should be determined all around by one part.

analyzed: vinyāsa sūtrayoḥ antara bhānu aṃśam vibhajet samam
translated: The space between the two lines of construction should be divided equally by the number of parts of the sun.

analyzed: eka aṃśam kūṭa vistāram koṣṭham guṇāyatam
translated: One part should be the width of the central block, the chamber should be three parts long,

analyzed: paṃjara vyāsam eka aṃśam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: the width of the window should be one part, and the remaining space should be the space between the walls.

analyzed: catuṣkūṭa aṣṭa śālā ca paṃjaram bhānu saṃkhyayā
translated: It should have four central blocks and eight chambers, and the windows should be as numerous as the digits of the sun.

analyzed: tasya ūrdhve bhūmi vistāram dharma bhāga vibhājite
translated: Above that, the area of the floor should be divided into dharma parts.

analyzed: karṇakūṭam ca koṣṭham ca pūrvavat parikalpayet
translated: The angular tower and the chamber should be conceived as before.

analyzed: paṃjara vyāsam ardha aṃśam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: The width of the window should be half a part, and the remaining space should be the interval between the windows.

analyzed: tasya ūrdhva bhūmi vistāram pūrvavat dharma bhājite
translated: The area of the floor above that should be divided into dharma parts as before.

analyzed: paṃjaram kūṭa koṣṭham ca tadvat eva vidhīyate
translated: The window, angular tower, and chamber should be done in the same way.

original: ūrdhvabhūmi navāṃśe tu madhye śālāgni bhāgayā /
analyzed: ūrdhvabhūmi nava aṃśe tu madhye śālāgni bhāgayā
translated: In the ninth part of the upper floor, the hall should be two parts in the middle.

original: vyomāṃśaṃ karṇakūṭaṃ syāt ekāṃśaṃ paṃjarastatam // //🔽hārāntaramathārdhāṃśaṃ tasyordhve vasubhājite /
analyzed: vyoma aṃśam karṇakūṭam syāt eka aṃśam paṃjaraḥ tatam  hāra antaram atha ardha aṃśam tasya ūrdhve vasu bhājite
translated: The angular tower should be one part, and the window should extend for one part.🔽Then, in the half part above that, the interval between the windows should be one part.

analyzed: madhye śālā dvi bhāgena śeṣam pūrvavat ācaret  /
translated: In the middle, the hall should be two parts, and the rest should be done as before.

analyzed: tad ūrdhve bhūmi vistāram rasa bhāga vibhājite  kūṭam eka aṃśam iti uktam śālā tad viguṇā ayam
translated: The area of the floor above that should be divided into ten parts.🔽It is said that the angular tower should be one part, and the hall should be twice that.

analyzed: ardha aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: The width of the window should be half a part, and the remaining space should be the interval between the windows.

analyzed: ūrdhva bhūmi agni bhāga ekam madhye daṇḍena nirgamam
translated: In the upper floor, one part of the hall should emerge in the middle with a staff.

analyzed: sa saptaṣaṣṭi bhāgam tu kartavyam sadana udayam
translated: The height of the building should be made one sixty-seventh part.

analyzed: sa pāda agnim adhiṣṭhānam sārdha ṣaṭka aṃghri tuṃgakam
translated: The plinth should be one-fourth of the height, and the height of the pedestal should be six and a half aṅgulas.

analyzed: tad ardham tu ṣaṣ bhāgam caraṇa udayam
translated: The height of the platform should be half of that, and the height of the foot should be six parts.

analyzed: sa tri pāda dvi bhāgam tu maṃcamānam udāhṛtam
translated: It is said that the height of the platform should be two and a third parts.

analyzed: sārdha bhūta aṃśam aṃghri uccam sārdha dvi aṃśam tu prastaram
translated: The height of the foot should be one and a half parts, the height of the pedestal should be two parts,

original: sapādaṃ paṃcabhāgaṃ tu staṃbhamānamudīritam // //🔽prastāraṃ cārdhapaṃcāṃśaṃ bhūtāṃśaṃ caraṇodayam /
analyzed: sa pādam paṃca bhāgam tu staṃbhamānam udīritam  prastāram ca ardhapaṃca aṃśam bhūtāṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: and the height of the pillar is said to be five parts with one-fourth added.🔽The height of the pedestal should be five parts with one-fourth added, the height of the foot should be one part,

analyzed: sa pāda dvi bhāgam aṃcam syāt sa tri pāda yuga aṃśakam
translated: and the height of the platform should be two parts with one-fourth added, and the height of the platform should be two and a half parts.

original: caraṇodayamityuktaṃ prastaroccaṃ dvibhāgayā /🔽pādoccaṃ sārdhavedāṃśaṃ pādona dvyaṃśamaṃcakam // //
analyzed: caraṇa udayam iti uktam prastara uccam dvi bhāgayā
translated: The height of the pedestal is said to be two parts, and the height of the pedestal should be two parts.🔽The height of the foot is one and a half parts, and the height of the platform is two parts with one-fourth subtracted.
The height of the base is one part, and the height of the neck is two parts with one-fourth subtracted.

analyzed: ardha adhika yuga aṃśam tu śīrṣaka udayam iṣyate  /
translated: The height of the head is considered to be two and a half parts with half added.

original: pakṣāṃśaṃ sthūpimānaṃ tu gaṇyaṃ saptatalaṃ viduḥ /🔽paṃjaraṃ kūṭa koṣṭhaṃ ca samasūtre tu kalpitam // //
analyzed: pakṣa aṃśam sthūpi mānam tu gaṇyam sapta talam viduḥ  paṃjaram kūṭa koṣṭham ca sama sūtre tu kalpitam
translated: The height of the stupa should be one-seventh part, and the seven-storied (stupa) is known.🔽The windows, turrets, and chambers are designed on the same line.

analyzed: homāt agram tu śikhare veda nāsikā
translated: The pinnacle is square from the fire altar, and the nose of the pinnacle is at the top.

analyzed: śālā ṣaṭtriṃśatiḥ yuktam
translated: The hall should be thirty-six cubits long, with a ridge double that,

analyzed: ṣaṣṭi paṃjara saṃyuktam pādam prati alpa nāsikā
translated: with sixty windows, and a small nose on each side.

analyzed: nānā adhiṣṭhāna saṃyuktam eka ākāram atha api vā
translated: It should be connected with various foundations, or of a single form.

analyzed: eka aneka ākṛtiḥ vā aṃghri samujvalanam udāhṛtam
translated: The foot with a single or multiple shape is said to be radiant.

analyzed: tat eva unnata kūṭāḥ syuḥ sāntara prastara anvitam
translated: That itself should have elevated ridges, with an interval and a lintel.

analyzed: śrīchandasam iti khyātam sarva deva arhakam param
translated: That is known as the Shri Chhanda meter, supreme and worthy of all gods.

analyzed: tat eva nata kūṭam ca koṣṭha unnata samaṃcakāḥ
translated: That itself with bent ridges, with storied chambers elevated,

original: śrīviśālamiti khyātaṃ sarvadevapriyāvaham /🔽tadeva śīrṣaṃ karṇaṃ ca śraṃ vedikāyatam // //🔽śrīkāntamiti vikhyātaṃ kūṭakoṣṭhasamaṃ tu vā /
analyzed: śrīviśālam iti khyātam sarva deva priya āvaham  tat eva śīrṣam karṇam ca   śram vedikā āyatam    śrīkāntam iti vikhyātam kūṭa koṣṭha samam tu vā
translated: is known as the Shri Vishala, which brings about the love of all gods.🔽That itself with a sloping ridge and eaves, with a platform extending to the eaves,🔽is known as the Shri Kanta, or with equal ridges and storied chambers.

analyzed: samam ca unnata kūṭam vā śrī pradam tat udāhṛtam
translated: Equal or with elevated ridges, it is said to bestow prosperity.

analyzed: tat eva vṛtta śikharam sthūpiḥ ca eva galam tathā
translated: That itself with a circular pinnacle, with a stupa and a neck,

translated: That itself with sloping ridges, with a square, octagonal, or circular

analyzed: tat eva unnata kūṭam ca nata lālā samanvitam

analyzed: kūṭānām mastakam vṛttam su vṛttam iti vidyate

analyzed: sa unnatam kūṭa koṣṭham ca paṃjara antara maṃcakam

analyzed: dvi daṇḍam vā atha niṣka antam bhadram vā bhadra paṃjaram

translated: Equipped with various foundations, adorned with various feet,

analyzed: nānā citraiḥ vicitram tu śiva saukhyam udāhṛtam

analyzed: paṃjaram kūṭa koṣṭham ca antaram prastara anvitam

analyzed: yathā iṣṭa śikhara ākāram śrī pratiṣṭhitam ucyate
translated: The shape of the peak as desired is said to be Śrīpratiṣṭhita.

analyzed: evam sapta talam khyātam vasu bhaumam atha ucyate
translated: Thus, the seven-storied building is known. Now, the Vasubhūmi is being told.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape sapta bhūmi vidhāna paṭalaḥ trayastriṃśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-third chapter on the procedure of seven-storied buildings in the Āṃśumat Kāśyapa.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa vasu bhūmi vidhim param
translated: Now, I shall describe in particular the supreme procedure of Vasubhūmi.

analyzed: prāsāda māna vidhinā saṃgrāhyam visṛta udayam

analyzed: trayodaśa vibhāgam tu kṛtvā prāsāda vistṛtam
translated: Having divided the expanse of the palace into thirteen parts,

analyzed: bhūta aṃśam garbha geham tu dvi bhāgam gṛha piṇḍikā
translated: the Garbhagṛha should be one part, the Gṛhapindī two parts,

analyzed: alindam ca eka bhāgena hārāḥ bhāgena kalpayet

analyzed: athavā nava bhāgena garbhageham vidhīyate

analyzed: bhāgena gṛhapiṇḍī syāt alindam ca eka bhāgayā
translated: The Gṛhapindī should be one part, and the Alipta one part.

analyzed: kuḍyam ekena kartavyam alindam tu śiva aṃśakam  /
translated: The Kuḍya should be made one part, and the Alipta one part of Śiva.

analyzed: śaśi bhāgena hārā syāt kalpyā evam dvijasattama
translated: The Hāra should be one part of Śaśi. O best of the twice-born, it should be thus measured.

analyzed: vinyāsa sūtrayoḥ ante trayodaśa vibhājite
translated: When the space between the two lines of measurement is divided into thirteen parts,

analyzed: kūṭam eka aṃśam iti uktam koṣṭha dīrgham dvi bhāgayā
translated: the Kūṭa is said to be one part, and the length of the Koṣṭha two parts.

analyzed: tri bhāgam madhya koṣṭham syāt śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet

analyzed: tad ardham paṃjara vyāsam bhadram vā abhadraḥ eva vā
translated: Half of that is the width of the window, it may have a Bhadra (niche) or not.

analyzed: bhānu koṣṭham catuṣkūṭam kalā paṃjara saṃyutam
translated: The chamber should have four corners, be endowed with a Kalpa window.

analyzed: hāra antaram tu dvātriṃśat kalpayet ādi bhū tale

analyzed: varṣasthalam alīndam syāt prastara antam ghanīkṛtam
translated: The ground floor should be solid up to the threshold, the rest should be solid up to the beams.

analyzed: tad ūrdhva bhūmi vistāram trayodaśa vibhājite
translated: The width of the floor above that, divided by thirteen,

analyzed: kūṭa koṣṭha ādi sarva aṃgam ādi bhūmim iva eva tu
translated: all the parts like the turrets and chambers should be like the first floor.

original: tasyordhva bhū viśālaṃ tu bhānubhāgavibhājite /🔽karṇakūṭaṃ tadekāṃśaṃ śālādīrghaṃ dvibhāgayā // //
analyzed: tasya ūrdhva viśālam tu bhānu bhāga vibhājite  karṇakūṭam tad eka aṃśam śālā dīrgham dvi bhāgayā
translated: The width of the floor above that, divided by twelve parts,🔽one part should be for the angular turrets, the length of the halls should be two parts.

analyzed: ardha aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam śeṣam hāra antaram bhavet
translated: Half a part should be the width of the windows, the remaining part should be the space between the beams.

analyzed: paṃjaram kūṭa koṣṭham ca saṃkhyā vādi tala ukta vat
translated: The windows, turrets and chambers should be as described in the first floor.

analyzed: tad ūrdhva bhū viśālam ca bhānu bhāga vibhājite  kūṭa koṣṭha ādi sarva aṃgam māna saṃkhyā eva pūrvavat
translated: The width of the floor above that, divided by twelve parts,🔽all the parts like the turrets and chambers should be as described earlier.

original: tadūrdhva bhūdaśāṃśe tu kūṭakoṣṭhaṃ ca pūrvavat /
analyzed: tad ūrdhva bhū daśa aṃśe tu kūṭa koṣṭham ca pūrvavat
translated: In the case of the floor above that, divided by ten parts, the turrets and chambers should be as before.

analyzed: hāra antaram atha ardha aṃśam lamba paṃjara saṃyutam

original: tadūrdhve bhūviśālaṃ tu vasubhāgavibhājite /🔽karṇakūṭaṃ tadekāṃśaṃ madhyeśālā dvibhāgayā // //
analyzed: tad ūrdhve bhū viśālam tu vasu bhāga vibhājite  karṇakūṭam tad eka aṃśam madhyeśālā dvi bhāgayā
translated: Above that, the width of the ground should be divided into eight parts.🔽The angular projection is one part, and the central hall is two parts.

analyzed: paṃjara vyāsam eka aṃśam ardha aṃśam
translated: The diameter of the window is one part, and the space between the hanging ornaments is half a part.

analyzed: catuṣkūṭam catur śālāḥ vasu paṃjara saṃyutam
translated: It has four angular projections and four halls, along with eight windows.

original: p / hārāntaraṃ kalā proktaṃ kalpyevaṃ ṣaṭtalaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: bhavet
translated: The space between the hanging ornaments is said to be one part. Thus, the six-storied building should be constructed.

analyzed: tad ūrdhve bhū viśālam tu ṣaṣ bhāgam vibhajet samam
translated: Above that, the width of the ground should be divided equally into six parts.

original: kūṭamekāṃśamityuktaṃ madhye koṣṭhaṃ dvibhāgayā /🔽ardhāṃśaṃ paṃjaravyāsaṃ śeṣaṃ hārāntaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: kūṭam eka aṃśam iti uktam madhye koṣṭham dvi bhāgayā  ardha aṃśam paṃjara vyāsam śeṣam hāra antam bhavet

analyzed: tad ūrdhve bhū viśāla ardham madhye daṇḍena nirgatiḥ

analyzed: kūṭāt koṣṭhaḥ tu nīvrāḥ vā madhyaśālā tu nīvrakam
translated: The angular projection or the chamber should be a Nivra, and the central hall should be a Nivraka.

analyzed: kūṭa koṣṭha viśeṣam tu sama sūtrakam eva vā
translated: The angular projection and the chamber should be either equal or of different sizes.

analyzed: sapta sapta tri bhāgena kṛtvā geha samucchrayam
translated: Having divided the height of the house into seven parts with three parts each,

analyzed: sārdha agi aṃśam adhiṣṭhānam sapta aṃśam caraṇa udayam
translated: the plinth is one and a half parts, and the rise of the base is seven parts.

original: prastaraṃ tu sa pādāgnisārdhaṣaṭkāṃghri tuṃgakam // //🔽maṃcamānaṃ guṇāṃśaṃ tu ṣaḍbhāgaṃ caraṇodayam /

analyzed: syāt sārdha bhūta aṃghri tuṃgakam  /
translated: The platform should be one-eighth less than the height of the fire, and the height of the feet should be one and a half parts.

original: sārdhadvibhāgamaṃcoccaṃ kalpayettu viśeṣataḥ /🔽sa pādaṃ paṃcabhāgaṃ tu caraṇodayamīritam // //🔽prastaraṃ sārdhapakṣāṃśaṃ bhūtāṃśaṃ caraṇodayam /

translated: The height of the platform should be two and a half parts, and it should be made especially.🔽The height of the feet is said to be one-fifth of the total height, with one-fourth added.🔽The platform should be one and a half parts, and the height of the feet should be four parts.

analyzed: sa pāda dvi bhāgam aṃcam syāt pādam
translated: The platform should be one-fourth less than two parts, and the height of the feet should be five parts.

original: maṃcamānaṃ dvibhāgaṃ tu pādaṃ sārdhayugāṃśakam /🔽sa tripādāṃśamaṃcoccaṃ vyomāṃśaṃ vedikodayam // //
analyzed: dvi bhāgam tu pādam sārdha yuga aṃśakam  sa tri pāda aṃśam aṃca uccam vyoma aṃśam vedikā udayam
translated: The height of the platform should be two parts, and the height of the feet should be one and a half parts.🔽The height of the platform should be three and a half parts, and the height of the pedestal should be one part.

original: kaṇṭhaṃ pādona pakṣāṃśaṃ sārdhavedāṃśa śīrṣakam /🔽kaṇṭhamānasamaṃ sthūpī tuṃgamityeva mucyate // //
analyzed: kaṇṭham  kaṇṭha māna samam sthūpī tuṃgam iti eva mucyate  /

analyzed: sthūpi antam tad upānah ādi veda aśram parikalpayet
translated: From the end of the stupa up to the base, it should be designed as a square.

original: sauṣṭhyagraṃ ca yugāśraṃ syāt staṃbhaṃ pratyalpanāsikāḥ // //
analyzed: ca syāt staṃbham prati alpa nāsikāḥ
translated: The top of the eaves should be a rectangle, and the pillars should have small nostrils.

analyzed: śikhare tu catur nāsī yuktyā āste tu mahattaraḥ
translated: On the top, there should be four nostrils, which are the largest.

analyzed: eka ākāra talam staṃbham śivacchandam udāhṛtam
translated: The platform of one form is said to be the desire of Shiva.

analyzed: tat eva nata śālāḥ syuḥ sauṣṭikena tāḥ
