translated: It should be endowed with the upper parts of the feet inside, and be adorned with Mandara and others.

analyzed: dvāra ūrdhve raṃga saṃyuktam dvāram tat bhadra saṃyutam
translated: Above the door, it should have a stage, and the door should be endowed with auspiciousness.

analyzed: pūrve pare mahā nāsī pārśvayoḥ vaṃśa nāsikā
translated: On the other side in the east, there should be a great nose, and a ridge and a nose on the sides.

original: svastikā kṛtināsāḍhyaṃ catuṣpaṃjarasaṃyutam // //🔽kūṭakoṣṭhadisarvāṃgaṃ prāgukta vidhinā kuru /
analyzed: svastikā kṛti nāsā āḍhyam catur paṃjara saṃyutam  kūṭa koṣṭha di sarva aṃgam prāc ukta vidhinā kuru
translated: It should be endowed with a Svastika design and a nose, and have four cages.🔽The entire body, including the turrets and chambers, should be made according to the previously mentioned method.

analyzed: śrīkeśa alaṃkṛtam vakṣye bhūmi bhāga ādi pūrvavat
translated: I will describe the decoration with Shrikeshas, and the ground part etc. should be as before.

original: pūrve pare ca śālāyāṃ sabhadraṃ bhadranāsikā /
analyzed: pūrve pare ca śālāyām sa bhadram bhadra nāsikā
translated: In the east and on the other side of the hall, there should be auspiciousness and a beautiful nose.

analyzed: nānā masūraka stambham vedi jālaka toraṇaiḥ
translated: With pillars of various colors, altars, nets, and arches.

original: antaḥ pādottarairyuktaṃ madhyāvaraṇasaṃyutam /🔽pārśvayordaṇḍavaktrāḍhyaṃ kṣudranāsīvibhūṣitam // //🔽śālākāraṃ śiropetaṃ jālakādivibhūṣitam /
analyzed: antar pāda uttaraiḥ yuktam madhya āvaraṇa saṃyutam  pārśvayoḥ daṇḍa vaktra āḍhyam kṣudra nāsī vibhūṣitam  śālā ākāram śira upetam jālaka ādi vibhūṣitam
translated: Inside, it is equipped with upper stories, and has a middle enclosure.🔽On the sides, it is adorned with large and small windows, and is decorated with small doors.🔽It has a shape like a hall, with a head, and is adorned with nets and other decorations.

analyzed: keśa viśāla alaṃkāram bhūmi bhāga ādi pūrvavat
translated: It is decorated with hair and width, and the parts of the ground and so on are as before.

analyzed: pārśvayoḥ ca mukhe pṛṣṭhe mahānāsī catuṣṭayam
translated: On the sides, in the front and back, there are four large windows.

analyzed: ayugma sthūpi saṃyuktam dvāra prāsādakam trayam
translated: It is equipped with an odd number of stupas, and has three door-palaces.

analyzed: vakṣye iham dvāra harmyasya lakṣaṇam dvijasattama
translated: O best of Brahmins, I will now describe the characteristics of the door-palace.

analyzed: prāk ukta vat prakartavyam bhūmi bhāge dvijottama  sabhā śikhara saṃyuktam svastika ākṛti nāsikām
translated: O best of Brahmins, it should be made in the part of the ground as described before.🔽It is equipped with a hall and a peak, and has a shape like a svastika.

analyzed: śikharam ca aṣṭa nāsā āḍhyam ayugma sthūpi saṃyutam
translated: The peak has eight windows, and is equipped with an odd number of stupas.

analyzed: svastikam ca iti vikhyātam diśā śāntikam ucyate
translated: It is known as the svastika, and is said to be auspicious for all directions.

analyzed: mukhe mukhe ca bhadra aṃgam śiraḥ ca āyata maṇḍanam
translated: In each face, there is a bhadra-anga, and the head is well-adorned.

analyzed: catur dikṣu mahā nāsī vidikṣu kṣudra nāsikā
translated: In the four directions, there are large windows, and in the intermediate directions, there are small windows.

analyzed: antar pāda uttaraiḥ yuktam ayugma sthūpikā anvitam
translated: It should be endowed with inner feet and upper parts, and have an odd-numbered stupa.

analyzed: kūṭa ādi bhūmi bhāgam ca prāk iva eva prakalpayet
translated: The parts of the ground such as the peak should be conceived as before.

original: pure pare mahānāsī satāre dvyaṃśanīvrakam // //🔽śālākāryā śiraḥ kāryaṃ ayugmasthūpikānvitam /
analyzed: pure pare mahā nāsī sa tāre dvi aṃśa nīvrakam  śālā kāryā śiraḥ kāryam ayugma sthūpikā anvitam
translated: In the other city, there should be a great hall with a terrace and two-part balconies.🔽The head should be made in the form of a hall, and endowed with an odd-numbered stupa.

analyzed: śālā ākrāntam saṃyuktam nānā alaṃkāra śobhitam
translated: It should be occupied by a hall, connected, and adorned with various ornaments.

analyzed: nānā adhiṣṭhāna caraṇaiḥ yuktam tat sa upapīṭhakam
translated: It should be endowed with various foundations and steps, and have a platform.

original: dvāraharmyaṃ tridhā proktaṃ śṛṇu gopuralakṣaṇam // //🔽caturdigbhadrasaṃyuktaṃ antaḥ pādottarairyutam /
analyzed: dvāra harmyam tridhā proktam śṛṇu gopura lakṣaṇam  catur diś bhadra saṃyuktam antar pāda uttaraiḥ yutam
translated: The door palace is said to be of three types. Listen to the characteristics of the main gate.🔽It should be endowed with four cardinal points and a square, and with inner feet and upper parts.

analyzed: śālākāram śiraḥ yuktam bhadra nāsī mukhe mukhe
translated: It should have a head in the form of a hall, and a great hall at the front and back.

analyzed: pārśvayoḥ ca mahā nāsī pārśvayoḥ dvis dvi nāsikāḥ
translated: On the sides there should be a great hall, and on the sides two small halls each.

analyzed: mātṛkhaṇḍam idam khyātam śrīviśālam atha śṛṇu
translated: This is known as the section on the mothers. Now listen to the glorious extensive one.

analyzed: pūrvavat bhūmi bhāgam ca mūlakam tu karīkṛtam
translated: The parts of the ground should be as before, but the base should be made like an elephant.

analyzed: śīrṣam ca tasa ākāram sabhā ākāram atha api vā
translated: The head should be in the form of a hall, or in the form of an assembly hall.

analyzed: nānā masūraka stambha vedikābhiḥ alaṃkṛtam
translated: It should be adorned with various pillars, balconies, and platforms.

analyzed: catur diśi mahā nāsī vidikṣu kṣudra nāsikāḥ
translated: In the four directions there should be great halls, and in the intermediate directions small halls.

original: p / caturmukhaṃ tato vakṣye bhūmibhāgādi pūrvavat /
translated: Now I will describe the four-faced (temple). The ground portion etc. should be done as before.

analyzed: diśibhadra samāyuktam madhya vāraṇa saṃyutam  nānā masūraka stambham vedikā ādiḥ alaṃkṛtam
translated: It should be endowed with Bhadra in the directions, and have a central rampart.🔽It should be adorned with pillars of various woods, and with a platform etc.

analyzed: sabhākāra śiraḥ vā api śālākāram atha api vā
translated: The top should be shaped like an assembly hall or a shed.

analyzed: mukhe mukhe mahā nāsī pāśvayoḥ dvis dvi nāsikāḥ
translated: In each face there should be a large window, and on the sides two windows each.

original: antaḥ pādottarairyuktaṃ prastare tu talaṃ prati // //
analyzed: antar pāda uttaraiḥ yuktam prastare tu talam prati
translated: Inside, it should be provided with steps, on the ground floor.

analyzed: antar sopāna saṃyuktam trividham dvāra gopuram
translated: The door tower is of three types, with internal steps.

original: alīndaṃśaṃ tu kuḍyaṃ vā varṣasthalamathāpi vā // //
analyzed: alīndaṃśam tu kuḍyam vā varṣasthalam atha api vā
translated: It should be like a balcony, a wall, or a rain-protected area.

analyzed: tulā ādyaiḥ pratara avadhi alīnda aṃgam yathocitam
translated: From the scales up to the pratara, the balcony part should be as appropriate.

original: śālākāraṃ sabhāgaṃ vā mālikā kṛtireva vā // //
analyzed: śālākāram sa bhāgam vā mālikā kṛtiḥ eva vā
translated: It should be shaped like a shed, have an assembly hall, or be shaped like a garland.

analyzed: dvayeṣu iṣṭayaka dvāre prakalpayet
translated: In the two types, the door should be made there itself.

original: bāhye bāhyeṃghriyasthāpya madhye madhye yutaṃ tu vā // //
analyzed: bāhye madhye madhye yutam tu vā
translated: Outside, the feet should be placed, or it should be combined in the middle.

analyzed: gṛha piṇḍim garbha geham ca prāk iva eva prakalpayet
translated: The house and the inner sanctum should be designed as before.

analyzed: alīndam hārayoḥ māne vivṛtta aṃghrikam eva vā
translated: The balcony should be of the same size as the pillars, or have open feet.

analyzed: prastara uddiṣṭa bhūmi antar sopāna ādi samanvitam  kūṭa koṣṭha ādi alaṃkāram ūrdhva stha vat prakalpayet
translated: Inside the area indicated by the Prastha measure, it should be equipped with steps and other features.🔽It should be designed with turrets, chambers, and other decorations, as if they were located above.

analyzed: bhūmi bhāgam alaṃkāram gala antam parikalpayet
translated: The ornamental part of the ground should be conceived up to the neck.

analyzed: śīrṣa daṇḍaka śālā ābham śālākāram tat ucyate
translated: Having the shape of a hall with a pole and beams on top, it is called the hall-shaped.

analyzed: yat sabhākāram samucyate
translated: The hall-shaped one is said to have the shape of an assembly hall, which is a combination of the Lupta and Vyokta types.

analyzed: prastaram pratisaṃchādyam maṇḍyam yaśvīṣṭaram vinā
translated: Having covered the Prastha measure, it is the Mandya, which is without the Vishva and Ishtavara.

original: p / mālikā kṛtikaṃ khyātaṃ maṇṭape tu parasparam /
analyzed: mālikā kṛtikam khyātam maṇṭape tu parasparam
translated: The garland and the Kritika are known as the Mandapas, which are mutually exclusive.

analyzed: gopuram hi evam ākhyātam parivāram atha śṛṇu
translated: The Gopura is thus described. Now listen to the Parivara.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape gopura lakṣaṇa paṭalaḥ catuścatvāriṃśaḥ
translated: Thus ends Chapter Forty-four in the Ashva-maya Kashyapa on the characteristics of Gopura.

analyzed: atha vakṣye viśeṣeṇa parivāra vidhim param
translated: Now I will explain the supreme method of Parivara in particular.

original: aṣṭau vā ṣoḍaśaṃ caiva dvātriṃśacca yathākramam // //
analyzed: aṣṭau vā ṣoḍaśam ca eva dvātriṃśat ca yathākramam
translated: Eight, sixteen, and thirty-two, in order.

analyzed: antar maṇḍalake ca eva parivāram tu kārayet
translated: The Parivara should be made in the inner mandala.

analyzed: saṃkalpya antarahārāyām parivāra aṣṭakam dvija
translated: O Brahmin, having conceived the inner Hara, the eight Parivaras.
The Parivara called Kala.

analyzed: madhya hārā caturthe tu dvātriṃśat parivārakam
translated: In the fourth, the central part has thirty-two surrounding structures.

original: prākāre madhyame vātha sālākuḍyāśritaṃ tu vā /🔽mukhāyāmaṃ vinā bīje caturaśre kṛte sati // //
analyzed: prākāre madhyame vā atha sālā kuḍya āśritam tu vā  mukha āyāmam vinā bīje catur aśre kṛte sati
translated: In the middle wall or in the outer wall, or in a hall or a house,🔽when a square is made without the length and breadth of the entrance,
one should divide it into nine parts. In the middle part, there should be the main temple.

analyzed: tad āvṛtta aṣṭa bhāgeṣu pūrva ādi krama yogataḥ
translated: In the eight parts obtained by turning it, starting from the east in order,

original: prācyāṃ vai vṛṣabhaṃ sthāpya analaṃ cāgni gocare /
analyzed: prācyām vai vṛṣabham sthāpya analam ca agni gocare
translated: having placed Vrishabha in the east, and Anala in the southeast,

original: agnirdurgā tu vā yāmye athavā saptamātaraḥ // //
analyzed: agniḥ durgā tu vā yāmye athavā sapta mātaraḥ
translated: in the south, either Agni or Durga, or the seven mothers,

analyzed: mātṝṇām dakṣiṇe vīrabhadram vāme vināyakam
translated: to the south of the mothers, Vīrabhadra, and to the left, Vināyaka.

original: ekaberantu vā yāmye nairṛtyāṃ vā vināyakam // //
analyzed: vā yāmye nairṛtyām vā vināyakam
translated: Or in the south, a single idol, or Vināyaka in the southwest,

original: p / kumāraṃ vāruṇe deśe jyeṣṭhāṃ vai vāyugocare /🔽saumye tu keśavasthānaṃ tatra kātyāyanī tu vā // //
analyzed: kumāram vāruṇe deśe jyeṣṭhām vai vāyugocare  saumye tu keśava sthānam tatra kātyāyanī tu vā
translated: Kumāra in the west, Jyeṣṭhā in the northwest,🔽in the north, the abode of Keśava, or there, Kātyāyanī.

original: bhāskarīśapade deśe pīṭha vā pratimā tu vā /
analyzed: bhāskarīśapade deśe pīṭha vā pratimā tu vā
translated: In the place of Bhāskara, either a pedestal or an idol,

analyzed: pratimātvā ālaya upetā pīṭhaḥ ced ālayam vinā
translated: if it is a pedestal, without a temple.

analyzed: indra anala śiva aṃśa sthā paścima abhimukha āsthitāḥ
translated: Located in the parts of Indra, Agni, and Śiva, facing west,

original: gauryāstu mālikā vātha vimānaṃ vā prakalpayet // //
analyzed: gauryāḥ tu mālikā vā atha vimānam vā prakalpayet
translated: Or one can construct a pavilion or a temple for Gauri.

analyzed: anyeṣām api devānām maṇṭapam vā vimānakam
translated: For other gods also, a pavilion or a temple should be constructed.

original: mūlaharmyāttripādaṃ vā ardhaṃ vā pādameva vā // //
analyzed: mūla harmyāt tri pādam vā ardham vā pādam eva vā
translated: One-third, half, or one-fourth of the height of the main temple,

original: garbhageha samaṃ vātha garbhārdhaṃ vā tripādakam /
analyzed: garbha gā iha samam vā atha garbha ardham vā tri pādakam
translated: equal to the garbhagriha, half the garbhagriha, or three-fourths of it,

original: tricatuṣpaṃcahastaṃ vā parivārālayastatam // //🔽ābhāsa sadanāstena mārgeṇaiva samācaret /
analyzed: tri catur paṃca hastam vā parivāra ālayaḥ tatam  ābhāsa sadanāḥ tena mārgeṇa eva samācaret
translated: three, four, or five cubits in size, is the extent of the surrounding temple.🔽The light chambers should be constructed in the same way.

analyzed: śāntika ādiṣu yat mūlam geham eṣām tat eva hi
translated: The basic temple is the same for the rites of peace, etc.

analyzed: kārayet tu na atikramya viparītam vipad karam
translated: If constructed otherwise, it would bring misfortune.

analyzed: trivarga maṇṭapa ākāram catu dvāra samanvitam
translated: The temple should be shaped like a pavilion with three parts, equipped with four doors,

original: p / maṇṭapaṃ vā prakartavyaḥ śeṣāṇāṃ tu yathocitam /
analyzed: maṇṭapam vā prakartavyaḥ śeṣāṇām tu yathocitam
translated: or a pavilion should be constructed, and for the rest, as appropriate.

original: parivārālayaṃ proktaṃ pratimālakṣaṇaṃ śṛṇu // //🔽parivārālaye dvāraṃ garbhamānena vā punaḥ /
analyzed: parivāra ālayam proktam pratimā lakṣaṇam śṛṇu  parivāra ālaye dvāram garbha mānena vā punar
translated: The surrounding temple has been described. Now listen to the characteristics of the image.🔽The door in the surrounding temple should be equal to the size of the garbhagriha,

original: yaduktaṃ sakalānāṃ tu tanmānaṃ vātha gṛhyatām // //
analyzed: yat uktam sakalānām tu tat mānam vā atha gṛhyatām
translated: or one can adopt the measurements mentioned for all.

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃyuktam sthānaka āsanakam tu vā
translated: It should be endowed with all characteristics, either standing or seated,

analyzed: dvātriṃśat parivāram tu jālaja harmye tu kalpitam
translated: The thirty-two attendants are to be placed in the jeweled pavilion.

original: chande tu ṣoḍaśākhyātaṃ śeṣaṃ vo sviṣṭakaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: chande tu ṣoḍaśa ākhyātam śeṣam vaḥ su iṣṭakam bhavet
translated: In the case of the Chanda, sixteen are mentioned, the rest would be the Sviṣṭak.

analyzed: athavā sarva harmyeṣu sarvam vā parikalpayet
translated: Or in all the pavilions, everything can be imagined.

analyzed: kātyāyanī aṃśaka ādīni pratimā lakṣaṇa ukta vat
translated: The Kātyāyanī and other parts are as described in the iconometry.

analyzed: ādau tu parivārāṇām vakṣye iham vṛṣa lakṣaṇam
translated: First, I will describe the characteristics of the attendants, starting with the bull.

analyzed: iti aṃśumān kāśyape parivāra lakṣaṇa vidhi paṭalaḥ paṃcacatvāriṃśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-fifth chapter in the Āṃśumat section of the Kāśyapa Samhitā, on the rules for the characteristics of the attendants.

original: tuṃge paṃcāśadaṃśe tu ekāṃśaṃ cāṃgulaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tuṃge paṃcāśat aṃśe tu eka aṃśam ca aṃgulam bhavet
translated: In a height of fifty parts, one part would be one aṅgula.

analyzed: catvāriṃśa aṃgula āyāmam galāt pṛṣṭha avasānakam
translated: The length of the neck from the back of the neck to the end of the back is forty aṅgulas.

analyzed: mūrdhni sva gala paryantam dharma mātram udāhṛtam
translated: From the head to the back of the neck, the Dharma is said to be one aṅgula.

analyzed: tasmāt grīvā uccam aṣṭa aṃśam uraḥ ntam ṣoḍaśa aṃgulam
translated: From that, the height of the neck is eight parts, and the chest up to sixteen aṅgulas.

analyzed: ūru dīrgham tu tasmāt vai ṣaṣ mātram parikīrtitam
translated: The length of the thigh is declared to be six parts from that.

analyzed: jānu mānam dvi mātram syāt jaṃgha mānam ṣaṣ aṃgulam
translated: The length of the knee should be two parts, and the length of the shank is six aṅgulas.

analyzed: khura mānam dvi mātram syāt tuṅgam evam prakalpayet
translated: The length of the hoof should be two parts. The height should be planned thus.

analyzed: śṛṃgāram tu vasvaṃśam śṛṃgoccam catur aṃgulam
translated: The height of the horn should be four finger-breadths, one-eighth of the width.

original: śṛṃgamūlaviśālaṃ tu caturaṃgulamucyate /🔽ardhāṃgulaṃ tadagraṃ syāt agraṃ mūlātkramātkṛśam // //
analyzed: śṛṃga mūla viśālam tu catur aṃgulam ucyate  ardha aṃgulam tad agram syāt agram mūlāt kramāt kṛśam
translated: The base of the horn is said to be four finger-breadths wide.🔽Its tip should be half a finger-breadth, gradually tapering from the base.

analyzed: kiṃcid dvi aśra samāyuktam śṛṃgam vā abhyantaram budhaiḥ
translated: The horn should be slightly wedge-shaped, or the inner part should be pointed, according to the learned.

analyzed: lalāṭa vyāsananda aṃśam mukhavyāsam śara aṃmulam
translated: The width of the forehead is one-eighth of the width, and the width of the face is four finger-breadths.

original: ghanaṃ ca tatsamaṃ khyātaṃ netrāyāmaṃ dvayāṃgulam /🔽adhyardhāṃgulamutsedhaṃ śapharākṛtivatkṛtam // //
analyzed: ghanam ca tat samam khyātam netra āyāmam dvaya aṃgulam  adhyardha aṃgulam utsedham śaphara ākṛti vat kṛtam
translated: Its thickness is said to be the same, and the length of the eyes is two finger-breadths.🔽Its height is one and a half finger-breadths, made in the shape of a fish.

analyzed: netra madhyāt mukha āyāmam vasu aṃgulam udāhṛtam  tasmāt vai pṛṣṭha grīvā antam ṣaṣ mātram parikīrtitam
translated: The length of the face from the middle of the eyes is said to be five finger-breadths.🔽From that to the back of the neck is declared to be six finger-breadths.

analyzed: netrāt kaṇṭha antaram tadvat paṃca aṃśam karṇa dairghyakam
translated: Similarly, the distance from the eye to the throat is five finger-breadths, and the length of the ear is five finger-breadths.

analyzed: karṇa mūla viśālam tu dvi mātram iti vidyate
translated: The width at the base of the ear is known to be two finger-breadths.

original: madhyavāsaṃ caturmātraṃ agramaṃgulavistṛtam /🔽ghanamardhāṃgulaṃ khyātaṃ ghrāṇaṃ sārdhāṃgulāyatam // //
analyzed: madhya vāsam catur mātram agram aṃgula vistṛtam  ghanam ardha aṃgulam khyātam ghrāṇam sārdha aṃgula āyatam
translated: The middle part is four finger-breadths, and the tip is one finger-breadth wide.🔽The thickness is said to be half a finger-breadth, and the nose is two and a half finger-breadths long.

analyzed: vyāsam eka aṃgulam khyātam gāḍham tat samam ucyate
translated: The width is said to be one finger-breadth, and its depth is said to be the same.

analyzed: aṃgulam nāsikāt ūrdhvam tuṃgam iti abhidhīyate
translated: The height above the nose is called the height of the finger.

analyzed: āsyam paṃca aṅgula āyāmam adhara uccam dvi mātrakam
translated: The mouth is five fingers long, the lower lip is two finger breadths high,

analyzed: tri mātram ca uttara uṣṭham ca yuktitaḥ kalpayet kramāt
translated: and the upper lip is three finger breadths high, one should conceive them in order according to reason.

analyzed: jihvā āyāma viśāla uccam tri dvi eka aṃgulam ucyate
translated: The length, width, and height of the tongue are said to be three, two, and one finger.

analyzed: grīva vyāsam dvādaśa aṃgulam
translated: The girth of the neck is ten parts, its base is twelve fingers.

analyzed: pṛṣṭhagrīvasya mūlasya vyāsam aṣṭa aṅgulam bhavet
translated: The girth of the base of the back of the neck should be eight fingers.

analyzed: pṛṣṭha grīvā agra vistāram ṣaṣ aṃgulam udāhṛtam
translated: The width of the front of the back of the neck is said to be six fingers.

analyzed: kakud uccam catur mātram tasya vyāsam ṣaṣ aṃgulam
translated: The height of the dewlap is four finger breadths, its girth is six fingers.

analyzed: tāla dhvani sama ākārā dīrghā yā sā śilā striyaḥ

analyzed: prāc agrām vā udak agrām vā śilām saṃgrāhya śilpikaḥ

analyzed: adhobhāge mukham khyātam ūrdhva gatā bhavet

translated: In the region of Shankara of that (earth), he should perform the Shanti Homa.

analyzed: agnyādhāna ādikam sarvam agni kārya uktam ācaret
translated: All the rites beginning with the kindling of the fire should be performed as stated in the Agni Karya.

analyzed: samidham hṛdayena eva mūlena ājyam tu homayet
translated: With the heart (mantra), he should offer the sacrificial sticks, and with the root (mantra), he should offer the ghee.

analyzed: caru homam aghoreṇa puruṣeṇa eva taṇḍulam
translated: The Charu Homa (should be performed) with the Aghora (mantra), and the rice grains with the Purusha (mantra).

analyzed: tilam īśāna mantreṇa sarṣapam kavacena tu
translated: With the Ishana mantra, (he should offer) sesame seeds, and with the Kavacha (mantra), mustard seeds.

original: śatamardhaṃ tadardhaṃ vā pratyekaṃ tu śatāhutiḥ // //🔽sviṣṭamagnetimaṃtreṇa pūrṇāhutimathācaret /
analyzed: śatam ardham tad ardham vā pratyekam tu śata āhutiḥ  su iṣṭam agni iti maṃtreṇa pūrṇāhutim atha ācaret
translated: One hundred, half of that, or half of that again, each with one hundred oblations.🔽With the mantra Svasti agne (Hail, O Agni), he should then perform the final oblation.

analyzed: tatas vahnim samudvāsya pūjā udvāsa ādikam nyaset
translated: Then, having dismissed the fire, he should perform the worship, dismissal, and so on.

original: śilāṃ chedya hṛdā vidvān śastramaṃtreṇa pūjayet /
analyzed: śilām chedya hṛdā vidvān śastra maṃtreṇa pūjayet
translated: The wise one should cut the stone with the heart (mantra), and worship it with the weapon mantra.

analyzed: kavacam tu samuccārya śilā chedanam ācaret
translated: Reciting the Kavacha, he should perform the cutting of the stone.

original: tadūrdhvaṃ śilpikāryaṃ tu sthapatyādi samācaret /🔽garbhagehapramāṇaṃ ca dvāramānaṃ tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: tad ūrdhvam śilpi kāryam tu sthapati ādi samācaret  garbha geha pramāṇam ca dvāra mānam tathā eva ca
translated: After that, the work of the artisan should be done by the architect and others.🔽The size of the sanctum sanctorum, the size of the door,

original: stambhaṃ ca tālamānaṃ ca hastamānāṃgulaṃ tathā /
analyzed: stambham ca tāla mānam ca hasta māna aṃgulam tathā
translated: The size of the pillar, the size of the tala, the size of the hand, and the size of the finger,

analyzed: liṃga māna uddhṛtam sapta teṣām pratyekanā ekadhā
translated: The seven measurements of the liṅga are taken from each of them.

analyzed: garbha geham tu paṃca aṃśam guṇa aṃśam śreṣṭham ucyate
translated: The sanctum sanctorum should be five parts, and one part is said to be the best.

analyzed: śreṣṭha uttama ādi navadhā procyate dvijasattama
translated: O best of the twice-born, it is said to be of nine kinds, starting from the best of the best.

original: prāsāde tvādibhūmau tu stambhadīrghasamaṃ hi tat /
analyzed: prāsāde tu ādi bhūmau tu stambha dīrgha samam hi tat
translated: In the first floor of the palace, the length of the pillar is the same.

analyzed: tat uttamam iti khyātam tasya ardham madhyamam bhavet
translated: That is known as the best, half of that would be the medium.

analyzed: tayoḥ madhya iṣṭa bhāge tu nanda bhedam dvijottama
translated: O best of the twice-born, in between those two, in the eighth part, is the division of Nanda.

analyzed: tu nava bhāgam vibhājite  /
translated: When the length of the pillar is divided into nine parts,

analyzed: navadhā liṃga mānam tu stambha mānam dvijottama
translated: O best of the twice-born, the size of the liṅga is of nine kinds, and the size of the pillar is also of nine kinds.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna udaye vipra stambha māna vat ācaret
translated: O Brahmin, in the rise of the pedestal, one should follow the size of the pillar.

analyzed: eka hastam samārabhya sa aṣṭa aṃśam ca vivardhanāt
translated: Starting from one hand, by increasing by eight parts,

analyzed: nava hasta vidhiḥ yāvat saṃkhyā sa paṃcakam
translated: Up to the method of nine hands, the number is fifty-five.

analyzed: paṃca hasta vimāna ādi harmyam hasta avasā anvitam
translated: The temple should be five cubits high up to the top of the building.

analyzed: paṃca hastāt adhas harmyam liṃgam stambha vaśam vinā
translated: The temple should be less than five cubits high, except for the pillar of the linga.

analyzed: hasta ādi guṇa hasta antam vikalpa ābhāsa harmyayoḥ
translated: The options for the temple are from one cubit to five cubits.

original: trihastaṃ ṣaṭkarāntaṃ tu liṃgaṃ chanda vimānake // //
analyzed: tri hastam ṣaṣ kara antam tu liṃgam chanda vimānake
translated: The linga in the chandralinga temple should be from three cubits to six cubits.

original: p / ṣaṭkarādi navāntaṃ tu liṃgaṃ jāti grahocitam /
analyzed: ṣaṣ kara ādi nava antam tu liṅgam jāti graha ucitam
translated: The linga suitable for the jati graha temple should be from six cubits to nine cubits.

analyzed: evam hastam samākhyātam tāla mānam atha ucyate  /
translated: Thus the cubit measurement is explained. Now the tala measurement is described.

analyzed: tāla ādi nava tāla antam eka tāla vivardhanāt
translated: From one tala to nine talas, increasing by one tala each time,

original: sā liṃgo navasaṃkhyā syuḥ kalpyajātiratho bhavet // //
analyzed: sā liṃgaḥ nava saṃkhyā syuḥ kalpya jātiḥ atho bhavet
translated: there will be nine types of lingas. Now the kalpyajati is described.

analyzed: trayodaśa aṃgulam ārabhya yāvat nanda śata aṃgulam
translated: Starting from thirteen angulas up to one hundred and five angulas,

analyzed: tad eka anā eka bhāgam ca liṃga māna aṃgulena tu
translated: the length of the linga should be divided into one or more parts by angulas.

analyzed: tri bhāga sahitam liṃgam hasta kṣīṇam na kārayet
translated: The linga should not be reduced to less than three parts of the hand measure.

analyzed: hasta mānāt kṣayam liṃgam vṛtta ākāram viśeṣataḥ
translated: The linga should be reduced from the hand measure, especially in the case of a circular shape.

analyzed: viṣṭhare yojayet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should add the parts of the vedas, agni, and udaya to the viṣṭhara.

original: śeṣaṃ tu dṛśyamānaṃ syāt vikalpābhāsa harmyake // //
analyzed: śeṣam tu dṛśyamānam syāt vikalpa ābhāsa harmyake
translated: The remaining visible part should be in the vikalpābhasa temple.

original: viṣṭhare veśaliṃgaṃ tu vikalpo parigṛhe vinā /
analyzed: viṣṭhare veśa liṃgam tu parigṛhe vinā
translated: In a Viṣṭhara (a kind of pedestal), the Liṅga should be of the same size as the pedestal. In a house, there is an option without (any restriction).

analyzed: eka aṃgulam samārabhya yāvat rudra aṅgula avadhi
translated: Beginning with one aṅgula up to the limit of Rudra aṅgulas,

analyzed: lohajam ratnajam vati ūrdhve śailajam ucyate
translated: the Liṅga made of metal, gem, or stone is said to be above.

analyzed: trayodaśa aṃgula adhastāt śailajam tu na kārayet
translated: Below thirteen aṅgulas, a Liṅga made of stone should not be made.

analyzed: evam tu aneka bhedena procyate liṃga mānakam
translated: Thus, the measurement of the Liṅga is described with many divisions.

original: nāgaraṃ drāviḍaṃ liṃgaṃ vesaraṃ ca vadāmyaham // //
analyzed: nāgaram drāviḍam liṃgam vesaram ca vadāmi aham
translated: I shall now describe the Nāgara, Draviḍa, and Veśara Liṅgas.

original: liṃgodaye tu vedāṃśaṃ ekāṃśaṃ kanyasaṃ tato /
analyzed: liṃga udaye tu veda aṃśam eka aṃśam kanyasam
translated: In the case of Liṅga, the one-eighth part is the smallest.

original: tuṃge tryaṃśaṃ śivāṃśaṃ tu vistāraṃ śreṣṭhamucyate // //
analyzed: tuṃge tri aṃśam śiva aṃśam tu vistāram śreṣṭham ucyate
translated: The height of three parts and the width of one part is said to be the best.

analyzed: tayoḥ madhye ṣṭa bhāge tu navadhā tāram ucyate
translated: Between the two, in eight parts, the width is said to be of nine types.

original: adhodaye kalāṃśe tu paṃcāṃśaṃ śāntikaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: adhodaye kalā aṃśe tu paṃca aṃśam śāntikam bhavet  /
translated: In the case of the rising of the Liṅga, in the one-eighth part, the five parts would be for peace.

original: p / vedāṃśaṃ pauṣṭikaṃ khyātaṃ guṇāṃśaṃ jayadaṃ bhavet /
translated: The one-fourth part is known to be for nourishment, and the one-sixth part would give victory.

analyzed: ābhicāram dvi bhāgam syāt vyāsam evam caturvidham
translated: The two parts would be for black magic. Thus, the width is of four kinds.

analyzed: evam trayodaśa vyāsam nāgare tu vidhīyate
translated: Thus, the width of thirteen is prescribed for the Nāgara (style).

analyzed: liṅga ucce dvidh nava aṃśe tu rasa bhūta yuga aṃśake
translated: In the height of the Liṅga, in the nine-twelfths part, in the five-eighth part,

analyzed: guṇa aṃśe śāntika ādi syāt rāviḍe tu caturvidham
translated: In the Guṇāṃśa, there should be Śāntika etc., and in Rāvide, it is of four types.

analyzed: vesaram ca catur bhedam harmya liṃgasya piṇḍikā
translated: The Vesara is also of four types, and the pedestal of the Hermyalinga.

original: vesare liṃga tuṃge tu viṃśatyaṃśaṃ vibhājite /
analyzed: vesare liṃga tuṃge tu viṃśati aṃśam vibhājite
translated: In the Vesara, if the height of the Liṅga is divided by twenty,

analyzed: aṣṭa aṃśam sapta ṣaṣ paṃca bhāgaiḥ vyāsam prakalpitam
translated: the breadth is determined by eight, seven, six, or five parts.

original: śāntikaṃ pauṣṭikaṃ caiva jayadāt bhudakaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: śāntikam pauṣṭikam ca eva jaya dāt bhudakam bhavet
translated: It will be Śāntika, Pauṣṭika, Jayadā, and Bhudaka.

original: vesaraṃ ca caturbhedaṃ harmyaṃ liṃgasya piṇḍikā // //
analyzed: vesaram ca catur bhedam harmyam liṃgasya piṇḍikā
translated: The Vesara is also of four types, and the pedestal of the Liṅga is a mansion.

analyzed: pāda ādhāra śilāḥ ca eva ekajāti svayam karam
translated: The foot-base and the stone slabs should be of the same type.

analyzed: yatra eva kalpitam liṃgam vardha hetu mudā āhṛtam
translated: The Liṅga that is conceived is said to be the cause of prosperity.

analyzed: anyonya saṃkaraḥ ced tu rājñaḥ
translated: If there is mutual mixture, it is frightening for the king's face.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena saṃkaram na samācaret
translated: Therefore, one should avoid mixture with all effort.

analyzed: liṃgānām nāgara ādi evam khyātam āya ādi tat śṛṇu
translated: Thus, the Nāgara etc. of the Liṅgas is known. Listen to that.

analyzed: liṃgasya utsedha mānam tu māna aṃgulena bhājayet  /
translated: The height of the Liṅga should be divided by the measuring finger.

original: mātrācchedaṃ pravṛddhyā vā hānyā vā paripūrayet /🔽śreṣṭhāntarādhamarmārvāmātrapūrṇaṃ parigrahet // //
analyzed: mātrā chedam pravṛddhyā vā hānyā vā paripūrayet 🔽śreṣṭha antara adha marma arvā mātra pūrṇam parigrahet
translated: One should complete it by increase or decrease from the mātrā, or by addition.🔽One should accept the mātrā-filled Liṅga of the best, middling, or lowest.

analyzed: utsedha mātram aṣṭābhiḥ vṛddhitam ṛkṣa saṃkhyayā
translated: The height is increased by eight times the number of lunar days.

original: hṛtvā te dinasaṃkhyā tu aśvinyādi dvijottama / // //
analyzed: hṛtvā te dina saṃkhyā tu aśvinī ādi dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, subtracting the number of days from Ashvini etc.,

original: navabhirguṇine saptā hṛtvātvarkādi vārake /🔽p / anale guṇite cāṣṭa hṛte yonimudāhṛtam // //
analyzed: navabhiḥ guṇine saptā hṛtvā tu arka ādi vārake  anale guṇite ca aṣṭa hṛte yonim udāhṛtam
translated: Subtracting seven times nine from the number of days of the week starting from Sunday,🔽When divided by eight, the result is called the Yoni.

original: aṣṭābhirvṛddhite bhānu hṛte tvāyamudāhṛtam /🔽navabhirguṇite nāḍi hṛte śeṣaṃ vyayaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: aṣṭābhiḥ vṛddhite bhānu hṛte tu āyam udāhṛtam  navabhiḥ guṇite hṛte śeṣam vyayam bhavet  /
translated: When increased by eight times the number of days, and divided by eight, the result is called the Ayamukha.🔽When multiplied by nine and divided by the number of Nakshatras, the remainder is the expenditure.

analyzed: yuga vṛddhyā hṛte tu aṃśam navamam taskara ādibhiḥ
translated: When divided by the increase in the Yugas, the ninth part is the thieves etc.

analyzed: āya ādhikyam vyayam hīnam saṃpadām āspadam sadā
translated: When the income is more than the expenditure, it is always the abode of prosperity.

analyzed: dhvajam siṃaha vṛṣe hastī śubhayonim udāhṛtam
translated: The flag, lion, bull and elephant are said to be auspicious Yonis.

analyzed: sita saumya śaśī sapta vāre śubha aśubham
translated: The white, gentle, and moon-like Jupiter is auspicious in the seven weekdays.

analyzed: nṛpa kartuḥ ca janma ṛkṣāt liṃga ṛkṣa avasānakam
translated: From the birth Nakshatra of the king, up to the Linga Nakshatra,

analyzed: janma trayam ca veda aṣṭa ṛtu
translated: The three births, the eight Vedas, and the six seasons, excluding Nanda,

analyzed: śubha āvaha dināni ete śeṣakāḥ tu aśubha āvahāḥ
translated: These are the auspicious days, the remaining ones are inauspicious.

analyzed: bhānuvāra ādi saṃyuktam viśākhā ādiḥ catuḥ catuḥ
translated: The four beginning with Sunday, and the four beginning with Vishasha,

analyzed: ripu tva amaraṇam nāśam apamṛtyuḥ yathā kramam
translated: Bring enmity, death, destruction, and untimely death respectively.

original: śeṣaṃ yogaṃ parigrāhya śubhamānaṃ tu saṃgṛhet // //
analyzed: śeṣam yogam parigrāhya śubha mānam tu saṃgṛhet
translated: The remaining part should be taken as Yoga and the auspicious measure should be collected.

analyzed: sama liṃgam vardhamānam śaiva ādhikyam ca svastikam
translated: The Sama-linga, the Vardhamana, the Shaiva-adhika, the Svastika,

analyzed: sarvatas bhadraliṃgam ca sārvadeśikam eva ca
translated: The Sarvatobhadra-linga, and the Sarva-deshika,

analyzed: dhārāliṃgam mukham liṃgam liṃgam aṣṭavidham bhavet
translated: The Dharala-linga, the Mukha-linga, the linga would be of eight kinds.

analyzed: sama liṃgam tu viprāṇām nṛpāṇām vardhamānakam
translated: The Sama-linga is for Brahmins, the Vardhamana for kings,

original: śaivādhikyaṃ tu vaiśyānāṃ śūdrāṇāṃ svastikaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: śaiva ādhikyam tu vaiśyānām śūdrāṇām svastikam bhavet
translated: The Shaiva-adhika for Vaishyas, and the Svastika for Shudras.

analyzed: sarveṣām itaram liṃgam sarva kāma phala pradam
translated: The other linga for all gives the fruits of all desires.

original: evameva mahādevo liṃgaṃ bhedaṃ nṛṇāṃ hitam /
analyzed: evam eva mahādevaḥ liṃgam bhedam nṛṇām hitam
translated: Thus, Mahadeva, for the benefit of men, has divided the linga into different types.

original: p / iṣṭāyāmaviśāle tu catura śrīkaraṃ purā // //
analyzed: iṣṭa āyāma viśāle tu śrīkaram purā
translated: In a rectangular and not too wide place, first make a square of four parts.

original: paścād bhāgatrayaṃ kalpya anena vidhinā budhaḥ /
analyzed: paścāt bhāga trayam kalpya anena vidhinā budhaḥ
translated: Then, the wise one should divide it into three parts according to this method.

original: caturaśramadhobhāgaṃ brahmabhāgamathocyate // //🔽madhye tu vasukoṇaṃ syāt viṣṇvaṃśaṃ tatprakīrtitam /
analyzed: catur aśram adhobhāgam brahmabhāgam atha ucyate  / madhye tu vasu koṇam syāt viṣṇvaṃśam tat prakīrtitam
translated: The square at the bottom is called the part of Brahma.🔽In the middle, there should be eight corners, which is declared to be the part of Vishnu.

analyzed: ūrdhva bhāge tu vṛttasya tat śiva aṃśa iti vidyate  /
translated: In the upper part of the circle, that is known as the part of Shiva.

analyzed: aṃśam prati avidhānena tu aśeṣam tu śiva ātmakam
translated: Without specifying the part, the entire linga is of the nature of Shiva.

analyzed: vṛkṣasya mūla madhya agram śākhā puṣpa samanvitam
translated: The root, middle and top of the tree, along with the branches and flowers,

original: śabdaḥ sparśaśca rūpaṃ ca rasagandhau tathaiva ca /
analyzed: śabdaḥ sparśaḥ ca rūpam ca rasa gandhau tathā eva ca
translated: Sound, touch, form, taste and smell,

analyzed: carma ca rudram ekasya ekaika aṃśaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: And the skin, are declared to be one part of Rudra.

analyzed: tathā api aṃśa bheda yuktasya pramāṇa bhedam na vidyate
translated: Even so, there is no difference in the measure of what is endowed with the division of parts.

analyzed: tathā eva śiva liṃgasya bhāgam
translated: In the same way, of the Śiva Liṅga, which is undivided in every part,

original: liṃgatāraṃ yugāśraṃ tu kṛtvā karṇārdhakaṃ kramāt /
analyzed: liṃga tāram yugāśram tu kṛtvā karṇa ardhakam kramāt
translated: Having made the Liṅga equal to the height, with a square base, dividing it into half,

original: koṇātkoṇaṃ tu saṃkalpya tena mānena deśikaḥ // //
analyzed: koṇāt koṇam tu saṃkalpya tena mānena deśikaḥ
translated: The preceptor should imagine from corner to corner, by that measure,

analyzed: tad bāhye chedayet vidvān aṣṭāśram tat bhavet iha
translated: The learned one should cut outside that, and it becomes octagonal here.

analyzed: athavā liṃga tāram tu sapta bhāgam vibhājite
translated: Or else, if the height of the Liṅga is divided into seven parts,

analyzed: guṇa aṃśam madhya paṭṭam syāt chedayet tu bahis budhaḥ
translated: The middle band should be one part, and the learned one should cut outside.

original: athavā vasubhāge tu madhyapaṭṭaṃ rasāṃśakam // //🔽chedayettu viśeṣaṃ tu vasvaśratrividhā vahi /🔽aṣṭāśraṃ paṭṭavistāre caturaśrīkṛte sati // //
analyzed: athavā vasubhāge tu madhya paṭṭam rasa aṃśakam  chedayet tu viśeṣam tu vasu aśra trividhāḥ vahi  aṣṭāśram paṭṭa vistāre catur aśrīkṛte sati
translated: Or else, if divided into eight parts, the middle band is five parts,🔽The learned one should cut outside. The special octagonal shape is of three kinds outside.🔽When the width of the band is made square,

original: tatkoṇārdhaṃ tu vasvaśraṃ koṇātkoṇaṃ tu lāṃchayet /
analyzed: tad koṇa ardham tu koṇāt koṇam tu lāṃchayet
translated: Half of that corner is octagonal. One should mark from corner to corner.

original: p / tadbāhyaṃ tu paricchedya kalāśraṃ tadbhavediha // //
analyzed: tat bāhyam tu paricchedya tat bhavet iha  /
translated: The external part should be cut into a square shape.

original: kalāśrāśre tu saṃchedya vṛttākāraṃ tu tadbhavet /
analyzed: tu saṃchedya vṛtta ākāram tu tat bhavet
translated: In the case of a square-shaped liṅga, it should be cut into a circular shape.

analyzed: aṣṭa asra ādīni vinyāsam catur aśram tu labhyate
translated: The liṅgas with eight corners etc. are arranged in such a way that they become square.

analyzed: liṃga āyāme tri bhāge tu eka aṃśam caturaśrakam
translated: In the case of a liṅga of three parts, one part should be square.

original: madhye vomaṃ tu vasvaśraṃ agre vṛttaṃ śivāṃśakam // //🔽samaliṃgamiti khyātaṃ viprādīnāṃ tu vṛddhidam /
analyzed: madhye vomam tu agre vṛttam śiva aṃśakam    samaliṃgam iti khyātam vipra ādīnām tu vṛddhi dam
translated: In the middle, the altar should be of eight corners, and at the top, a circular portion of one part.🔽This is known as samalinga, which bestows prosperity on Brahmins and others.

analyzed: bhānu dvi aṃśe tata āyāme sapta aṃśam caturaśrakam
translated: In a liṅga of two parts, one part should be square.

analyzed: aṣṭa aṃśena aṣṭa koṇam tu nava aṃśam vṛttam ucyate
translated: In a liṅga of eight parts, one part should be of eight corners, one part should be circular.

original: ṣaṭsaptavasubhāgaṃ vā paṃca ṣaṭsapta eva vā // //
analyzed: ṣaṣ sapta vasu bhāgam vā paṃca ṣaṣ sapta eva vā
translated: Or, it may be divided into six, seven, or eight parts, or five, six, or seven parts.

analyzed: catuṣpaṃca ṣaṣ aṃśam vā vardhamānam caturvidham
translated: Or, it may be divided into four, five, or six parts. This is the fourfold increasing type.

analyzed: liṃga āyāme daśa aṃśe tu guṇa aṃśam caturaśrakam
translated: In a liṅga of ten parts, one part should be square.

analyzed: ca eva tad tulyam yuga aṃśam syāt śiva aṃśakam
translated: The altar should be of eight corners, equal to that, and the top portion should be of one part.

translated: Having placed eight pots around, with sprouts, covered,

translated: With threads, adorned with new clothes, filled with fragrant water,🔽The priest should worship the Lokapalas, covered with cloth and gold,

analyzed: brahmavṛkṣa samidbhiḥ tu homam kṛtvā tu

analyzed: brahma ja jñāna maṃtreṇa pūjā homam samācaret

analyzed: carum pratyeka aṣṭaśata āhutiḥ

translated: having worshipped the fire as before, one should offer the oblation of the full oblation.

analyzed: evam jāgaraṇam rātrau prabhāte su muhūrtake

adorned with a white sacred thread, born in a Śaiva Brahmin family,

analyzed: sthapatiḥ ca śuciḥ bhūtvā yajña sūtra pavitra dhṛt
translated: and the architect, having become pure, wearing the sacred thread and the purifier,

analyzed: prabhāte su muhūrte tu lakṣaṇa uddhāram ācaret

analyzed: liṃga mānena matimān sūtra vistāram ucyate

analyzed: rudra bhāga udayam grāhya śirasaḥ vartana anvitam
translated: One should take the rise of the Rudra portion along with the turning of the head.

analyzed: veda viṃśat śata aṃśam ca kṛtvā eka aṃśa aṃgulam stṛtam
translated: Having divided the twenty-one hundredths of the Veda, one part is one finger in length.

analyzed: tad aṃśam vasudhā bhajyam tat eka yava mucyate
translated: That part is divided by eight, and one of them is said to be one barley grain.

analyzed: uttama uttama liṃgānām sūtram
translated: The thread of the best of the best lingas is five barley grains long.

analyzed: śeṣāṇām api liṃgānām vardhayet na tu hrāsayet
translated: For the remaining lingas also, one should increase, not decrease.

analyzed: adhama traya liṃgānām sūtra tāram yavam bhavet
translated: For the three lowest lingas, the length of the thread should be one barley grain.

original: sūtravistāramevaṃ syād khātaṃ caiva tu tatsamam /
analyzed: sūtra vistāram evam syāt khātam ca eva tu tad samam
translated: Thus should be the length of the thread, and the excavation should be of the same size.

analyzed: lakṣaṇam śirasi vyādhiḥ lalāṭe maraṇam bhavet  /
translated: If the mark is on the head, there will be illness; if on the forehead, there will be death.

analyzed: netra sūtre tu apasmāram āsye ca anna vināśanam
translated: In the eye-thread, epilepsy, and in the mouth, destruction of food.

analyzed: cibuke bandhu nāśam syāt karṇe skandha vināśanam

analyzed: stana deśe sutam hanti tasmāt deśāt vivarjayet
translated: In the breast region, it kills the son, therefore one should avoid that place.

analyzed: śirasā saha rudra aṃśam guṇa bhāga vibhājite
translated: In the head, along with the Rudra portion, divided by the quality parts.

analyzed: eka aṃśam ūrdhvake   sthānāt ūrdhva tad aṃśake
translated: One part is above the upper place, above that part.

analyzed: tad adhastha aṃśake vipra lakṣaṇa uddhāram ācaret
translated: In the lower part below that, O Brahmin, one should extract the characteristics.

analyzed: padmasya mukula ākāram yathāyukti yathā ākṛtiḥ
translated: The shape of the lotus bud, according to the principles and the form,

original: dvijānāmabhivṛddhyarthaṃ nṛpāṇāṃ ca jayāvaham // //🔽khaḍgau pratyānvitākāraṃ kuñjarākṣamivākṛtiḥ /🔽śaṃkhaṃ cāṃkuśayorbhedānnṛpāṇāmabhivṛddhaye // //
analyzed: dvijānām abhivṛddhi artham nṛpāṇām ca jaya āvaham  khaḍgau pratyānvita ākāram kuñjara akṣam iva ākṛtiḥ  śaṃkham ca aṃkuśayoḥ bhedāt nṛpāṇām abhivṛddhaye
translated: For the prosperity of the twice-born and for the victory of kings.🔽The sword has a shape like a hooked goad, the shape of an elephant's eye,🔽The difference between the conch and the goad, for the prosperity of kings.

original: karāñjali samākāraṃ gokarṇākṛti vartulam /🔽vaiśyānāṃ tattrikoṇaṃ ca śūlavṛttāyataṃ tathā // //
analyzed: kara añjali sama ākāram go karṇa ākṛti vartulam  vaiśyānām tat trikoṇam ca śūla vṛtta āyatam tathā
translated: The shape of the folded hands, the circular shape of the cow's ear,🔽For the Vaishyas, that is triangular, and the trident is elongated.

original: śūdrasya vṛddhikaraṃ trīṇi vaiśyānāṃ tasya lakṣaṇam /
analyzed: śūdrasya vṛddhikaram trīṇi vaiśyānām tasya lakṣaṇam
translated: The three for the Shudra, that is the characteristic of the Vaishyas.
The extracted part mentioned, divided by the Rudra portion.

analyzed: mukula udayam eka aṃśam tad vyāsam ca api tad samam
translated: The rising bud is one part, and its width is also the same.

analyzed: tad mūla nāla dīrgham tu nava bhāgam udāhṛtam
translated: The length of its root and stalk is said to be nine parts.

analyzed: tat nālam eka sūtram vā sūtra dvi tri yutam tu vā
translated: The stalk may be made of one thread, or with two or three threads.

analyzed: sūtra dvi tri yutam ced tu sūtra antaram yava trayam
translated: If it has two or three threads, the space between the threads should be three barley grains.

analyzed: yava dvaya antaram vā atha nāla tāram dvijottama
translated: Or the space between the threads should be two barley grains, O best of Brahmins, up to the tip of the stalk.

analyzed: nāla mūle ca tasya agre sīmā sūtram samālikhet
translated: At the base and tip of the stalk, the boundary thread should be drawn.

analyzed: tat nālam ca eka sūtram ced liṃga madhye viśeṣataḥ
translated: If the stalk is made of one thread, especially in the middle of the liṅga,

analyzed: vyāsakhātam ca nāla yāme tu kalpayet  /
translated: the depth of the hole should be as mentioned in the sūtras, and the length of the stalk should be determined.

original: nālādhastāttu vyomāṃśaṃ tyajya viṣṇuśiropari /🔽maṇirekhāṃ tataḥ kuryānmukulādāsphigantakam // //
analyzed: nāla adhastāt tu vyoma aṃśam tyajya viṣṇuśira upari
translated: Below the stalk, having abandoned one part for the sky, above the head of Viṣṇu,🔽then the maṇi line should be made from the bud up to the hip.

analyzed: maṇi rekhayoḥ ntaram padma mūle padma samam tu vā
translated: The space inside the maṇi line at the base of the lotus should be equal to the lotus,

analyzed: tridhā ekam vā veda aṃśa igni aṃśam eva vā
translated: or one-third of the lotus, or one-fourth of the lotus, or one-fourth of the lotus.

analyzed: paṃca aṃśe tu yuga aṃśe vā padma tārā ardham eva vā
translated: In five parts, or four parts, or half of the lotus,

analyzed: mukula mūla intaram hi evam nāla mūla intaram śṛṇu
translated: thus the space at the base of the bud, now listen to the space at the base of the stalk.

analyzed: nāla āyāma samam vā ardham tri pādam vā yuga aṃśake
translated: Half the length of the stalk, or three-fourths, in four parts,

analyzed: tri bhāgam paṃca bhāge tu veda bhāgam atha upari
translated: In the five-part, the navel is three parts, and above that, the gem line is one part.

analyzed: nāla mūle same
translated: The space between the two gem lines is equal at the base of the navel.

analyzed: mūlāt agram kramāt kṣīṇam maṇirekhām tatas kuru
translated: From the base, gradually tapering, then make the gem line.

original: nālamūle same tiryak dvā pṛṣṭhe tu sabandhayet /🔽maṇirekhāvyāsakhātaṃ liṃgasyocitasūtravat // //
analyzed: nālamūle same tiryak dvā pṛṣṭhe tu sabandhayet  maṇi rekhā vyāsa khātam liṃgasya ucita sūtra vat
translated: At the base of the navel, horizontally, two should be fastened at the back.🔽The width of the gem line should be dug out, like the proper thread of the liṅga.

analyzed: tuṃga samā iva vā
translated: The length of the support of the gem line should be equal to the height.

analyzed: tasmāt tad mūla paryantam vasu bhāga vibhājite
translated: From that, up to its base, divided into eight parts,

analyzed: maṇirekhā ālambanam vipra navadhā parikīrtitam
translated: The support of the gem line is declared to be of nine types.

analyzed: sarveṣu lakṣaṇa uddhāreṣu evam vai maṇirekhake
translated: Thus, in all the extractions of characteristics, in the gem line,
